FmCdBbBSLvr93SkZwSeZcw.text: A solid sandwich experience. I love cheesesteaks, and you just can't get the real thing unless you go to a place that only makes cheesesteaks. This place looked kinda greasy and worn down, which actually made me want to try them out. Got mine "whiz with".....it was too cold to sit in the outdoor seating so I ate in the car....I almost made a mess, which is how these sandwiches should be.....it was very tasty, high meat to bread ratio. I'll be back if I'm ever craving a cheesesteak, probably wouldn't make it a destination on its own.

G-1oFG7DKSlhJ8_zDDLszQ.text: This place is freakin' great! I made mine a chicken philly and my hubby had a classic steak philly with provolone, bell pepper and mushrooms. The classic Philly is a 32 on the menu. The sandwiches were so good. Both the sandwiches were freshly prepared and tasted great because the chicken was thinly sliced.   Next time I'm going to ask for extra cheese though. One slice isn't enough for all the delicious meat. Also the sandwich is amazing with onions, so be sure to request them with your sandwich!  Also I loved the fried okra! I would have never thought of dippin okra in ranch, but it was the perfect accompaniment.  Lastly, and most importantly, the grill master Steve was sooo nice and personable!   The only draw back and thus the 4/5 was the price. 11 dollars for a sandwich is pricey!  This place has great food and service; I NEED one in Los Angeles.

_TEf-1v9mdLajznr5T5-3g.text: Every time we grab a bite to eat here we are nothing but satisfied. The ingredients taste fresh, and the food is always made to order. The premise is clean, the staff is friendly, and the food is great! Would recommend to everyone! The #3 with extra cheese is our favorite!

of-VtCtcYCAGrO9Ow4TM2g.text: The ONLY place for REAL Philly cheese steaks in Vegas. I've been to Philly many times so I know the comparison. This place is open 24 hours. Fantastic hoagies and sides as well. Love this spot.

me5Xb4d-iQ8blo_6RnmTfQ.text: The only authentic philly cheesesteak place in Vegas, simply because they have CheezWiz. Although the taste is sketchy sometimes, it's worth going out of your way for... and since it's DEAD CENTER WEST it's not really close to anything.  I think it's be awesome (and cheaper) for them to use nacho cheese instead of cheez wiz. It's probably taste better too since it has a kick.  Big Sloppy sandwiches just like I like them!

zQTiiswY4csctapYav6MUQ.text: This place used to be the BOMB!!!! Went there about 7 last night for philly and fries. Must be NEW OWNERS!!! Wasn't good like it used to be. And we used to get fresh cut fries. They are frozen fries now ad hardly any cheese on philly . Not a good experience and will not return!!!!!

mC_lpU600KnEXYAbUmm10g.text: This place is amazing their food is bomb I always get the cheese whiz with extra mushrooms and boy oh boy it's so damn goooddddd if your philly lover you'll love this place!!

MJyQ8P2wO25PZRuX9_kgVg.text: I came here expecting a hot and delicious Philly steak and received a chewy cold bread and cheese disaster.   Cold cheese whiz. Nasty food and service.  and very over-priced!!!

bjBGqAXsoYJ5VEhSd0DoWw.text: Need a cheesesteak at 4 in the morning? This is the place for you. Another review brought to you by Groupon.   I've been meaning to try this place for years. Having passed by it from time to time I always think to myself, why haven't I been there yet. Well, I have seen and I have conquered. All I can say is I can't believe it took me so long.   The atmosphere is pretty cool and they are QUICK with the orders. We waited no longer than five minutes for our entire order to be ready after paying. Even better, they cook it fresh.  This place offer a great dining experience. I had the cheesesteak with mushrooms and whiz, my fella tried the cheesesteak with bacon and swiss. These sandwiches are no joke. Large and in charge. I could barely finish half of a half after also ordering some battered mushrooms and cheez whiz fries. We could definitely have shared one sandwich between the two of us.  I found the sides to be fantastic. I tend to judge a place by it's sides and this place did it for me. They were greasy and delicious, even after a long car ride home.   I'll definitely be back to try some more of their heart attack inducing menu items.

V6SmzjQctroCHEH1jfhs1A.text: Well I went back there a few weeks ago and tried their breakfast Philly. It was awesome!  I believe it is the cook who makes it wort overpaying for a philly. The cook- it was a young man who works am on the weekends mostly- that mead this experience worth its weight in gold.

tsLqLEpbcvX7tW406kevuA.text: Standing in line as I write this.  It's 2:43 am and no one is really here.  The cook sucks because he takes an order, cooks it and waits til the order is done to take the next.  Been in line for 30 minutes at least.  The food the first time was okay, philly cheese with Swiss.  A little too greasy for me.  Getting the jalapeno poppers just because I have a craving and the pastrami and Swiss this time.  Don't expect it to meet my expectations but both Taco Bell and McDonald's were closed by 2:00am.  Not as good as advertised, plus this part of town is super trashy and ghetto!

PANMkf4PAfOkLU5UX_OkmA.text: Great Philly's and sandwiches. Ever since it changed over names, possible ownership, it seems to take quite a while to get an order in and the sandwich out if there is at all a crowd, 5 - 6 in line, give yourself a good 30 minutes to order and get your food. Service always seems good.

PdZB261JzwcuXGbo_Ub6zg.text: This place is so F'ing good. Not just good F'ING GOOD. Philly cheese steaks never ever disappoint. Always hot and fresh ingredients. And the green bean fries WOW. KEEP UP THE OUTSTANDING WORK POPS !!!!

sKjL3YetI-vcbaPKO61udQ.text: In town for a capoeira event. After the festivities we went to this weird food court and we really packed the place but for some reason I got a flash of us waiting in line FOREVER.  Our Mestre rented all of us out of towners a place nearby here and when running errands we spotted this place. It reminds me of a 50s carhop. They're menu is pretty big. I settled on the cheesesteak with cheez-whiz, mushrooms and onions and an order of fried okra.  The service was really quick and the sandwich was HUGE, and they were definitely generous with the fried okra. As soon as they placed it in my grubby little hands one half of the sandwich didn't even make it to my table. I'm prided on an Asian mouth and I was reading some reviews about it being too hot. Some may call it hot and mouth burning, I call it fresh.  And after we all ate our sandwiches, we were the first ones back to the house to shower and even after that, people were still waiting for their food at the other food court!

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried okra
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #6

_jjYn2QETmxnTeQ9k_drLA.text: Stopped in for a bite. I've never been to Philly so I really have no clue what an authentic cheesesteak tastes like, I only know what I like. I was a big fan of Philly SteakOut at Trop/Ft Apache. I was terribly sad when it closed shop.   Anyway, I ordered the cheesesteak with provolone and grilled onions. The bread was really good, the meat was pretty good, but overall it made me remember how much I miss that same sandwich from SteakOut. Since it is closed, Pop's will have to do. Don't get me wrong, it was the most tasty philly I've had in a long while. The cheese fries were real good. The husband is partial to the three cheese chili cheese.

Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. three cheese chili cheese

02QAv0-d879W6aRBcWvLEg.text: they might as well call them Pops CheeseSteaks or Vegas CheeseSteaks because they do it right! I have been to Philly but you have been replaced!

szIcrTL5vZPbd-VG5uwV2A.text: A bunch of us stopped by here for lunch on a work day and I wasn't disappointed.  We went on their website and printed a coupon and figured we'd try it out. Now I've been to all the top Philly joints in Philadelphia and I don't keep my expectations that high here in vegas - BUT I had high hopes for this place and it was just alright.   I thought with the way everything was priced ( a tad high ) that the outcome would be great, but it really didn't wow me. I had fried okra as my side and it was pretty greasy - nothing spectacular.  I wouldn't go out of my way to stop by here again, but it's worth giving a shot.

FuzL8CQU_B3HsXaNsEPDNQ.text: I love cheesesteaks and I really wanted to like this place. Cheesesteaks 24x7 on the West coast?!? What's not to like about that? Unfortunately, my dream was shattered. Pop's has all of the ingredients, but fails to deliver. I ordered my steak wiz wit -- frizzled beef, cheez whiz, and onions on an Amoroso roll. It's usually a recipe for success; not at Pop's. For starters, the cheez whiz was room temperature...yuck. The beef was bland and not well seasoned.  I ate half of my sandwich and simply could not find the wherewithal to finish it. To date, I have never failed to finish a cheesesteak. I guess there's a first time for everything. To add insult to injury, I had way too many impromptu visits to the porcelain thrown after my visit, I won't be back.  If you insist on eating here, get it to go. The outdoor covered seating was fly ridden. It's hard to eat your steak in one hand and swat fly's with the other.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. wiz wit

yQGJbQh59WnGTTs7UvOvHg.text: Nothing impressed me and pricey. Had a hoagie that lacked flavor/seasoning/salt, for dessert, had the Oreo churro that was seriously obscenely coated with sugar that was about $4 for ONE piece.

InXUOKrUGTwyvTOn6v7zjQ.text: I've been in Vegas for over 5 years now, and I've never tried Pop's before.  I've meant to, especially since it's open late (24 hours?) and I'm always up at weird hours.  But I just hadn't had the chance.  Last night, I wanted something quick and easy, so I headed over at 10ish.  I got a #2 and a #4... a whiz steak and a provolone steak.  Both were delicious, with the whiz steak (obviously) being the better of the two.  But it still just can't hold a candle to the cheesesteaks in Philly.  I don't know what it is, but it's just not the same.  That being said, I'd assume Pop's is probably the best cheesesteak in Vegas, so I'll probably be back at some point.

_yoAipidwvEpzYNmdoYw9g.text: Pop's is 'as good as it gets' when it comes to Philly cheesesteaks in Vegas. One of the main reasons I gave it 5 stars was because they use real whiz! It's underrated and great big portions for a reasonable price. The closest thing to a REAL Philly Cheesesteak that I've tasted in Vegas.

3BTygR3GPncvVaV1-S_j4g.text: Philly steaks only come 2nd to bbq in terms of my favorite food. With that being said, this is one of my top 5 favorite places to eat when I'm home. Genuine cheesesteaks, which you can get with Whiz, provolone or American (go for the Whiz). They also have an awesome BBQ pork grinder with a great sauce. And its 24 hours, which is a HUGE plus.

Uye0DEPh5V4wAp4mYnlFBQ.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!!! Awesome cheesesteaks...probably the BEST in Vegas!

D3ZWCRqBYA5FUyUIBjv8LQ.text: If you have never been here you are missing out. Best cheese steak in town, whiz and provolone for me!! Best of all, it is 24 hours.

zCB9AlTt7ChpIRTijZkdJQ.text: The hogie was awesome! Huge & great price! Def going back!

CJm4qsfJIkPeKVxm6e3rVg.text: Maybe I was there at the wrong time. Maybe the cook had a bad night. Drove past this place so many times over the years and never stopped. The lack of flavor made me wish I had kept going. Had a #4 Philly w/ provolone and side of chili fries. It was all bland. Wish I could have had one of the great Philly's I read about in the other reviews but not so lucky.

fSqu34NCM2yGn2vAcWx94g.text: This is a "go-to-place"! You will find just the right food for your hunger. Tastee and lots of it!

AVGndyIYesViTHU4XjceEQ.text: I know I'm in the minority here, but I did not enjoy this cheesesteak at all.  I had a CrowdSavings or Groupon thingy for it and maybe it was the fact that I took it home with me and ate it, but the grease from the onions just made the sandwich a soggy mess.  The roll didn't even taste all the fresh at all.  Now I get to go through the rest of the day feeling like I have a bowling ball in my stomach.  I guess that's what I get for not eating greasy food all that often...  I'll pass, thank you.  Those who like it can keep on going, but I will go elsewhere.

AbS_YRTfgNOacgq2aN43eg.text: Bomb!! When you think, "cheese steak sandwich", then you picture one from here. Classic taste that is hard to find for some reason. Big portions. Don't take it for granted because its in your backyard. If this place was not here, you would miss it forever.

zKOH6lSeygm4qAGrWUqQrQ.text: When my family moved from Maine to Las Vegas we needed something filling and not out of a bag. We drove by and though what the heck let's try it. They are on the pricy side but it was well worth it. The sandwiches were flavorful and the staff were very friendly.

5y_reTJNeHdVaOzsWh6JFA.text: Not really a Philly steak sandwich fan ,but was intrigued by the building and the  reviews on yelp. We both had the Philly wit cheez whiz an mushrooms and onions. The meat is cooked and sitting in jus,  after u order cook puts meat on flat top w your toppings then put in bread they bring in from Philly . The meat is juicy and tasty, bread is soft and chewy. Liked the cheez whizz , onion and mushroom combination . The sandwich was extremely hot had to wait a couple mins to let it cool. We also ordered fries and fried okra. Fries and okra were made to order , the okra was the frozen stuff served with ranch, it was good not great same as the fries. I think I like capriottis cheese steaks a little better, but would come here because they serve fries :) and have more sides then just chips.   Our two phillys , fries and okra came out to $25, which is not cheap  , I'm glad I read the reviews on yelp , which said it was a little spendy, that's y we stopped by 7 eleven and bought a double big gulp for a couple bucks, saved a little there , I think I'll make it a quick tip . They also have hoagies  .  I will back to try the other menu items. I luv a sandwich shop that serves fries.

Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried okra w/ ranch

Y5_qlfCLg11SGtJLAbUPwg.text: We are from Philly and man o man, Pop's is the best we can find here in Vegas!  Too bad for the one location, though - if we could eat them every night we would!  Don't forget the Italian water ice!

s8rPV6ZvgZian9SgLjqN9g.text: Cheesesteaks are so fab here. Get the sweet potato fries with the sauce - oh!!!

Q12gImAxgJoaa0ii2UyKjA.text: Pop's is the best Philly cheesesteak in Las Vegas and would give Geno's and Pat's a run for their money. The #2 with onions is my standard as that is the traditional Philly. Meat, whiz, onions. No peppers, no mushrooms. Anyone that tells you otherwise is incorrect. Pop's is the bizness!

IumwqKievGNDz_f62cvwUg.text: Overall a pretty good cheesetake sandwich.  Though Capriottis is still my favorite.

n0nkY5nB_OLXBMVO5L9Cnw.text: The Best Philly Cheesesteak Sandwich I have ever had. The fried green beans were good too. The fries were a good compliment as well. I thank my friend for taking me and introducing me to this marvelous eatery.

W2DSgIfHZibgVdd5u36FRg.text: The best cheesesteaks outside of Philly......the meat, the rolls and the cheese are the best

RtYxaW5fjb_1-4uQ1P1yZw.text: My husband loves Philly Steak sandwiches and we are always looking for good places to eat. I read that Pop's had the best in Vegas so that was our next stop. We ordered ours Phillies with bell pepper and onion. My son ordered with Chili beans. Sounds weird but he love it! In fact, we all loved our Phillies. They had so many different kids of sides too. We'll definitely go back to try the other sandwiches. Oh almost forgot, they are open 24 hrs. Love that!!

KbVLACbA_Csnvo5DXbHnOw.text: I wanted like this place more than I did.  I got a cheese steak wit.  I got it with onions and peppers and had them throw in some peppercinis.  The meat lacked flavor and the so did the onions and peppers.  The only thing I could really taste was the cheez-wiz.  The sandwich is a good size and is filling.  The bread is good, pretty authentic.

WkOw4GI26h08Z2q91xVkUw.text: its a cheese steak. it tasted a little bland. i dont have that much of a craving for cheese steaks and when i do theres other places i can goto.

OsXQCGEcZlw_wmm2cqvLYw.text: The sandwiches are good but the price of a bottle or can soda is expensive. It costs $2.49 for a soda and I can get a 12 pack of Coke or Pepsi for another buck at Smith's or Albertsons.

Ir7gH5tyF2z_8ZVXjf5oIg.text: Love the cheese steaks here. On the last visit they messed up and gave part of our order to someone else... twice. Of course I wasn't happy. I must say they went out of the way to make it right!! Checked on us several times. Made a new sandwich so it wouldn't be cold.  Great tasting and really care. Well done guys! Thanks!!

rBdaMwOAlpC1YoCYFUCkOA.text: Omg! Absolutely love it. I had an original PHILLY CHEESESTEAK. It was delicious. Very cool place

qZFua9QlZiCdN5J-Sw9f_g.text: I've been coming here for years, but just now getting around to writing a review.  So I'm a West Coast guy, and while I've been to Philly and had a few "Originals", I'm hardly an expert on what would be considered a Classic, or Real Philly. I do, however, know what I love, and Pop's is it. I've had Cheesesteaks in so many states, plus a few countries, and each and every time, I can honestly say, "Wish it was Pop's." Seriously, it was this place and Carl's Jr. that I was always fiending for in the sandbox.  Personally, I get the Steak, Provolone, Onions and Mushrooms, plus Sweet and Hot peppers.  The fried green beans are kickass. Their sodas are imports as well as their desserts, Tasty Kake brand. The Black Cherry soda is perfect, but unfortunately expensive because they get it from (I'm assuming) Philly. Tasty Kake Butterscotch is my favorite, although some will probably just compare it to normal packaged bakery stuff, it seems higher quality to me. It's all still packaged sugary baked goods though.  This place is also open 24/7. These poor sods are there to provide losers like myself a Philly on Christmas or Thanksgiving at any time of the night.  If you don't carry cash and want to tip, you have to tell them before they run your card because they can't add anything once you've signed. Has to be done where they add it to your total. Some weird system, I dunno.  The seating is outdoors only, and for some reason the corner there is a vortex of whirlwind. Seriously though... it can be hot as heck outside and you go stand there on the corner at Pop's and the wind is blowing 70 MPH and all of a sudden you're freezing. It's really strange.   The seats are not comfortable, but then, you didn't go to Pop's to sit on the corner of a busy intersection and suck exhaust while eating fried everything with extra cheese Whiz and ranch because of the padding in the chairs. Most likely you're providing the padding yourself.  Parking sucks, I think they offer a grand total of maybe 9 spaces, at an angle, and if you can get out the one way drive through portion of the oddly built building, then you're pretty much stuck heading east on Alta. Turning around when the lot is empty isn't tough, but when it's packed it can be challenging if you're not a great driver. I seriously feel the need to specify the great driver part because we are in Vegas and I drive around town for a living, and Vegas drivers suck in general compared to most other places.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TUfatfcv-qM_e4h6K41EXg.text: Looking for food at 2 am ...  3 am...  4 am....  head to Pops.  A great food stand in Vegas for a philadelphia cheese stake anytime of the day (24 hours).  Cheap place to eat and well worth the money and drive.  I had the steak with cheese wiz and onion rings.  Both items were great and I would go back again for more in the future.  Enjoy your adventure to Pop's!

dg59T9ReAQgJGmTlC5ovjA.text: Went to eat here the first time in December. It was delicious. The coworkers and I decided to go back this week. I tried the pastrami sandwich it was amazing. I had an order of sweet potato fries and the girls got jalapeno poppers and I liked them. I will definitely come back soon.

wA8hy_7kIdXGyzsHmBC0yw.text: I really loved my #9, philly with bacon and swiss. Every inch of it was so delicious and the flavor combination was genius. Bacon popping in and out of each bite, swiss cheese goey and tangy blended perfectly with the tender flavor packed beef. Let's not forget the pillow soft roll all this magnificent meat and cheese sat in. Indescribable sandwich. I just love the Trueness of it all. Kudos Pop's for making every taste bud in my mouth a happy camper. My husband had the #32 and it usually takes a lot to fill him up, the 32 did the trick. He said it's like out of this world good. We recently moved here and we are definitely going to be loyal Pop's customers.

_3B3WiA0KBpjj8RmkJFouQ.text: It was my birthday weekend and I was craving a cheese steak. I've never been to Philly but my friend said go to Pop's, it's as close to it as you can get. I showed up and I love the look. It is open 24 hours and has out door seating with a covering and ceiling fans to keep air circulating. I got me a classic steak, Swiss cheese, mushroom, and bell pepper sandwich.  Bread was so soft how I like and beef made my mouth water more. Fresh mushroom and bell pepper all combined well. Also had chili cheese fries. It was a thin chili and fries were cooked the right amount of crispness. They were tasty but messy. Extra napkins are a must. I've never been to Philly but I'll be back to Pop's that's for sure. You never know who you'll run into. One guy was from San Diego and another from Philly. We all were craving a cheese steak.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yeah,I had a fork. How can you blame a guy? I&#39;m not letting any delicious food escape me. Beef, Swiss, mushroom, bell pepper, soft hoagie.

m9tYxaVuONhZOR-Xt5owzQ.text: Been to Gene and Pats in South Philly. Had the American Cheese Steak with everything on it. Great bread and steak. Fast service.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

N89QUYXhFECtkowtbF_J_Q.text: I'm no expert in Philly cheese steaks, but I do know what I like, and I liked this. The building's exterior has been catching my eye for a while now, so on a recent trip back from the west side, I popped by for a late lunch.  There wasn't much of a line, but soon enough one formed behind us. The ordering system confused the folks in front of me (despite the big sign that says "ORDER HERE" they were at the wrong window and looked upset when I pointed it out to them), but we got our orders in regardless.  The Cheez Whiz steak was awesome, and I also had half a #32. Both were delicious. Service was pretty prompt, and overall I liked the vibe. It's outdoor seating, nothing too fancy, but really good food.

gmAkrctTwolqBdLBvOugOg.text: Pop's is fantastic! That sums up every experience I have here and what I have heard from everyone I know.  I LOVE this joint.    Ok, you probably want more info on it, so here you go:  1. These cheesesteaks are big and tasty.  They are stuffed full of meat and toppings on soft, flaky bread. I've tried a couple and have loved them all.  My faves are the 3 cheese steak and the Mushroom and cheese steak.  Delish!  2. Choices on top of choices! Steak or chicken, then 3 types of cheese, add in all sorts of veggies, and you have a lot of variety. You never get tired of the menu.   3. They have Tastykakes!  4. Lots of tasty sides like Cheez Whiz fries, Fried green beans, chips, etc.  Gotta love the sides.  5. The grill man.  I've been lots of times and it always seems the same guy is working. He is super friendly and knows how to cook.  He's just cool and deserves his own line.   Pop's has been on this corner for as long as I remember.  The food is consistently good, the staff is friendly, and you will always leave with a full belly.  What could be better than that?!?!

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 cheese cheesesteak.
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom and cheese cheesesteak.
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ha ha, how can you not throw a buck in this tip jar?!

aKAO0V7ZmK_jSS2285enyw.text: I've lived in Vegas for about a year, and every time I passed this place the line is a mile long so I figured food must be good!... and I gotta to stop sometime. I finally get to stop and have never been so disappointed. Waited forever to order as the cooks were changing positions....no big deal....i order, which is just shouting at the cook through the screen (poor guys) and I ordered 4 sandwiches.....move over to pay....not any better, everyone just seems so confused so I pay what she asks.....waiting and I finally get 2 sandwiches.....not what I ordered. It's hot and I'm tired and had high expectations of a place I didn't know, my bad I guess. You guys need a better system, there's a reason I've never heard of this place aside from driving by it all the time. And the lines that long because you guys have no clue what's going on. So sad

l0qGD8krmf90Yxb4651qWA.text: I don't remember when I bookmarked this place but I'm glad I did! After a drunken night with my friends on the strip, we decided to go all the way here afterwards. This place is away from the strip but its 24 hours and it was def worth it. I ordered the mushroom cheese steak and it was amazing! I'm not sure if it was because I was really drunk and hungry but my friends really enjoyed it as well. My friends and I are not from Vegas so our uber driver was surprised we went out of our way to go here and I'm surprised not more people know about this place! I would def come back when I go back to Vegas!

SHJS0ZP8JugLeqv1364JCg.text: One of worst cheesesteaks ever and I work for airlines travel extensively . If you like grease then this is the place for you .

dlCW8yG6OnMDnqP2FycbPA.text: Good food, generous portion, and clean. We ordered the Philly with peppers,  mushrooms,  onions and cheese. Very tender, lean, juicy meat. Very tasty, great soft bread.   4 stars not 5 because of very bad fries and they charge extra for every little thing (sauce, jalapenos)

ljKoMjv-__XXAtrXvF-XUw.text: Pops cheesesteaks seemed promising on arrival, but upon ordering their staff seemed unsure of how to process my order. Being from philly I ordered exactly how I would back home, but the cook taking orders seemed confused.  The cheesesteak came out with larger pieces of steak and wasn't chopped finely like a True Philly cheesesteak. The meat was not seasoned and was pretty bland. The only good thing was the cheese Fries. I will not be returning to this establishment.

u-0ckvlvvhpbrreHDeUknA.text: omg! i love coming to get my philly sandwiches in the night time. the cook  is so friendly, courteous, and he knows exactly what kind of philly i'm getting. they have great customer service. but, i recommend no one to go in the day time. i don't know this guy's schedule. but, i went last week on friday 26th at 2pm. the cook lacked of customer service, no personality and a bit racist. my philly was very skinny. i didn't even enjoy eating it. the guy is a tall coacasian. so please if you want a delicious philly go at night. go after 10pm. if you want a nasty go to mcdonald's or burger king or jack in the box

It's been 2 weeks and I hope he's still waiting on his wings ya after church on a Sunday tourist buster ass trick, go to bdubs next time, get outta my way I want a cheese steak. And his ho ordered a salad. Get wrecked ho!!!!

9qV073ytesgUYrUdhvFf-A.text: This vegas trip,we decided to give POPS PHILLY  CHEESSTEAKS a try,we were kind of dissapointed,ours were pretty greasy,and not nearly enough cheese on them,this is an outside seating only establishment,we could only compare them to cheesteaks we have had in Philadelphia,it was an OK cheesesteak,thats about it,we did not want to go back,we thought it was really nothing special...

XLqoE3vpA-p-FDiLE1AJ_Q.text: Great customer service! Even better food!   The guy making our sandwiches took great pride in making them. Hubby had a chili cheese philly #34 that he's sorry he had since it isn't that close to our home & he'll crave it often. I had a vegetarian hoagie. Amazing!!! Fries were cooked to perfection... Staff asked how our sandwiches were when we were done. Love it!

MZB8GOGI3wAuXOXqnKmjkg.text: Yum-skiddley-umptious!  We ordered to go because it was too hot to sit in their outdoor seating.  Ate in the car.  The philly cheese steaks were great, cooked fresh, bread and meat all very tastey.  But the sweet potatoe fries were soggy and mostly just batter (might be the way they wrapped a paper around it, and steam was trapped).  Great for the phillys, not so much on the fries, and a downer for me to not have indoor air conditioned seating (we are in the desert people)

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OqZ-2IACJduKN133TPuTDg.text: The cheesesteaks are good, and this is from someone who has lived in South and West Philly. The reason for the three stars is for the set up and the ordering process. You have to yell your order at the grill person who is usually distracted by the previous order, nothing is written down so expect to repeat your order five times. They seem to get annoyed if you want your order a specific way (and I'm just talking about basic things like mayo, double cheese, steak cooked well, etc.). I told the guy American cheese five times and ended up with Swiss and provolone. I get the ordering directly to the grill person (common in philly) but either the guys can't hear well through the mesh and noise or they don't understand. I usually go when it's not busy. I've been more than 10 times because the steaks are good for Vegas, but the process is a pain.

GHVBhE1jypgDb2EgIsaLzA.text: One of my favorite late night spots! Service is always quick & friendly, and the food is always tasty. Try the fried okra! Paired with a #2 (Philly with Cheese Whiz), you can't go wrong.

oI6RG80RdLQERY20gkSoZw.text: After driving by this place many times, finally decided to stop and give it a taste. Glad we stopped...the menu offers many sandwiches and sides...ordered sandwich  #32 (philly with green bell pepper and mushrooms with provolone cheese) and sides of fried green beans and banana foster...what a treat! Excellent! If you like Philly cheesesteaks, stop at Pops! They're open 24/7!

6HaG3ELwA5jUnqCHtEK_1Q.text: In my opinion and my family's, this is the best place for cheese steak sandwiches!!! They have all kinds of other awesome things to try too! People are friendly and the outdoor seating seems relatively clean. Give it a try!

hK6crquL7bDjC6dLKR7UEg.text: I've been hearing for so long how great the cheesesteaks here are so I had to try it myself. I got the cheese whiz fries with a cheesesteak with onions,mushrooms, peppers and cheese whiz. The cheese whiz fries were so yummy the cheese steak eh it was ok. I was hoping to taste the best cheesesteak ever, but unfortunately it didn't happen tonight. The cheesesteak was good sized and it was filled up it just lacked flavor. The meat was bland and the hoagie was salty and stale. I'm not sure if it was fresh being as it took less than 5 mins for the guy to call my name. Anywho I'm saddened it wasn't an amazing cheese steak as I was really craving one, but hey at least I tried this place once.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesesteak with onions, peppers, mushrooms, and cheese whiz.

quNLDLxBpYTu4PhWAOR4TQ.text: Meh... Came here cause the awesome reviews... I thought the mozzarella sticks were bomb diggity! The fries were good.. But the philly cheese steak was Meh! Not bad but not great! It's a good sandwich but would I go back not likely.

lUWZKEMI9hjcU--lsTZdgA.text: I love Pop's! The cheese whiz is what I order with extra whiz and provolone (yep it is cheeeeeeezzzy) and onion. I am never disappointed.   I love that they have "wise" chips as well.  My husband can eat a whole sandwich and be satisfied I personally can only eat half then save the other half for later it is well worth the money. This last visit was nice because there was no line! Sometimes there is a line but it moves real quick.   I recommend it to anybody that loves cheese steaks and all who think they don't. It is on a old school original A-frame wiener schnitzel and if it is your first time you can drive through the middle of the "A" but don't think there is a drive-thru to order food it is simply a place to get you back on the road you must park in the lot and walk up to the window.  The "Mozzarella Sticks" and "Cheese Whiz Fries" are super yummy.  You can sign up for their e-club and get coupons and deals.  I have seen that they now have a food truck as well at a couple food truck events so give it a try!

FAOlcnMRfMy_eidtBTrlbg.text: Cheese whiz fries. Why? Who would even? Well, my significant other would, did, and enjoyed. I left that completely to him, though I did try a fry. I don't understand the allure of cheese whiz.   I also don't eat beef, which may compromise the legitimacy of my review for some people, but I'm pleased with requesting a sandwich with chicken, onions, mushrooms, provolone, and hot peppers. The bread that night was different. Not as smooth, but instead had a slight grainy feel on the outside. It was still warm and soft, but I prefer their typical loaf, which doesn't leave as much of a crumby mess.  Everything is made to order and hot. It's a good guilty meal. My only gripe is that I never want to eat there because the tables are dirty.

syZVwJrc6fV4UG6RdcW1Vw.text: Best cheesesteak I've ever had outside of philly. So many places all over the country make steak sandwiches and call them philly cheesesteaks and it's usually a disappointment. Not at pop's. Real philly cheesesteaks in vegas!

ZsnofodSMdGSwdakBKZiIw.text: Nothing like Philly Cheez Stake. Not even close. its fried tough beef on a bun. The beef was so bad after one bite........ the sandwich meet the trash can. What a waste of my money.  There is a sucker born every minute. I guess that's me.

3EFQfiy5WuwFX_kS5eevnQ.text: Uhm... maybe I am slightly judgmental because I have been to Philly. I remember going to Pop's a few years ago, and thinking it was amazing. That was pre-Philly and pre-Philly Steakout.  The Steak:  Pop's is okay. I ordered the traditional with the whiz and onion. It was fresh. The bread was soft, but it wasn't anything to write home about. You can honestly buy meat from the butcher near the Meadows mall, and recreate something just as tasty yourself.  The Italian "ice":  A total miss. I adore real Italian ice, which was my main reason for stopping by. This tasted like a masked popsicle. Such a disappointment!  I would go back if I was in the area, but I'm sticking to Straight from Philly Steakout.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Italian&#34; ice

pI9LQCgk5ga4XmozJDeYAA.text: Having been to Sonny's in Philadelphia which was a mind blowing perfect 10, I must say, I was surprised Pops was as good as it was. The chili cheese fries were some of the best I've ever had. Just wondering how consistent this place is. Can't wait to return to find out.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NRx5idwkUaiKdCgxSLnm1g.text: This place is amazing. I just submitted a recommendation to Diners, Drive-Ins & Dives. The Philly cheese steaks are the best you'll ever get. I recently read their website and have a new appreciation for their craft. The Amoroso bread is made in Philly, flash frozen and shipped within hours to PoP's. It's unique in many ways including the water used has a mineral content not found in Vegas and its baked at a lower altitude. It's delicious!  They take a ton of pride in their work and truly are the Pride of Philly.

9HTQ2pM7TAfw1jQ_ndcT9g.text: I've been coming to Pop's since before it was Pop's. Haven't been here in a couple years now. Was a little disappointed steak was no longer fresh but Frozen, made for a dry sandwich. Fries are still great people there extra friendly business seems good the lunch line was four or five people. Still a good sandwich just not the great one I remember comma but what is as good as it used to be really? Also got a free Tasty Cake for my birthday today!!

aJGsPM0eGzpO-AfHsihT4A.text: Every time I come here I'm never disappointed. Great Philly cheesesteaks great bread great prices great sweet potato fries great fried zucchini great everything man this is just a great place

UIaup5euyB86J4rZ6bRBYg.text: This place is amazing - the food always very good and the staff is always friendly- Never would look for a cheese steak elsewhere.

mRwR91vWGjBK1A2OMJLzOw.text: I had one of my favorite sandwiches last night... Steak with swiss cheese and bacon.. Fries with cheez whiz ... just wanted I wanted...

0A4Sjh0oW2uj7dxLx2xEdQ.text: Placed a order for wings french fries and fried green beans . Got on route to my destination while enjoying my fried green beans which were up to par , crispy as preferred . Get to the chicken which i had half hot n half regular both were nice n fresh but were a tad on the salty side . While trying to enjoy my wings i go in to enjoy my nice fresh potatoes when i find  Them to b  non existent in my bag . Very disappointing especially when i was CHARGED for something i did not receive not to mention who i believe to be the owner comes to the car and tells me my order is ready

qMp-uoe4M8dWApMOi0H7YA.text: Came here for some late night munchies. Had the cheese steak. Everything was already precooked, and the cook just took the meat out of the holding oil, placed it on the bun, toppings, then slapped it together and sent it out. LAME!! I know at 3 in the morning it can't be that busy where you can't make the ingredients to order.. Sigh..  BTW: came in here pretty hammered after going to the bar with some of the fellas from work. Wish I could remember more, but I couldn't :)))

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom and pepper cheesesteak at 4 am

WqYtNXrjnjsPj_XcLvXRkg.text: I would give five stars but my order was messed more than twice. Communication was lacking between the cashier, I think her name is Meghan, and I ended up waiting more than 20 minutes for my bbq wings. I mean they were delicious but cmon, coulda had a better attitude and had better communication with the rest of the crew

516Zcll-QGVpSVLW9sRLtQ.text: MY FIRST TIME!!! This was an awesome experience, I'm born and raised in Vegas and I've passed up this place a million times and i finally had my chance to eat here.  I must say it felt really good standing under the port and actually ordering from my usual street side view from traffic, I gave this place 3 stars the 1st negative was the pricing for 2 phillys some fries and chips came to $28 I was hungry so I wasn't tripping the 2nd was for $28 dollars the food tasted ok as my wife says "I could've made this for $20 and fed the whole family" (coming from a stay at home chef mom) I actually enjoyed my food it was a traditional cheesesteak sandwhich to me I ate the whole thing and was satisfied. The cook was really friendly and I enjoyed watching him cook it was a great 1st time experience if your ever in the area you should definitely stop by and check them out.   Ps. Make sure you have a lil money on you though these ain't Mccy dz prices!

4Gb-v4cfqNPBFbnTi9ITBQ.text: Love that it's open 24 hours. Plenty of meat and the bread was really good which Is the key to any sandwich. They were courteous and friendly. I'll be back. If your wondering if it's authentic as a philly steak I would say it's close. A simple change would be that the cheese to under the meat not on top. I know it's semantics but that's how they do it in philly which by the way is where I'm from.

EhHacjlgGpzfigbyiLyPTA.text: Very cool place, the service is super fast and the food is cooked fresh but if you plan on playing with your debit card you better have your ID handy or else I'll chase you down the street...Lol

mTWYHm_LjtkM0loVfr8pNg.text: Was my first time here at pops, and I was not disappointed I love everything about it and I'm very picky lol

gE7v8cGK5q5K0TrMhyl8aA.text: I have driven by Pop's many, many times and always wanted to stop and give it a go.  I had a program at the Nevada State Museum and after doing a quick check of my bookmarks, this is where I stopped.  Ordering is through a screen on the left side, pay on the right side window, and pick up there also.  I ordered the #32, a cheesesteak with peppers and mushrooms.  The cook asks if you want onions and I got them, too.  I also ordered some fries and a diet Coke.  All seating is on the patio.  Keep that in mind when it's in the cold months or in the middle of summer when it's 100 degrees at 9 PM.  My sandwich was tasty and it was OK.  I should have ordered extra cheese because that was the only thing I found lacking.  When I make cheesesteaks at home, I always load up on the cheese.  The roll was great.  Very fresh.  The fries were pretty standard.  I did notice that they have other foods they deep fry including Oreo pieces for deep frying.  I might need to stop here for a dessert some evening before it gets to be the hot days of summer.  The parking lot is small.  The staff was very pleasant.

Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just cut the cheesesteak in two.

-scRvlCXp7jXde7qT9SNZA.text: TRUE AUTHENTIC PHILLY CHEESESTEAKS!  Hoagie was PACKED with tender grilled steak topped with gooey cheese, grilled onions and fresh vegetables of your choice.  A TASTY EXPERIENCE you won't forget.  I highly recommend you go

4SmJlw4DTyegh9i_iGC4IA.text: So since I'm from the east coast I was told to try this place. CHALLENGE ACCEPTED!  Place is small but quite busy. They seem to be able to handle it with no problem. Cashier was friendly and so were the cooks. The cooks also take your order to help speed it up which helps.  So since I'm from the East coast all Phillys come with CHEESE WIZ. I was beyond excited to finally try a place in vegas with Cheese Whiz. I ordered fries and a philly with onions and peppers and I specifically said CHEESE WHIZ, because I was so excited.  Going off the trust system I didn't watch them make it and told them to go even though I was eating it there. I get to my table and my sandwich has PROVOLONE :( :( :( :( I asked for cheese whiz. My partner saw I was upset and asked me if I wanted him to go get it fixed. Since I work in restaurants I never complain and just take it. Plus the line was long again and knew it would take forever honestly and I waited long enough for this one in the first place. I was excited for my partner to try it too.  I only want to go back because I want to actually have what I ordered. Next time write down the orders. This could have been avoided if you had tickets to go off of and not memory. Remember that. I gave this place a three star because the staff was friendly and they handled their own. It wasn't super fast, they just kept up.

08VororU23idnFHbz0428g.text: Amazing food! Been going here for years since high school definitely a place to check out while your in vegas!

3g36nq6YOAjrLveEYvRfsQ.text: I used to live in Philly and this is a taste of home. Worth checking out. Cheese steaks worth of saying they are from philly

V0pqU9_TGn4xBakyMmoeWA.text: As a former regular to Tony Luke's and D'Allesandros in Philly I was pleasantly surprised.  Good steaks and bread, lines were a bit long but worth the wait...

8-v1162eJr6OhzCIgZAp9Q.text: These are some serious cheesesteaks! There's so many options and that includes sides and sweets! It's good to know what you want because they can get a bit fussy if you order wrong and there's a line behind you. The banana fosters bites are a must try! They have great fried everything and don't let cheese whiz scare you away because it's reeeeeeally good on their cheesesteaks and fries!

ojTCv9rx_z1PMfT_umo49g.text: If you like comfort food you must go to Pops for  their Philly Cheese Steak sandwiches. They are awesome. The sandwich is large enough to be share with someone. I went with a friend that order the fish sandwich and they loved it. The only drawback for some people is that there is only outside seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

d7aNnn07_1LeXWYuejo1rg.text: This is the best steak sub shoppe in town! I wish there was one closer to Henderson! Every time I'm up in this area of town, everyone gets one in my family! Their Philly Cheese Steak Sub with real Whiz Cheeze is absolutely mouth watering! Plus they have honey they give you with your sweet potato fries and now I can't eat my sweet potato fries without it! If you are visiting Vegas, you must have at least one meal from here!

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Get your free pick with Santa here!

HnMInAm0ZSfAljjt5Oc_Kw.text: This is now my most favorite fast food tavern in Vegas I've never really tried this type of food before but I went with my dad and I instantly fell in love he food is fresh and fast as well as it tastes great.

AtCsdbxNB89e5BF2M7oTHA.text: This is a unique place where you can actually see the person cooking your food. My only wish is for it to be a little closer to my home :). I ordered a cheese steak with onions, peppers and fries and it was delicious.   Once I placed my order it did not take long for the my order to be ready. They have a sitting area where you can watch the traffic pass by, but i would recommend to sit out on a nice warm day.  The fires were cooked to perfection and the cheese steak was also delicious. Next time I would ask for lettuce, tomatoes and mayo on it if they have it because I had to add this when I go home to top off my sandwich.

Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UGedJol9bIywVi9sN2UC8g.text: If I could give this 3.5 stars I would, but since I can't, I rounded up because the food quality and taste was solid and they are open 24 hours.   Food quality. It's not healthy food, but it's delicious fried and grilled food loaded with cheese. I haven't had a "True Philly cheesesteak," but I would say they make a good one. I had the chicken Philly cheesesteak with cheese whiz, and it was hot, gooey, and tasty. The bread was soft and fresh. I also tried their cheese whiz fries, which I would also recommend. They had tons of other fried choices to go with your sandwich. If you aren't looking for a Philly cheesesteak, or something fried, then this place can offer nothing to you.  The cooking area looked clean and sanitary, and the dining area was clean and picked up, with just a couple trash cans overflowing.   Service was quick and to the point, and I got my food pretty quickly. I was there at 10:30 pm on a Wednesday, and it was moderately busy.   It's all outdoor seating with slightly uncomfortable stools that are at a fixed height and length from the table as they are bolted into the ground. Each table has no more than four seats. They have a nice mural, and on a day with nice weather, it's delightful       Part of the lower score comes because the surrounding area isn't quite the safest. While in line, I heard three gunshots, and soon after the place was buzzing with over 10 police cars. They were driving around leading me to believe there was still a suspect at large. There was also a man asking people in line for money and getting pretty close. The employees firmly asked him to leave, and said he is a common problem. There is also a sign entering the dining area warning customers that the employees will defend themselves with guns. There were also some shady "transactions" happening in the parking lot area.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_XUsbpnGqb0dgz-CIYDv3g.text: I really LOVE this spot. It's the only place I go to get a Philly cheesesteak. I refuse to order one anywhere else. It's a little small and waiting outside sucks in the winter but there's nothing you can do about it. Around dinner time there is definitely a rush and the wait can easily be 20 minutes. Always get the ranch on the side, it makes it 10x better!

c21F7EkmbZZrLW6p-V8tUw.text: I have passed by this place several times and always think I should stop and get something to eat.  Unfortunately, it is never when I have time to stop.  However, I decided to make the trip.  I am so glad that I did.  The place is a walk up stand with out door seating.  I have only been in the winter time, and I am a wimp when it comes to cold weather, so I have only gotten it to go.    The service is fast.  The ordering system is efficient.  The cashier is fast and efficient.  The menu is limited, but what they do, they do well!  I have now been several times.  The sandwiches have been consistently great.  They are flavorful, slightly greasy (in a good way) and definitely sloppy (which is the fun way to eat).  I have had both the chicken and the beef cheese steaks and both have been absolutely delicious.  The bread is soft and absorbs the juice and grease.    There are two things I do not do at restaurants - wait more than 15 minutes for a table or make a special trip for a fast food restaurant.  However, for the food from this place, I will definitely make the trip, no matter how inconveniently located.  You should note that if you are going to use a credit card, they pass along a credit card fee to you.  Also, don't stick to just the sammiches.  The fried mushroom appetizers are delicious.  But if you don't let them cool for a few minutes, you are totally going to burn the roof of your mouth.

ub87gSsWaPRP5VCy2Ze4zg.text: I came here for the first time tonight with my wife to pick up some Philly cheesesteaks.im from California so the cheesesteak I had is far from the real deal LOL I got the wiz cheese Philly cheesesteak an OMG.i got a feeling I'm going to put on some extra pounds because of this place.LOL.GOOD ASS FOOD!!!my favorite food for sure out here now

z8MG4r_munU61xN-_eSbLw.text: Best cheesesteaks in the area???   I hope not!  Absolute garbage.  When the roll is the best thing on your cheesesteak -- Houston, we have a problem!  The meat quality is so substandard ... Its chewy, salty, and would never fly in Philadelphia.  Dont waste your money here, try anywhere else.  The meat and saltiness of their philly with onions and wiz was foul!  Sandwich tossed after two bites (the first bite was wtf?... The second bite was 'i cant eat this shit)...  I warned you

73mqvUTQ_0YbJvkxGPcFTg.text: Number one philly cheese steaks in Vegas. Every day lunch spot when I used to work on this side of town.  Shoutout to the cooks here working the grill!

hb3D5vlil37Ys1t9W-Lttw.text: Meh... it certainly it not BOO's Philly Cheesesteaks in Los Angeles, but I guess if you want something this does fine... I'm picky about flavor and their cheesesteaks lacked flavor, it was it's just too salty. Star snatched. Salt doesn't equate flavor. The meat tasted like "steakums" not fresh to me. Fresh meat has a texture to it that is tender and you don't have the chomp down on a cheesesteak... it should practically melt in your mouth, regardless of the toppings selected. Star snatched. I ordered the mushroom steak and asked for bell peppers as well... get home they aren't even in the sandwich- and no they weren't busy enough to excuse it. Star snatched. On top of all of that...The provolone cheese wasn't even melted... everything was "extra" and I've never been anywhere that charges "Per topping" it's usually whatever steak-combination you choose and you can say if you do or do not want grilled onions and/or bell peppers... not that it is an extra charge unless you actually want EXTRA. no grilled onions just a sad excuse for a Philly cheesesteak IMHO, but alas this is Vegas. My search for a cheesesteak home out here continues. The primary plus is it's open 24/7... but the only people who care about that is those who believe this to be good. Won't be back.   3/3/2017 Soooo the owner wants to reply about using fresh ingredients but what I got was clearly not fresh- nor was it good. No comment on my missing items though... interesting. Give you all another try? Not unless it's free seeings that I didn't get what I actually did pay for on my first visit- but even then, I'll pass. Sorry- the food just wasn't good.

fubodDMF5ff4lCvyLDGWCA.text: I like that this place is open 24 hours. I get a craving not in your normal business hours. Wide variety of items. You can't go wrong with anything you choose.  Limited parking spaces, but the service is next to none. You're in and out in no time. The food is fast, but it doesn't taste like it. Reasonable prices and good quality food. The great thing is, the food keeps for leftovers too.  When I'm in Vegas? This is one of the must have places to stop.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Limited parking spaces, but the service is fast. There will be a spot opening up soon.

6CafkX9cqVbHAB_Fna9AyQ.text: A review is overdue for sure I as I have been stopping by here a lot more often over the last few months. My sweet friend Sergio I noticed often has a very large appetite on the nights we hang out. Pop's is close to his house so it makes a stop very convenient late at night since they are always open.  The staff is friendly and they make good solid food so this review will be sweet and simple. I have had a variety of their cheesesteaks in the past and they have always been good with quality ingredients. I must say that I really enjoy their sweet potato fries that come with a yummy coconut dipping sauce. Their regular French fries are great as well and are fresh cut.  Service is great, food is great and they are open 24/7. My only tip to you is that this is not a place to come to if you are low on cash, you better save those coins for the dollar menu somewhere else if you are on a budget! lol  Take out is your best option as it is a free standing store with a few patio chairs and tables to sit at outside. It is on a busy street so it may not be as comfortable relaxing to eat with cars whizzing by plus the crazy wind.  Check Pop's Philly Steaks out!

fWZJ7sZ3_3ctTPnIVmqy8Q.text: Absolutely Delicious..  You know when you're full but can't stop eating cause its so good ... Lol #yesIhaveproblems. Hehe & those Banana frosters.. Yummy....

lULa9NNyjNuMbm6bDHNe3g.text: This place used to be good. The last time I went there it was average at best and expensive. If it's late and no where else is open then it will do. Otherwise look for other options.

O-hEPAP0q8bkEE3jTdRxAQ.text: I've been going to Pop's at least once a month, if not once a week, for over a decade. Best cheese steaks in Vegas, no questions asked! They also have Tasty Cakes too, which anyone from the east coast should know are as delicious as they are unhealthy haha. Open 24 hours and always has fast service and freshly prepared food made to order. I just wish Yelp had more stars to give this legendary walkup restaurant :)

4iJ6GaMfoHb0fawZ9Uz6UQ.text: I vaguely remember a mound... oops... mounds of meat... steak meat... my memory isn't quite well... something about cheese... three of them... provo? American?  Cheese wizard? I can't quite recall... sloppyness... I remember sloppyness... damn speellcheck all to h3ll! Please quit reading this revue... I think I'm steak and cheese wasted!!  On a serious tip... those who complain about the price are the same that have no problem paying $4.00 for McD's featured slop sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8CXMs43i2jk-SLBeJeVGJQ.text: This place is the coolest of the cool!!  If it has not been featured on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives from Food Network - Guy Fieri...get your ass over here!!!   Old Der Winerschnitzel building that has been here forever, nothing fancy for sure but boy oh boy if you are looking for a great cheese steak...hit this place up.  A must try are the chili cheese fries, good stuff!!    Don't be trying to diet when you go here and have a place close by to take a quick nap...large portions of delicious yumminess!!  Order at the window and seating outside only, no drive through or frills.  Truly a great 'dive'.  Pops is Tops in my book!!!

8QQ4zVG6Q4oeakR5ATsMJQ.text: OMG the philly cheesesteaks are out of this world. It was so good and fresh. I ordered the fresh mushroom with cheese whiz and it was perfect! Don't judge when you drive by until you give it a try. The menu is huge with all kinds of different hot sandwiches and amazing sides. Deep fried mushrooms were to die for!

tmLer12ZI_i0uFOQlWMPTQ.text: Even though I'm from South Philly I still go here from time to time and last night was one of those. I'm not sure why they choose the cook the steaks in so much oil but it ruins the whole thing. Too much oil and not enough whiz. I'm not kidding when I say it looked like I got a French dip and not a cheese steak. Maybe it should be a Chicago beef joint instead. Lol

g9wo47ieqC3k5GusfG8HcA.text: After our son's football game we were looking for a food place nearby to grab a quick bite so from the recommendations from my FB friends we decided to try it.. Not impressed.. nothing was fresh I don't care what they say..i suppose bc of the fast nature of the business maybe they precook the veggies. We ordered chicken Philly with provolone and Philly cheese steak with provolone..cheeze wiz is the most horribly processed ingredient and we couldn't bare the taste so we passed on this Philly tradition. We ordered okra as well which was frozen but I expected that.. the ranch dressing dipping sauce was from a powder that I didn't like.. the chicken and steak was that quick frozen thin sheet type of meat.. this was just not my type of place.. now I'm craving a east coast cheese steak.  ..$12 for each sandwich..a, waste of money

mRw6X8FlO0QkO1R6iR14NA.text: Convenient,  fast, super yummy!! Huge sandwiches and good prices. If you haven't been to pops...GO!

-4SGp27Xixv3GR60dVu_mg.text: I've always been a fan of Pop's Philly sandwiches, even though they are a little expensive. And while the now-defunct Triple Play was better (and cheaper), this is the place to go if you're craving a cheesesteak.  We ordered one provolone and one Cheez Whiz, both with onions. At $10 a pop (plus an extra $5 for fries and tip), this was a pricey lunch! But we don't eat there often (and no one should probably be making a cheesesteak part of their daily diet), so the splurge was worth it. Plenty of meat, nice chewy bread, and a healthy (or not) helping of cheese on each. The fries were kind of mushy, but they served their purpose. Next time we'll try the fried okra. (They also have fried mushrooms, sweet potato fries, and a few other sides that didn't appeal to me.)  If you take a trip to the A-frame building, know your protocol before stepping up to the window: Order on the left, watch the guy make your food, then pay on the right. There's a small outdoor dining area if you want to breathe in the smells of fried onions and exhaust fumes from passing cars. Otherwise, do what we do: Take your cheesesteaks home, where you can enjoy them with a nice cold beverage of your choosing.

0ta-Ishm93Fdlvw-6qZL6w.text: The "kiosk" has been there for as long as I lived in Vegas, under a different name; maybe that is why they are so popular. When it comes to sandwiches though, the bread is as essential as what is inside of it, and just like many other similar sandwich places, the bread is very average, if does not scream fresh, especially for a place that serves nothing but sandwiches. I am not saying it is not fresh, just that it is very plain with the same doughy substance as the bread you buy from your supermarket that has been sitting there for a couple of days with an expiration date on the bag. When a place serves sandwiches, it is imperative that the bread is amazing, after all it is the first thing that will enter your mouth and determines the substance of every bite and chew. They meats are good, but nothing that screams amazing; I think people are attracted to it because of the locale and the length of time it has been there, and it would be nice to compliment it with the best of everything; after all for what you pay, investing a few more pennies on good bread is a small price to pay in cost to give the customer a True value for what you would expect from such an old fixture in Vegas... I have not tried anything else on the menu, but with a place called "Philly Steaks", that is the only item on the menu you need to try....

551R1DLGy-9xW1sSEBavaw.text: Awesome cheesesteak! $15 feeds you for the day! Mushroom cheesesteak with Provolone is off the hook. Wasn't a fan of Fried Okra until I ate here. Really never disappoints. Tip the guys well. They Work Hard!

kN2sz7dVAXeV6WWh1NTGkA.text: This is another hole-in-the-wall place that locals love to frequent. I'll have to say, their cheese steaks were pretty solid. We ordered cheese steaks with cheese whiz and onions. The sandwich was very tasty and had a good meat to cheese to bread ratio. Slightly greasy, but in a good way. You may think that prices are a bit high for a sandwich, but their portions are very generous. When I lived in Las Vegas, my only gripe with this place was that it was kind of out of the way if I was craving a good cheese steak.

g2bf1cv546y_ayZLf9-ssQ.text: One of the best places in Vegas to grab a bite to eat. They only place I go for a Philly Cheese steak in Vegas. Like the city itself this place is open 24/7.   The last time I was here grabbed a Philly with pepper and onions, provolone and cheese wiz. The was so good it was worth the extra weight and the guilty feeling about not being True to the good ole diet. On the few occasions I have been lucky enough to eat here they do not disappoint. The only thing that puts this as a 4 instread of a 5 is the location. Though I have never had any issues here, I also don't feel it is the safest part of town. Since I am usally in and out of here I will risk it. Like I said nothing has ever happened(knock on wood).   If you are craving great eats anytime of the day I would stop into POP's. The Philly Cheese Steaks are awesome.

Qfd9W4Rofc5lEesGxWFwdg.text: This place has the most legit cheesesteak I have had in this time zone. Prices are a little on the high side, but still well worth it. I got mine with cheese wiz and onions with a side order of fried okra. The fried okra was fresh  and not soggy. I do wish the batter was homemade  and contained some spices but hey I'm from mississippi and gotta have a Lil creole when it comes to okra. The ranch dressing that came with the okra was AMAZING, in fact I would love that stuff on anything.  If your on this side of town go pick yourself up a cheesteak here. You won't regret it.

BPQgyUuJDwGN_dvP93x6dQ.text: Not the greatest. Not the worst. I've ate there once. The people that work there are alright. The food is good if you wanna just stuff yourself with some basic sandwiches. I'm from back east. And this is not necessarily authentic Philly style.... Maybe because of the bread. But, it's edible

7JIfN0ok2Aoo7uA82SrfXA.text: Was craving cheesesteaks ... Heard about pops ... Decided to try it out ... The line wasn't long kinda confusing were to order and watch people wanted to watch the cook and he couldn't take other people's orders ... Mind u he cooks and the lady serves u the food and drinks ..  I've been to philly lots of times love their cheesesteaks ... Pops was salty as heck ...

AsP1ppsa84sk-Qh3owbr0Q.text: Simply the absolute closest to a Pat's or Geno's Philly Cheesesteak you'll get in Las Vegas. Came out fantastic, and the bossman even told me when were good times to come by when it wasn't too busy, which I suspect he is a lot. If you think his prices are too high, they're not. His Cheesesteaks are worth every dime, and he uses fresh steak cuts.  I used to go to Philadelphia a lot, and I always grabbed one or two while there, I will go back again, and again!!!

MpoxgoCNZeL0QM0A3ENeWg.text: first of all throwing down Steakems on a grill isn't a cheese steak.  charging 11.99 is bullshit too.  I have had  pats, genos,  world famous out of Burbank and a ton of cheese steaks in new England.  the cheese steak at domingos isn't as good as this place's cheesesteak.  but if you have had a domingo cheesesteak that isn't saying anything.  POPS YOU SUCK.  really how much less would you make on your 12 dollar shitty sammich if you used real shaved beef not frozen industrial steakem meat and the proper amount of cheese?  a dollar less maybe 50 cents?   there is no way I would ever eat here again, so I guess getting 17 bucks out of me for fries a sandwhich and a dr pepeer was a good idea. and I guess if you really want cheese on your CHEESE STEAK  you better get the double order which would be the regular amount of cheese ANYWHERE ELSE THAT CLAIMED TO MAKE CHEESE STEAKS IN THE WORLD, WHICH THESE ARE NOT.  there are shitty imitation made with some steakem type material.  oh I said that already.  I can only imagine the lady who gave it 5 stars was paid for that review or is so used to having awful things in her mouth this seemed better than ...well you can fiqure out where I was going.  the fries were okay.  not worth an extra star though.  SHITTY AWFUL Expensive and disappointing.

rVJFsl_WDwBtHewWMUJAEg.text: First time here, Got the cheese whiz steak with peppers and onions- DELICIOUS! Will definitely frequent this spot, kind of shady at night though

vHPrlcOX_3SIB4-wopn0GQ.text: This place is soooo good! If you're looking for a late night place to pick up something meaty - look no further.  I loooove meat and this place packs it on. I can't say that it's the freshest food, but it's definitely greasy and delicious. This is not a place for people on a diet. Choose to come here if you're ready to get your grub on.

D-peQH5FBusx6DARX6IOLA.text: I had the classic philly with pepper jack cheese. the meat was really tender and seasoned well, the only reason I'm not giving this meal give stars is bc the bell peppers were really hard, they should have been a little softer like the onions. I asked for no mushrooms but I noticed my boyfriend eating his so they much have been good.  they waaaay over charge for fries by the way.

PwD29t-PtA8WxuvWGyryCw.text: I've dined there a couple times over the past year that I've lived in the Las Vegas area.   As a vegetarian, I basically get a massive, molten glob of several cheeses, grilled onions, lettuce & then add some ketchup or BBQ sauce (*if* I can find it there).     The reaction I get from other customers is always interesting as I tell the cook I'm a vegetarian, HOWEVER it turns out that one of the cooks that's there often is actually a vegetarian too, and note to some of you tough-guys: just because some of us vegetarians care enough about other animals to not eat them, it does not imply we don't mind fighting & hurting some dumb human who decides he needs to offer his opinion on vegetarians if he overhears our order.    The bread is very fresh, and of course it & the rest of the gooey, heart-attack-calling mess tastes great.    I used to get a side of fries, but they weren't anything special, and even 200+lb glutton me doesn't need to fries if I'm planning on eating the whole sandwich then & there.    I can & will continue to try other cheesesteak joints.   I know this will disgust some of you carnivores, but some cheese-steak places actually have a fake meat item (called seitan) that they'll use to create a vegetarian cheesesteak that looks and YES, once you add the cheeses, onions, sauces, etc. TASTES very similar to a real cheesesteak, so I am still looking for places that do that (Pop's doesn't).     However, the product I eat at Pop's is great, and another wonderful thing about it is that it's open 24/7.   It's shaded but otherwise outdoor seating, right along the race-track/circus show that is Decatur Blvd near Arizona Charlie's -- NOT a place to be for the faint of heart, so either get it to go & get the hell out of that area, or strap-up your gat & go sit there at 2AM & enjoy your food & the 'entertainment' the street & Pop's provide.

ikoW77YPvXvqJYfyjmziNg.text: Great place! It's an order window but looks huge on the outside as I expected to sit in. You can sit out on the large patio which made it great to bring my little dog. I only eat seafood so wanted the fish philly but they were out. We arrived just short of midnight. Decided on the tuna but there was only enough for one of us so me and the wife had to share. Ok so with all these hiccups why the 5 stars? I explained that I wanted my tuna sub like the philly sandwiches. They had never done it before and was very confused. Then out of nowhere I got the "what the heck" and he went for it. He made it just for me and I couldn't have been happier. It came out amazing!!!! Get there earlier if you want the less popular foods (seafood).

NApVLJ_AVpYcxtVutKzdBA.text: Philly cheese steak sandwiches in Vegas baby! Located on the southeast corner of Decatur and Alta, you can do some serious people watching here. No indoor dining area and no drive through, but yet somehow this place it getting a four star rating from GA.   I ordered the #3, Steak and American cheese. 'Merica! Topped with grilled onions for good measure. It got better with every bite. Juicier and juicier with melted cheese all the way to the end. The French fries were hot and crispy. Next time I'll try the Cheese Whiz fries like JR got. They looked they could have been named after some crazy 80's band. They looked "Totally Cheezy Awesome." They have a sign that says they welcome you watching your food being prepared. So I did. It was kind of cool. They serve breakfast sandwiches too. Can't wait to try one.

9tAiqme4RhrlxCxykotM7A.text: Go to Pops for the best Philly Cheese sandwich in Las Vegas. Pop's uses high quality beef and the freshest buns. A variety of toppings, onions, hot or sweet peppers and a selection of cheeses are available.  Ordering and food pick up is done at the counter window. Only outdoor seating is available with a few tables under the covered patio.

iAJ5cnkDpDl89afHb6b2aQ.text: It was just okay to me...the flavor was missing...they give you big portions but it was not memorable at all...doubt I will return

IzN7GpUR-9Dks7H1YkEBnQ.text: First time here..my son mainly wanted it.  But I enjoyed the Phillip steak cheese.  It was big, full of flavor.  They had lots of different things on the menu.

rnNI8Z48XYxM1lRuEJLcNw.text: Pops was one of the first places I ate at when I moved to Vegas! I love it here. It's just a cheese steak place, but your subs are made fresh on the grill before you eyes. Definitely a late night staple after a few drinks! Service is fast, and the place is seemingly clean considering the high traffic location.

6IyxuM1HCf7onq6JsEA_bQ.text: This place has been on my list to try for quite some time. Today while working I was in the area and decided to stop in. Super friendly staff. I placed my order, three cheese and chili cheese philly steak. It was worth every cent!! This is a simple place, no big lights, not a big crazy atmosphere, simple, down to earth people with a great product! I will be returning to try another tasty sandwich option.
