NT1232Z9JyjWtar4KiSgBw.text: Eat there quite a few times horrible service in the second time got diarrhea couldn't leave the house for a day  thumbs down

9nm_XojnmKbbqv4wgiTwKg.text: My hubby is obsessed with Philly's and this 24/7 joint has been in operation like what seems like forever. There are so many places to eat in Vegas that we didn't find this place until we lived in Vegas for 7 years. Really.  Alright you'll want to go here when the weather is cooler and not during the main eating hours as you have to stand in a very long, long, long line and then wait for a place to sit and open up and that's not easy when you're carrying a brown bag full of sandwiches and cheesy whiz fries and drinks. The menu is simple and you can top your Philly with anything you like and watch the staff cook it right in front of you through their walk up windows.  Didn't add anything complicated with the sandwich except have onions, peppers and cheese on it and that was enough. The steak was lean, nicely cooked and all the toppings fresh and the cheese melted just right. It's a mouthful of a sandwich but def worth the wait and standing in line.  Little tip, at night this area can be considered a little sketchy, remember you are eating outside near a very busy main thoroughfare in a corner location and that there are on occasion homeless people wandering and begging for food. But don't let that deter you from having a great sandwich here as it's a great local hole in the wall and the quality is consistent.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside dining at POP&#39;s

eJt6J-ZinIR0ePgqbMNb9g.text: My boyfriend and I always said we wanted to try this place since we've moved to the area. We FINALLY decided to go at 4 am which shouldn't be a problem because there's multiple huge signs on the building that are lit up and says 24 HOURS. Well we arrived and they were closed.

RZzNXMrZ93ltVE06iKTEBQ.text: Always the Same Great Taste & Quality! YUMMM!! The staff is friendly and super efficient as well

R-nnxIbPpPoshGzWmzBOwQ.text: Oh yum!! Pops did it this time! After passing this place literally for decades today was the day to get this work! I was ravenous and Pops was to be my victim!   I settled on the number 32.. cheesesteak with peppers, onions, mushrooms, white American, and cheese whiz! Also, Cheese whiz fries with the whiz on the side! Whizzup with that you ask? There would be quite the drive home, and I just couldn't imagine improperly reheating the whiz!   Anyway, the steak was so delicious the seasoning was really perfect! The bread did the sandwich justice holding up till the last bite, soaking up every bit of tastiness! The veggies, perfectly cooked with a touch of bite, nothing too overpowering for the next item!   The whiz fries... very simple but I could add them into my weekly routine of "don't stare at me I'm eating for two" pregnant binge eating stops!   Also, tip the cook! He's very friendly!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The ride home did a slight injustice, but still satisfied.
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh my! Cheese shots!

mqNsO1KWKrl-NdtNV0DBHA.text: First time out to Pop's today. I wish it wasn't so windy. There is no inside dining area. Just tables and stools under a roof right off of noisy Decatur Blvd. Not the best ambience but cool atmosphere. All kinds of retro feels with the A-frame and the 50s style diner stools. Little old roadside stops like this are a piece of Americana. I was reminded of the legendary Pink's Hot Dogs in LA. Pop's may not have quite that legendary status but that doesn't mean the food isn't great. It most certainly is.  I ordered a #32 which has fresh mushrooms, bell peppers, onions, beef and choice of cheese. I chose cheese whiz. That is the way to go. I also ordered fried mushrooms because of my well documented love of the fungi and a Dr. Brown's root beer.  I was struck by the smells emminating from behind the cage today. I was already hungry when I ordered. Had I not been hungry the smell of the steak cooking would have gotten me there. I could hardly wait for my sandwich. Then I saw another persons order being wrapped. I was drooling by this point. I needed my food!  My sandwich was ready first. The order of mushrooms did not seem to be communicated from the cook to the cashier. They were ready in just a couple of minutes. No harm. No foul. Both sandwich and shrooms were piping hot which was nice considering I had to eat outside on a cool windy day. That will warm you throug and through.   But its those first bites which warm your soul. The salty beef, sweet peppers and onions, earthy mushrooms and funky orange cheese whiz harmonize so beautifully. The roll is just sturdy enough to contain all the excitement without being over bearing. The ratio of filling to bread is spot on.   The same is True for the fried mushrooms. Whole meaty shrooms and a few stems lightly breaded and fried golden brown. Not too bready. Just enough to keep it crisp. Served with a cup of ranch dressing. To me, a little ranch goes a long way. It wasn't a necessary condiment but welcomed to the party in my mouth.  The food was awesome today at Pop's. Service was friendly but seemed disjointed. From my order of fried mushrooms not being readily recognized to the delays in being rung up as the cashier was also working the fryer. It took a while all around from standing in what seemed like a short line, to paying and to receiving my order. And for the life of me I could not find napkins anywhere. At a place that serves one of the messiest sandwiches known to man you would think there would be napkins at the tables, at the order counter, in the bag. But no. No such luck. I resorted to licking my fingers. Sssshhhh, don't tell my mom. I still have cheese beneath my nails. Crazy. But I'll be back. Mark my words.

FR2nKuxyE6pyTG0MDLi5gA.text: POP'S is bringing me out of retirement!   So I was a YELPing machine a few years back. Then I wasn't. Now I want to be again. What better recipe for my return then a sloppy, cheesy, fresh made, amazing smelling, awesome tasting, authentic Philly Cheese Steak from POP'S? Honestly, there is no better recipe.  I'm no philly cheese steak aficionado, but the minute that sammich hit my mouth it was love at first taste. The peppers and onions were cooked amazing (I asked for them to be well done), the extra cheese wiz requested actually wasn't even necessary, and the steak meat was tender, juicy, and went perfect with all of the complimenting ingredients. This was one of the better sandwiches I've had in my life. This isn't diet food, then again, if you go to a place named POP'S looking for something healthy, you're probably the same person that goes to McDonalds and orders a super size fry and a DIET coke.   POP's is a treat and I'll definitely be back. Hit the jackpot when someones order got messed up and was given complimentary chili cheese fries. I mean chili cheese fries are a gift in itself, but FREE chili cheese fries? Wowee.   My POP's (aka Dad) told me he ate at this place in 1979 and called it the "finest cheese steak in Las Vegas and probably Nevada." When Pop's gives POP'S props, it's legit.

NtMOfEBFhVAjTzafzJIyZQ.text: Omg the Italian sandwich is so freaken good here! Onion rings and nice and crispy. I can't wait to go back and order something else. Upside is that theyre open late!

WJyMfjMKXStK_NKOEsBxow.text: Its always open. And lots of choices. but average compared to other philly spots. i give them credit for being open 24/7

vyPpPgauKsbMbGYaJCfCkw.text: For the price you pay totally not worth it. The first time I tried the place I was really excited because it has all the good vibes you'd expect from a really good cheesesteak spot. Then I got my food and wasn't impressed at the sandwich has potential but the "meat" which is the most important part of the sandwich didn't have the best flavor and was SUPER FATTY N CHEWY. Just because you put cheese wiz on ur cheesesteak doesn't mean it's the best in town. I've tried this place 2 times and I'll never go back.

_F9SkXkb4bRTO-5hNZv-eg.text: I have gone to this restaurant on several occasions over the years. They simply are not as good quality as they used to be. bEtka_ByBZK8dLrpT82ACQ.text: decided to make a late night run for some philly's. and since i knew this was the best place in town it seemed like an obvious idea. well was i disappointed. especially having eaten here before. the customer service was disgusting. i attempted to ask a question about new menu items (i haven't been here since i was in my early 20s & i noticed some additions) and i was given unnecessary attitude. then, the man literally threw my sisters sandwich at her. and if the customer service wasn't enough, our chicken phillys were EXTREMELY salty. and over cooked. needless to say this isn't the same pops i remember as a kid. my uncle loved this place & i loved going with him. however i doubt i'll be making a come back.

nhfRdJMzi87OVtr3BlZcOQ.text: I came here at 3 in the morning after a long winning night in Vegas. And I wasn't done winning yet!  This is hands down the best cheesesteak I've had outside of Philly. The rolls were fresh, the steak was juicy and delicious and the cheese was near perfect. I paired this with cheese fries that disappeared in mere seconds.   It's a drive off the strip but I highly, highly recommend it to anyone craving a real cheesesteak in Vegas.

akARJCLDH207OG6MvhRWDA.text: I am a Jersey girl so for me to say this is an actual Philly cheesesteak you must know it's True. They use the Amoroso rolls the real Philly steak meat and make it exactly like it tasted back home. I would go here every day if possible. Highly recommended

Q2_ZP49kNYvIkqMHa5DlkQ.text: After playing a late night bingo game at Arizona Charlie's across the way, cheesesteak sounded amazing. Yes it was good but for the price we paid about $20 something dollars for two cheesesteaks and some orders of fries. I wouldn't come back. Our cheesesteaks were rather small and are sides of fries were quite tiny as well. The quality might be there but for the price is rather go somewhere where I won't feel robbed.

_WF34a13dZRxhfafspzHwQ.text: You can't go wrong with a place that serves cheesesteaks with Cheese Whiz. Only way to do it right. And throw Cheese Whiz fries into the mix, too. Artery  clogging at its tastiest!!

xIc0wOR7n-CCo_RN__HAJQ.text: Best Philly cheesesteak in Vegas. Nothing can compete with Pops. Even there sides are amazing!

1-0bMnN2iWICV0n68Jn2cg.text: I just picked up a prov. cheese and a prov. mushroom cheese. eeeh I totally had better. I don't agree with the review on cap and pops. I still think Cap. has better meat ratio cause my bun had so much room for more meat to be filled. And they said it exploded. NOT even close. NAW I've had better. and that would be Giamela's in L.A. or in Philly. They know what's up. We also ordered the fried green beans (yum), friend cheese stick (good), and fried zucchini (not bad) I'm sure all of them are from a box right? who knows.   The workers please smile. HpVt1GpQC46nw_HjfDOHdQ.text: Ever been to Philly and gotten the real thing? Then don't come here. I don't go out of my way to leave bad reviews but I will literally never come back here, lol

x2SEZWznWD8MtVhqfg0tTg.text: Pop's. Can't miss the lightup signs at this location. Well this place is crazy busy or dead. I recommend going there at graveyard shift since half price sandwiches. Anyways, the phillys are good with them being decent size with juicy flavor and lots of fillings. The best thing on the menu is the potato fries and the dipping sause for them. So flavorful and make you want to come back for more. They're kinda pricy for what they are (4+$ for fries) but they make the meal. It's worth your time for a quick philly grab.   PS: no indoor seating, there's a roof cover but if it's cold, you'll freeze and if it's extremely hot, you'll roast.

TtrTWI3PvVdC9VgZOMAmOw.text: I was yesterday I ordered Philly steak I ask him how much he tell me $12.95 I told him why you charge over we raise the tax ....all the time guys check the receipt?

Df3QRLEMB-_R_82kb7pOFQ.text: Ok, so im from philly. So this review is for you transplants who may want to consider eating here.   If you grew up in or around philly (im from lower bucks), you know how a cheesesteaks supposed to be made.  The guys are supposed to take your order,  grill up the meat, grill the onions& peppers alongside the meat, add the cheese and hash it all together with a spatula. Then its supposed to be served on a foot long (aka 18") hoagie roll.   Pops did it a bit differently. The meat & veggies were precooked and sitting to the side of the grill. The cook took a scoop of each and put them on the grill, stirred them up a bit, and added my cheese. Then he took a roll, opened it and put it on top, scooping it up so that the cheese was only on the bottom of the roll.   The taste was still pretty authentic, but i wish id gotten mine fresh.   The "restaurant" itself was similar in feel to an old-time drive in restaurant, except it did have a covered patio with 6 or 7 tables. Very dive-y. I liked it.   In conclusion, this was a perfect spot for a post-drive in movie date (10 minutes away on rancho), fun, and a decent cheesesteak, at least for vegas.   Ill be back for sure. A solid 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gyPqn5ygEJdOZcLIv5ja0w.text: Cheesesteak was good. They have mustard and ketchup available on request. My son got the BBQ grinder and he loved it. It wasn't dry and had really good flavor. The fries were expensive for the size you get. Overall, I would recommend and come back.

1ktbVCSytYn6vciL52k5rQ.text: Okay so this happened twice and I'm just writing a review to bring awareness to the cooks. Two times we ordered the chicken Philly with peppers mushrooms, onions, AND CHEESE WHIZ and BOTH times provolone was put on the chicken Philly but not the steak Philly. The first time I figured it was a mistake but the second time was just extremely disappointing. I do not live close to there so when I finally make time to go over there for a Philly and the order is wrong it's just disappointing. In my eyes a Philly isn't a Philly without cheese whiz... and we do not look at it until we are home across town. So I just wanted to write this to bring awareness to the cooks. The food is amazing and I will never ever say it's not. It's just when you're in the mood for something and get exactly what you didn't order it kinda sucks.. we love Pops though and will forever be customers. I just hope this changes some things.

iUwDFO0OxeCriAbnl6MsHA.text: Face it, we are not going to get real Philly cheesesteaks anywhere in the Las Vegas. However this is a great sandwich. They are fast, there's plenty of meat, the cheese is nice and gooey, and They have good sides. I've ordered their wings and they were decent. But I almost always go for a #32 Philly cheesesteak with everything. The sandwiches so big I usually eat half the next day.  I keep coming back to Pop's because even though it is not a superior Philly Cheesesteak, it is tender, the veggies are great, they are fast and there is plenty of meat.

HUIPNyAWTV1X0TkDVwhRNg.text: Love this place! Pops has the best Phillies in Las Vegas! We have been coming here since we moved to the area and I pick food up when I'm on that side of town.  I recommend the philly cheese steak. You can have it with provolone or Cheesewhiz. Take sandwich is quite large so you can save half of it, especially if you order side items. They have different fried side items like onion rings, fries, fried mushrooms, fried green beans and okra.  It's not too far from old town Vegas off of Decatur. Highly recommend this place to you carnivores!

The chili cheese fries were also great. I honestly cant believe the size of the sandwiches for the cost. Will come back every time I'm in town.

UFh10TTZPenvPIqp4LQowQ.text: Yelp usually never steers me wrong. So I found Pop's cheesesteaks and asked some of my clients about it. They all said it was good. So I thought I'd give it a try. I have never been to a cheese steak joint that didn't have sweet hot pepper relish.it is sort of like a given on my sandwiches. None here. The people were nice. But the cheesesteak was just so-so. They do use Tastykake buns which is awesome. The meat was OK and the sandwich was just OK. Not really worth the journey. But if you're hungry for a cheesesteak and you're in the neighborhood, give them a try.

With about 10 lbs of seasoning salt.   Two subs and one order of cheese fries.....$35.  Get the hell outa here.  Never going back.

uY9XqjyiLsKc66YDmUgnaw.text: Excellent philly cheesesteak! Set our sites off the strip tonight and were very pleased.

ym_aoI8_lbvBQRCAID9axw.text: First time going to Pop's and I can see why there are always people in line and sitting outside eating at all hours when I drive by. When I came up to order the smell was great. The Philly I had was hot, fresh, flavorful and the meat was overflowing out of the bread (good portions!) Spring time and early fall, it's a must stop for me as the temps outside aren't crazy. Definitely recommend!!

So9JNvUjCPbq7ecfn8-KPg.text: Was craving a Philly cheese steak, so I gave this place a try. Pops is open 24 hours so no need to rush. Nothing fancy here, just tasty steak subs. I had one with provolone but next time I will get the cheese whiz, I thought it had more flavor.

Jb7sgp3xS3UuEh8zEBNLoA.text: Roadtrippin to Vegas with my bride, formerly the beautiful Katherine Tharp and now the beautiful Katherine Watt, we stopped by Pops so I could have a quick bite after a long drive. I ordered the Cheesesteak with onions and Whiz. Let me just say.....IT WAS AMAZING!!!! It was piping hot, not at all greasy, and full of flavor. My bride, who was not hungry and didn't want anything, completely stole half my sandwich and scarfed it down. Guess what??? She loved it as well. The rest of the trip after every meal we compared it to Pops. Pops won the gold metal this road trip. We will definitely be making another stop at Pops the next time we roll out for another Vegas trip. This time make it two Utah

2n0lHSD4Qj-OwmCvYB3Khg.text: 24hrs... and great quality!!!!!!!! Since there is enough said about the cheesesteaks, thought I would add something different. Pop's has the best breakfast sandwich!! Steak, Eggs, Cheese!! I love it and it has saved me from the hangover monster on more than a few mornings! Also, the turkey sandwich is top flight! The bread is amazing, and makes sense that they bring it in from back East. I don't eat "fast food" and I consider Pop's to be anything but typical fast food, the higher quality is obvious, and I don't mind paying for it. Highly recommended!

pbuBIXp_2UNPzgHYi6fZOg.text: One day I decided to give this place another try after years of avoiding the place since it first opened up since my last visit here was unpleasant last I remembered. Looking for another place to hit up after work for some late night grubbin I was feeling for a cheesesteak sandwich. I ordered a Mushroom, pepper, and provalone cheesesteak. It was very delicious and the topping were piled high almost falling out of the hoagie roll. Open 24/7 it works with my work schedule very well. A little pricey compared to some places but it makes up for it in a packed sandwich.

K-cuXZp-nSCVD0FmpFO11g.text: I'm from West Philly, and currently live in Las Vegas. I tried Pop's cheese steaks. Let me tell you that it's not worth the trouble. I'd rather drive 7 hours back to Franks in San Marcos, CA for real cheese steaks. Pop's steaks were salty tasting with stale Amoroso's bread. And the service sucked. I exspecting rudeness when you ar in Philly, because that's how we can be. But I do not exspect it from a culture who is not from or even been to the East Coast. Do not go to Pop's cheese steak Resturant. It's a waste of time and money.

U_saM5qo46_vBATrMM3kKg.text: Order a "Whiz wit" and call it a day. Awesome bread, perfectly cooked steak, delicious onions, and creamy melted cheese whiz. What more could you ask for in a cheese steak?  Its kinda pricey, but well worth it.

nTb3b1wuvGxZcmLlwj_L-w.text: I grew up in L.A. County, so there is an overwhelming amount of hole-in-the-walls/ mom n pop shops. Thats where my heart is. In summerlin, I don't see many of those but when I tried his place, I felt at home. Your typical sub sandwich and fried sides is quality worth every penny and brings comfort, and the food too. It's a walk-up shop with outdoor stool seating. The folks that work here are chill. Customers are able to watch the cooks do their thing. Seriously, they're diligent in making every sub just right. I've been here a few times and haven't had any disappointments. Try this place at least once.

_ulMH7-X00n-xmFn8wJPVQ.text: Always wanted to stop here, finally did after 6 years, could have waited 6 more.  I was disappointed. Not as good as I was hoping for.  I think it was close to $12 for a pretty small Cheese Steak.  I will bedriving by next time.

EX4h27vrxwQiuXRh6wtRDA.text: we have been coming here for at least 12 years or more, and the cheesesteaks are always awesome. We come all the way from Henderson ( at least a 25 minute drive one way  just to eat here). Oooey, Gooey yummy ! very casual and simple eating area but we come for the food ! I think they are the best philly steaks in Vegas ! Give me that #2 with extra "Whiz" !!!!!! and the cheese fries, oh man, don't get me started... lol this is like my guilty pleasure! Of course ya cant eat here everyday, that would be like a heart attack waiting to happen, but once or twice a month is just right!!!! Love this place and sure wish they had a location in Henderson ! will keep coming back

p-vM91MbB29U-eeQlk30ew.text: This place is a 30 minute drive for us but well worth it. I knew the minute we drove into the parking lot that we hit the jackpot for a genuine PHILLY Steak with whiz and grilled onions. Bun super soft with a great taste which makes a the sandwich taste even better. Ordered a side of onion rings which had a buttery taste, very crisp and served with ranch dressing...Yumo!  I'm already planning our next visit which will probably be next week. I think I will try PHILLY with grilled mushrooms/onions. They also serve Hoagies if your into that type of sandwich.

nbvvAQS-n7BrWHp6M0GAgQ.text: I was surprised to see only one person at the window (normally there is a long line).  It was cold and windy, and I stood there and waited for about five minutes behind the one person.  It turns out that he was just visiting the girl behind the counter!  I finally stepped over to the other side and asked the guy who was standing inside if I could please order (I needed 9 sandwiches).  At that point he points to the sign and rudely states that I had been standing at the wrong window the entire time...neither of the two people working there bothered to tell me that!  I suppose I should've seen the sign but there's so much writing everywhere I missed it.  Non existent service!

s7q8Lg6rjf63FeM7ISblnA.text: I've never been to philly so I can't actually say I've had a real Philly cheesesteak however I will say this is the best philly I have tasted so far. And the cheese fries are good too.
