Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ukUPTPoUb5drr9p4UXmcpQ.text: What the heck I thought food in Vegas was supposed to be dirt cheap. If you can get a steak and eggs meal for under $5 it puts Pop's $8-10 sandwichs into perspective. Sides are expensive too at $4 for an In-N-Out sized paper tray! =/  The did have variety on sides you can get cheez wheels, deep fried zucchini and deep fried okra. The side of sweet potato fries I ate wasn't bad at all, had good crunch (the number one thing I look for in a fry) and natural sweet potato flavor. The flavor was enhanced even further with this syrup dipping sauce that had a hint of cinnamon. =)   I don't get how people can eat Cheez Whiz it's so processed it can't even be called cheese! I just didn't grow up with it, but apparently it's THE topping to get for Philly Cheesesteaks. You can even get a side of fries slathered with it here.   This location was most likely converted from a Wienerschnitzel since it had the signature triangle roofline and drive-thru. The covered seating provided sheltered for our group when we experienced a spontaneous downpour during lunch. I enjoyed the mural of Benjamin Franklin affably holding a Philly Cheesesteak, just drives the point home that what is in his hand is indeed a Philly Cheesesteak and if you don't order one here you are un-patriotic! =p

xctomVinx7htCr0vZukcpA.text: I do love going to this place and the quality of ingredients are good and are from Philadelphia.  I was there one day when the UPS guy showed up with the boxes of rolls from Amaroso's Bakery in Philadelphia.  My complaints are no indoor seating, which is a problem during the miserable Las Vegas Summers.  From May to September, you basically have to get it to go.  And it's not as good unless it's hot and fresh.  The person taking the order doesn't always get it right. Double check your orders before you leave.  And it is very pricey.  You'll pay over $15 for a sandwich, fries, and a drink.  But I guess you pay extra for the Philly imported ingredients.  The taste is good though and it is the best cheesesteak I've had outside of Philly.  I do like the fact that they are 24/7/365!

ShpCrqFDtGIkRUnHuJYaPg.text: Pop's is the business. A little Philly Cheesesteak stand offering up vegetarian, chicken, and steak phillies. They are also serving up grinders, have a bunch of sides (fried mushrooms, cheese sticks, pinwheels, etc.). They also serve TastyKakes (and you get a free one on your birthday)! Best part of all this awesomeness is that is available to you, Las Vegas, 24/7!  I've  been to Pop's several times. I've always ordered their cheesesteaks and you gotta get the Cheez Whiz. I NEVER eat cheez wiz ever (cheese from a can?! What?!) and it a MUST and Philly tradition to do so. I always order mine with peppers, onions, and mushrooms. I've seen people say that everything was pre-cooked. The veggies were, but the meat was laid on the grill fresh, we had to wait for our fries, too. So, that may have been the past, but it's not True now. This was also at 10 PM on a Sunday night. The roll was soft, the meat was juicy and tender, and the whiz, the whiz was the whiz. A great sandwich. It came out to $10.99 before tax, but I can only eat half a time.   If you have a late night craving or are needing something to soak up all the alcohol from your late night Vegas shenanigans, pop on over to Pop's!  They only offer outdoor seating and no public restrooms.

w44my2ThVl21bUXaH5nGJQ.text: I had heard nothing but good things about this place, I finally decided to go at about 1am on a Monday morning. This was the best cheesesteak I've ever had, do try the cheesesteak with provolone and cheese wiz, it was amazing!

8rCFQ5-S36gWXNIGDgdSjg.text: Great cheesesteaks and cheez whiz fries! Busy but worth the wait! You can make sure they get your order right because they make it right in front of you too. It's open 24 hours, so very convenient for great food anytime. Cheese fries are awesome and certainly don't lack on cheese. The meat is not fatty at all, and seasoned perfectly. Mozzarella sticks are also awesome and they have homemade ranch!

KDBH2Qhun8TEAaBmhEnMnw.text: I'm not, normally, a fan of philly cheese steaks but, WOWWWWWWWWWWWW!!!!   I am a believer =)  I think I got a pepper, onion, and mushroom philly cheese steak.  The bag was greasy! The meat was flavorful. The shrooms, onions, and peppers reminded me of pizza.  IT WAS DELISHHHHHHHHHHH.  It was open late which is a big plus.   Considering that it's open late, it's kinda scary!!!  We were the only ones there; and the workers work behind a bullet-proof window (OK, I WAS KIDDING BOUT THE BULLET-PROOF WINDOW!!!!!)  Alas, the food is worth getting shot at for..... WELL, I, MAYBE, NOT SHOT AT... maybe, a stab wound.........lol j/k  My review: MUST SAMPS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

GkEDGkImmvLvcMkkxnwKZA.text: I really hate to leave a bad review for this place. I've been going her for as long as I can remember. Since it changed from Philly Steakout to Pop's. I absolutely love their sandwiches and never really had bad service or a complaint for that matter.  I was craving a Philly Cheese Steak last night, but couldn't get one until my check hit. So I really really really wanted a Philly Cheese Steak tonight.   It was a bit chilly out and there was a couple on the side, I was told they already ordered. So I placed my order a #32 and a #6 both with bacon. The previous two times prior they were pretty sparse with the meat and bacon compared to what I'm used to, I figured it was just the Grill Master. This time was no different, he put a lot of onions for one sandwich and barely any for the other, I didn't say anything because I don't like to complain. He made my sandwiches, then cut them wrapped them and put them aside. I figured he was waiting for the cashier to come ring me up, so I patiently waited. He began assisting the couple that had already ordered. (It appeared they were waiting for wings) I figured it would be just a minute or two and I would get my food, however that was not the case. I ended up waiting for over 7 minutes, the couples card declined 3 times. I decided I wasn't going to pay $25+ for two cold sandwiches that have been sitting there for about 10 minutes.   Money is tight so I haven't been able to indulge as much as I would like and I was really looking forward to a Hot Philly Cheese Steak sandwich. I think the employees really dropped the ball this time. If I'm paying around $12 a sandwich I want it hot. If you're helping someone else, that's fine I'll wait. I want my food hot off the grill.  I want the old Grill Master back. The Philly was stuffed to the rim and there was bacon in every bite. I never once got cold food.

nQpyInjFsFwnglyfWbH06A.text: Amazingly Delicious!  The breakfast special (m-f/6-10am) is a sweet deal! The Breakfast Sandwich (steak, egg, cheese, peppers, onions & mushrooms) with a drink only $6! Freshly made right in front of you while you order.

7-unrPayxUKl-GmynrwNrg.text: Pros- amoroso bread, size and franks soda. Cons-  meat can be too salty, sometimes skimpy on the cheese and last visit out of black cherry soda.

yatpGy5lDF5egSjWAGx1rQ.text: I had the #34 chili cheese steak sandwich mmmmm most delicious wit sweet potato fries..I sure will b coming back when I stay out here in Vegas. .. going to try out the whole menu..lol

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #34 chili cheese steak &amp; sweet potato fries

PaZ2j36e0XKad6foYw1D7g.text: Great sandwich. Confusing menu for a girl from Minnesota that doesn't know the difference in a hoagie, grinder, sandwich, etc.  Whatever it was that I ordered was good.  The pigeons were nasty and fearless.  Vegetable lovers beware there is an extra charge of a dollar each for lettuce, tomatoes, etc.  Meat and bread and cheese come standard!

HdYKdd75lcD3c4Xvh1OHlg.text: My boyfriend and I went out to grab a philly at 2am a few weeks ago, and it was pretty good. The sandwiches were a little expensive, at least in my opinion, but they were full of meat and toppings, so I can't complain too much. As for flavor, well, to be honest, I've had much better. These weren't  bad, just not that great. Plus, they have no restroom, which is really weird for a food place. It's also not the cleanest place around, but I suppose that's part of it's seedy tasty charm. :P  We'll probably be back at some point, simply because it's open so late, unless we find something better.

sN95ca98zgAiS-gx6v25nA.text: This place is AMAZING. They're always open and just have great tasting food. Defiantly one of my favorite places in Vegas.

BkW_pCrQPpWKrDyzxP_fRw.text: I've never had a Philly cheese before I came to Pops and I won't have one nowhere else it's open 24/7 friendly service nice atmosphere what more could you ask for

ylk9rWELa5ctyo1hF-ejyg.text: My friend took me here in a recent trip to Las Vegas. BEST Philly cheesesteak I ever had.   The beef was juicy and the bread was toasted perfectly.

mucYxFWgXSj337xAVaVXGQ.text: FOOD= :( STAFF= Not friendly  PRICE= For the crap you get too much  This is no big deal. Go to the grocery store buy all the stuff and make it at home. 10 X better plus the people who work their are rude.

deeina-nzkOdiPRBEHhKBQ.text: They're just the best. Try the Banana's Foster! The food is really greasy, but that's how you know it's good!

JFs9T9ETanwgHyBN9-PRyw.text: If you think this is an authentic Philly Cheese Steak, you have clearly never been to the city of brotherly love. The one star is for the bun, it actually was pretty good. All down hill from there.The "steak" which seemed to be just as quality as a SteakUm you would get in the frozen section at the grocery store, was greasy and lacked any kind of seasoning! The only flavor was from the onions. Definately not returning, not worth another try...: (

QfBSTl-wMjkJ1uN817RWEA.text: I love their sandwiches...really fresh and hot :) for some reason..I always go there after work out..maybe I feel like it's healthy and low calories or something.. I've never heard bad thing about this place and never complained of this sandwich place! I love their mushroom + jalapeno sandwich! they have some good sweet potato fries too!! really fast but not so a instant food! have to try this place!!the best steak sandwich place ever!!

VTfcopBLIt1doks7Nlis9Q.text: The best philly sandwich this side of Philly and maybe better than philly. Off the beaten path but worth the drive. I live far south of the valley but anytime I'm out near it I go.

9zKeDOQjoD51MHBdWK3yzA.text: I always order a "#32" when I'm in their neighborhood, and I'm NEVER disappointed.  If they were located in South Philly, I can tell you that GENO'S would be worried!  The food is awesome, it's served up with a smile by friendly folks, and best of all, the place is open 24/7.  If you are addicted to Philly Steak Sandwiches (as I am), made by some folks who are actually FROM PHILLY, stop by and check them out.  You'll become addicted, too.

BEk8UcSBwrzev4W4KEO0Ew.text: Decided to stop here for some late night eats after a night spent downtown. Had just a Philly Sandwich with the cheese wiz and a small soda...$12 seemed kind of steep. The Sandwich was so so, there was a generous portion of steak on the sandwich and the bread was not to bad. It definitely was not a straight out of Philly experience for me...not awful by any means but I don't think I would be pumped up to go back.

H-RwKDUT-fWCPCqJH4vYDQ.text: Love this place, it has great food,a great environment and the people working there are super friendly!

tNPVowJu1xwmzSzJdysYSw.text: OMG!  24 hour casual drive in place. Outdoor seating only, gets a little windy there.  Philly cheese is their specialty and WOW are they good at it.  Got the #32 with mushrooms & peppers with some provolone. The only thing you need to remember is to get plenty of napkins.  This is oozing, dripping goodness!

JBM3fJj9EFYui5qHJNdk8w.text: The best Philly cheese steak we have ever had. We had the provolone and the cheese wiz both are excellent but the cheese wiz was out of this world we will be back every time we come to Vegas

qkMQ1QFUJAFeFtPIvPi-ig.text: Yummy food with a really good value. I have now been here twice in less then a month. First time was by stumbling onto it on accidents while trying to find another Philly cheese place I had a coupon for. They have a walk up window where you watch the grill master make your sandwiches.  Both times I got the mushroom, pepper and onion philly.Juicey, cheesy and big! Room mate got the pastrami both times as well. Another big juicy sandwich. I normally don't like pastrami minus a place in Cali name The Hat! Stole a bite to try it and may actually get it next time. We have had the fried green beans , yummy with a thick ranch sauce. The sweet potato fries with some sort of coconut dipping sauce. They should be considered a sin. So sweet and yummy. Whole reason I went back a second time was to have my friend try them with a to go order.  Also had the banana fosters bites. First one was yummy second one was ok, third one I only had the half of before I stopped eating it. Tasted like warm banana pudding with a soggy graham cracker crust and deep fried with a thin batter. Think they were store bought  rather then made on location. A good thing to try in a group but I won't be ordering them again for just me.    Prices are good for the amount of food you get. Main and pretty much only draw back I can think of is no indoor seating. Definitely going back more in the summer . Right on the street and fun to watch passing traffic but in the winter its a bit to cold. We wolfed down our food as quickly as we could the first time, and wised up the second time with a to go order. If you like Philly Cheese this is a great place to go  and well worth the drive even if it is across town!

fGOOS7NYKo4S3rtK4GZjAA.text: For me, the food has to be delicious. And I have to see value in purchasing a delicious meal. There's been a lot of hype recently over Pop's Philly Steaks--especially now that they have a food truck running (I see them parked in front of LVAC and downtown for Vegas StrEats.)   A few of my friends went down to their free-standing restaurant to eat and said the food was awesome! They're 24-hrs which totally works with my hectic schedule. So I made it a point to stop by.   I went around 10 or 11pm. No crowd, little wait, quick service. The food is cooked right there in front of us and they prepare everything "to-go." I ordered a Philly with onions and provolone and a heaping portion of fried okra luxuriously served in a large paper bag. My meal cost approx $15 w/o a drink.  I think Pop's is simply a hot sandwich. Not particularly flavorful or delicious. It's alright food, I would just rather spend my $15 elsewhere. I might give them another shot in the future. I've heard this place is hott on the cheese whiz. But overall it was a mediocre meal. Not bad food, just maybe not my kinda food.   The seating is entirely outdoors (not so great for the hot summer days or cold winter nights)--make sure you dress appropriately.

X30r6luGlm9IDS_STsWNpA.text: This has been my go to cheesesteak place for many years. Being from the Philly area, this has been one of the best choices for cheesesteaks, no matter how far I have to drive to get it. They're much better if you can eat there, but tables are outside and weather doesn't always cooperate. Prices have gone up but its worth it. Go on your birthday for a free tastycake...yum! I like to order my cheesesteak with extra cheese. Staff is pleasant.

LholiPC18CPTk2TQ8vCn6Q.text: I ordered a beef and cheese sandwich, which was forgettable. It was beefy, but flavorless. Considering that I have spent time in the East Coast, this in no way resembles hot sandwiches out there. I also found it to be on the expensive side. Their sides look interesting, but will sample them only if I'm in the area, which is right off the Meadows Mall and the 95.

U6wZD40jMgIU8C1cYk6Z0A.text: I have never been to Gino's and Pat's Steak in Philly but a friend of mine originally from Philly recommended this place and said its the closest you'll ever experience to taste the like of Gino and Pat's.  We ordered the Philly Cheese steak and it was pretty good.  Meat was cooked just right that it wasn't chewy and first time ever trying Cheese Wiz on a Philly.  The cheese wiz was actually one hell of a good idea, tasted really good with the sandwich and different from what I expected if I would have just chosen the common cheeses such as provolone.  The only difference from what my friend told me that would have made this equal to Pat's or Ginos was the bun used.  The bun in Pops was not that great in my opinion as well.  I have never tasted Ginos nor Pats so I can only go by from what he says.  I do recommend this place however. Still the best Philly u can get in Vegas from what others I have tried so far.  Next time I'm going to try their breakfast sandwich.  .....I have never said Philly this much in my whole entire life.

BxcK3glxkkMg478NlYACaw.text: I love this place me and my girlfriend and her brother ordered from here and the food was delicious I had the chicken wings which tasted soo good with ranch almost as good but better then any other place I ate chicken wings at. The chili cheese fries were the bomb and the cheeze wiz they used for the cheese made it that much better this is my favorite place and will be me and my girlfriends to go spot.

6m0OSYdrKChKndbeg4TdXQ.text: Soooooo excited!!! Went here for the first time yesterday and had a delicious cheez wiz steak just like back home!!!! Thank you Pops for having delicious steaks and the bread I'm used to toooo, I miss good bread and you have it all!! The cheese steaks and cheese fries are the bomb!!! My husband and I will be there all the time now!!!

IDxCejq3tslAb5rog2Py-g.text: Pretty decent cheese steak, I would have preferred if the meat was ribeye instead of sirloin.  Points for offering it hoagie style!  Good price and plenty of choices other than cheese steak.

KWOJmY3YhbIQN6codgAshA.text: STILL da bomb! I brought my friends here last weekend while we were in Vegas, and they agree, fantastic cheese steaks!  I got the one with bacon and mushrooms this time, DAMN it was good!  The guys here are great, terrific service!

lcLLzKkj7E4dU6xyqS53-w.text: I'd read about Pop's in LV Weekly awhile ago and when the Groupon for this place popped up, we seized the opportunity and ventured over to Decatur to check it out.  I was surprised to discover it was an outdoor establishment with no indoor seating, and wasn't sure what to expect since the place doesn't look like much at first glance.   But looks can be deceiving, and I was VERY impressed with the food -- everything is made to order, so even though we sat outside in the 60 degree evening to eat our phillies at one of the tables, the food was piping hot.  I liked that they had a few options for cheese since I'm not a cheese whiz fan, so I got provolone instead with peppers and onions and it was delish.  My boyfriend got the same and we shared the crunchy fried green beans with marinara sauce, which were very good.  Portions were pretty big so you definitely get a lot of food for your money.  I'd definitely go here again!

efQGcnp7WHLWZzahvVn9vg.text: This place has really awesome pastrami sandwiches and deep fried green beans +  they're open 24hrs! Nice late night meal :)

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Green Beans!

F9mdkb5n2toYMUEPkEH4Cg.text: This is a close to a genuine Philly Cheese Steak as will find west of the Liberty Bell. I will deduct just one measly star for not having fountain drinks. That small bottle of Coke was not enough to wash down that wonderful Cheese Steak and French fries. But other than that, if you find yourself north of the strip, stop on in for a little taste of back east. Live It Up You Are In Las Vegas For Cryin' Out Loud!

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. With Wiz, What Else?
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

afSP1Ndv4p4gvEcjkNKhnw.text: This place is very good. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because of location and outdoor seating. Food quality and flavor was outstanding.   Would definitely go back just not when it's 100 degrees outside!

lRn8UFoEq5wj-l8GI2cg2A.text: So I heard about this place from some family and was craving something savory in bread so I wanted to try it out. The place Is tight on parking but I came at a not so busy time 3pm and there was parking and no line. It is outdoors, it was a little windy and the eating area is small. I looked at the menu and went for the #32 and fried mushrooms to go with it with ranch. It came with steak onions provolone cheese bell peppers and mushrooms. I have this review a 4/5 flavor wise because it tasted a little flavor less to me and I took this to go so I was at home and added some salt and pepper which made it a million times better. The steak was juicy and the veggies were grilled perfectly. Just needs more flavor like I said. The bread was soft tho and perfect. The fried mushrooms were okay, I rather try the chili cheese fries next time. But overall like I said I give it 4/5 stars. The chili cheese steak looked interesting too, but I'll maybe think of coming back

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #32 with fried mushrooms

rct3UCnyCevzLpajtGK0Hw.text: It was my very first time eating here and I must say that Asante and Derrick did their thing! Food and customer service was impeccable! Thanks Pops!!

TWfYmgBQ79i0E6CK4QTJLw.text: Went here late night. It was so good.   Careful though when looking for it, otherwise you'll have to make a few U-turns, it's right on the corner of Alta & Decatur.

Xvyg-QibClz5-ley21XZpw.text: Tina was great!!! Food was amazing!!!! One hundred percent should come here to eat. Definitely a go to place

M0ULMjMFBKRTb-WYHRMudg.text: Really homey feel, had excellent customer service from from the order taker ms Tina with her wonderful attitude along ms Meganand the cook Louis, the food is amazing!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cfB9sdNUECIPOlnqEY9wtA.text: Wow. I jus love this place. We had the #32 with peppers n mushrooms and of course, the ubiquitous whiz. The sandwiches come out piping hot and oh so good. The meat is tender, the bread holds everything together, and the flavors just meld. Not sure if this place would hold up in the land of the 'Philly Special' but I would like to think so. But then again, I'm from an island in the middle of the pacific and now live in the desert so my experience with Philly Steaks is limited.   Buuuuuut- Pops is in Vegas and in my books they make a pretty mean Philly Steak. I will most definitely return!

YW5317n5ysOWxs4rnuL0Yw.text: This place is good! I would highly recommend their hot wings! BOMB! My boyfriend got the whiz cheese madness and it's wayyy messier than we expected. But it was good. I got the #32 and it was pretty good too!

yQ66trVcz-eC12YH90SmWA.text: Gotta give my guys Robert, Derek and Asa at Pop's a shoutout for the best philly cheese steak sandwiches in town! This is my go to philly steak spot in Vegas hands down. I'm constantly bringing friends from out of town here and they never disappoint. Ask for whiz when you order your sandwich. It's the best and only way to eat em!

7nHTpLRVVc1o-sCoLsfbrw.text: This has been my absolute favorite spot to eat for over 7 years. I always get the same thing #19 and I know exactly how it should look taste etc. Tonight was the worst the sandwich was super oily the bread was hard in some areas there was not even the right ingredients on it. I am super disappointed. The green beans and Cauliflower were over cooked in old oil. This has never happen in the 7 years I been coming here. This sandwich tonight did not even taste like a sandwich you would usually get from POPS I literally took an UBER there and back to get a sandwich that tasted worse then Subway.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #19 Italian Hoagie on old bread super oily and not all the proper ingredients
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burnt Fried Green Beans made in way old oil

kOUiQSfmN31vbtXCR_34gQ.text: They offer their delicious subs 24/7! That says it all. I'm not a fan of their wings because the ones I got were slightly burnt but their bbq sauce was good. The other item on their menu I would recommend aside from all of their yummy subs are their onion rings. If you like thick onion rings with flavorful batter then try these!

vlkJvUu8wHAbawmBaOXTIw.text: Went here for the first time today... They open at 10am... we knew it might take awhile for the food to be made but it was worth the wait for sure! Everything was fresh and so very tasty... The service was excellent as well... the counter guy keep checking our food and kept us update to how long more of a wait. He even walked our food over to us when it was ready... The pizza sauce was so good and toppings for the supreme was just right amd tje crust was perfect... the gyro sauce was amazing and there was a good amount of meat which was seasoned well... my daughter loved the fries and chicken nuggets it was seasoned with something other than just plain old salt it was so good i wish we had more... we will definitely be back...

zfCJaKpZsHPIq_n2ILgEBg.text: One of my favorite spots while living in Vegas most definitely authentic I have a friend from Philly that says reminds him of home cool staff, reasonable prices also to mention they are open 24 hours

cGYwwmnCMbfUSG841-JcmQ.text: Wasn't my favorite Philly i have had. That would be Boston Pizza or home cooked, but I heard so much about the cheese wiz philly so i had to try it. To say the least i was really dissapointed, i was expecting it to be so delicious and full of flavor. Instead it was really bland and super messy. Im not giving up on Pops just yet tho. Im gonna go back and try another type and then i will decide if they are going to be put on my philly list!

Cra68CQaXm2VoyhDXqMTsw.text: So glad I stopped at Pop's today. Been in Vegas a Decade, and there's No Reason for me to go to Philly now! Steak Philly w Whiz. I'll be back

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qGi9Fsi19YSVj5CUAcyyTw.text: Good food, but the other day (I'll start by saying this is the first time this has happened) ...stood around for almost 10 minutes at window - 2 workers were counting cash, one was out in parking lot, 3 others were standing around talking. No-one came to the window where people were waiting. We finally left without ordering. When we left someone else was waiting to be helped. Weird.

I0s9ALXyDAsUygMCK-zGZw.text: Drove across town to specifically come here. It took forever, about 30 mins plus, to get the order. What pushed my buttons was the window dude was straight shithead. He had an attitude with all the customers, when he was the one giving people wrong orders. Our order was wrong and we asked for a receipt, no receipt. Check your banks for charges people! Totally disappointed, been coming here for over 20 yrs. Customer service gone to shits. Food was good though, can't complain about the cook! Yum.

skt4gKIgCyPqYBa-ch0ufA.text: Ok, my fault for forgetting but I was going to get the Italian, toasted with grilled meats so I had to eat it cold. BUT, the flavor was pretty amazing. Definitely going back and ordering it heated. After 25 years, I FINALLY went.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The pickles and pickled peppers were so good

pRAp_xCXWjKDSZNXf2PoPg.text: I have been going to Pop's for years. They have the best Philly steaks in Vegas. I used to drive from Green Valley and now from Aliante just for a #32 with hot peppers, onions, and Cheez Whiz, and a side of sweet potato fries. They're open 24/7 so no matter when you stop by you'll leave happy.  Outdoor / Covered Patio style dining only.  Limited parking. Usually adequate on an average night but when they're busy...

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

omwdZlWg5-6t2A2iGrMoug.text: Always a great place to stop in the middle of the night when you're having a craving for some amazing food. The selection is huge and so is the portion. You can't go wrong and the service is great as well.

7IP2gUo9toz_5YmvZpx8EQ.text: Best cheesesteak in town. Double meat double cheese and a Frank's black cherry cola. And it's always open...

xld5NgUW8AcyuRjkhr_1DA.text: I ordered a cheesesteak with onions and peppers at Pops 0n July 6th. The place was very busy but they were pretty fast getting the orders out. I had been there many years ago and had the same sandwich, which my wife and I shared. We both thought is was OK, but no match for the steaks at the Triple Play and certainly not close to Genos, etc in Philly. Yesterday was no exception, but perhaps a little worse. I don't know what kind of meat they used but I can't believe it was rib steak. It tasted either old or previously frozen. It was WAY,WAY overcooked also. Maybe it was only fair because they were so busy, but I'm not going to go back to see. The bread,wiz,onion, and peppers would have been a better combo.

rrwe8EyC0SS0JF-C1eqnCA.text: Ordered the pepper and mushroom cheese steak with bacon and it is the best I've ever had. The chef behind the Grill is a master of his craft. Amazing cheese steaks !  From one Chef to another - keep doing what you do and do what you love, you're awesome at it.

VZfsoCOjboEUQWyU-wGIow.text: I was hoping for such a better experience! I went here last night with friends who are Philly born and raised. I grew up close to Philly and have enjoyed many an authentic cheesesteak. These had no seasoning, even the peppers and mushrooms were bland. The steak wasn't chopped in classic Philly fashion. I give two stars because the cashier was pleasant, cheese fries were on point and they had Dr. Brown's black cherry soda. Otherwise, this experience was a disappointing bust.

AbqxaAXAxTZB_SrNuO4K7g.text: the pulled pork sandwich from here is phenomenal!  the bbq sauce is sweet. they give you nice portions of meat on everything. there's no way you can walk away from this restaurant and you're hungry two hours later. very tasty and filling and reasonably priced. definitely going back

xe2VPYJ5heBoIn1mcO60vA.text: Honestly one of the best philly steak businesses in Las Vegas!!!! I highly recommend going here. I saw this place as I was driving by and i was like why not I'm in the mood for a philly steak. I went in and was greeted nicely which is what most restaurants or fast food places lack. I can see why they call this place pops philly steaks, because now whenever I'm hungry I think pops lol

rVu7CehwGRn0IFtbhcx6YA.text: Pop's is a life saver. There open twenty four hours. The pastrami and hoagies look a delight. I may need to warn u, the thought of extra meat is unnecessary. So many favorites in such a humble spot. I was mad pleased with the dressing of my #LateNite #TasteBuds

QanH0c8t0DnpUPQH7Q9lMQ.text: I had high hopes for this place, because it looks like the perfect hole in the wall you've yet to discover. Cheesy side murals, dim lighting, hand painted signs, all the makings for a secret delicious spot.  I ordered the chicken Philly with bell peppers, provolone, and mushroom. It was very hot and cheesy, which was a plus! But almost too hot....I had to pause in between bites or else risk third degree burns. Overall it was kind of tasteless. And dry. The fries were no good, we ate a couple and tossed the rest. That's pretty bad considering I love fries so much that my standards are pretty low. They tasted like fries you would get at the public pool snack stand when you were a kid.  Overall I would say this is fine if you're hungry and in the area....but definitely would not make a special trip for it. Most likely I will not be back again.

ps7j0obgFHvks2Or08ZLdA.text: Went here for the first time on Friday.  Gotta say I wasn't expecting much.  I was pleasantly surprised!! My sandwich was heavenly.  I ordered the steak with cheese whiz, onions and mushrooms. I can't wait to go back. It was that good.  The outdoor eating area was spotless.

MvNUVdQIyeMTnAn091boXQ.text: I loved coming to pops i love the taco salad and bbq pork sandwich. Unfortunately I have to give it 3 stars as 2 people have gotten food poisoning from the cheese steak.  I really did love the flavors but cant risk continuing to eat here.

2R04PMDBbErShYKWj8kq-w.text: Pop's is AMAZING!  Open 24 hours and great service.  This is my go to late night eat.  The wagon wheel and cheese wiz is to DIE FOR!  The owner is a retired Military vet and very kind.  I asked to meet him so that I could tell him how awesome his employees were and how much I love his food.  I've had Philly cheesesteaks all over the world due to being in the Military, this one is my fav.  They also offer a Military discount and the food comes out FAST.  Try it, I bet you'll be a fan.    I can't wait to get back to Vegas to get some POP'S!

uTg_l85du1q6odgX0wmcYw.text: Always Fresh always great , never had s complaint , damn near the last thing of the original Vegas left

adU2wDzh0UfTBsgkUUWIBQ.text: I've never had an original Philadelphia philly but I've loved all the prepared imitations I've had along the way. I was looking for a post-workout meal ( some Phillies can be quite nutritious depending on what you pile on) and this place came up on yelp.   The first thing I noticed was the large helping of steak Pop's puts on their sandwich (hello protein), I had to look more. Then I saw they serve sweet potato fries... Then I was sold.   The philly I ordered was a #32 which was a 9" philly served with about 5 oz. o strip steak, onions, bell peppers, red peppers, your choice of cheese, and mushrooms (I didn't get the mushrooms)  I also got an order of sweet potato fries with their cinnamon for sauce ( I didn't care for the sauce)  Well I calculated the nutritional information for my meal and it was as follows: Philly Cheesesteak Sandwich  Cal 414   Protein 30g   Carbs 36g    Fat 15g  Sweet Potato Fries (3 oz.) full portion is about (5 oz.) Cal 150   Protein 2   Fat 10    Carb 24

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #32 special $10.99 Philly cheesesteak (your choice of cheese) onions, peppers, and mushrooms!

g4Lmx9CR7DJwsPVfLiBWmQ.text: I've been wanting to try this place for some time.  I was hoping for a truly legendary cheese steak experience.  Unfortunately I was more than a bit disappointed with flavor.  There are many more places to get a great cheese steak in the valley, and unless I'm in the area, I don't see a need to come back here.  I got the Bacon and Swiss Cheese steak.  Everything should be better with bacon, right?  Not in this case, the bacon didn't add much flavor, and the swiss was definitely a mistake.  A good cheese steak always comes with whiz.  Provolone is acceptable but if you really want the flavor, the whiz is where it's at.  The steak itself was sliced perfectly and was melt in your mouth, except it lacked a flavor.  The sandwiches were nice sized for what you pay, but overall for someone who is just a Philly Steak place, it was a bit of a letdown.    They have a lot of sides, and I can't comment on their flavors.  If you find yourself in the northern part of the west side, this place will more than meet your need for cheese steak at all hours of the night.  They do have a nice seating area, and they have misters for the heat.

D_vxg0aPrpUlGVq_L6JDSw.text: I've been coming to this place for 15 years. Me and my daughter were just discussing that we've never had a bad experience here in 15 years.   On top of that, this is the best food on gods green earth. God bless Pops!!  Don't bother with all the other imposter Philly cheesesteak places.  This is the one and only!  This is a weekly event for us and the kids!  Yummmm!!  Cheese Wiz!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NbFFroUN4cXsCxuV_pkBtg.text: This place was yummy! My husband is a harsh critic when it comes to other places trying to recreate the original Philly cheesesteak. He's biased because he grew up in philly. Needless to say, it was good. The meat was very tender and the bread was soft. I'd probably get a regular cheesesteak next time because their onions and green peppers are way too big and they don't cook them too long. The fries were bland and undercooked. We would return, in just going to get something different.

jru0xyiRG53_5Y__G53A1g.text: Best food I had in Vegas. Love the cheesesteaks here more than in Philadelphia.

DLVBHlC7_Sx1WBWEk73aTg.text: Came out here for the weekend with my boyfriend we were starving and came across pops Philly's!!! Great service & great FOOODDD!!!!! very reasonable price! Daniel helped us out thanks again for your service you were great! Fersure we will be back , Our New Favorite hot spot :)) !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bum7qKuMl0_PoeuseXGPVg.text: I had the Philly cheese steak sandwich.  The food was good, the people were nice. I wish there was a drive thru or a place to go inside. It sucked waiting outside for my food.

1-5IUwVkeeryS0cosUybYw.text: I'mma give it a 5-star because the sandwich was pretty filling...the rest is subjective.  I prefer my philly steak sandwiches to have a garlic mayo, noticeable slices of onion and bell peppers and mushroom. I got a #4 which is the steak with provolone cheese.  size was good and steak portion was great, so was the steak flavor.  I didn't see too many noticeable onions though since it was pre-sauteed and mixed in.  just the sandwich was $10.80 after tax.  meh, I'd say it was worth it.  I am not a fan of cheez whiz, which there seemed to be a lot of varieties of items using it, but at least it is Kraft brand. Oh well, take it as you will.  I would recommend this place though.

oZiMrouDIpnmvAP6swoGcg.text: Delicious!  Best phillysteak EVER!  Good was easy to order and quick with great service as well. Will definitely be coming back!

K5hNtcmiSFzoslO88xwjTg.text: It's hard to find a great steak wit-whiz, but these guys deliver.  Quick, greasy, delicious.  The rolls are soft and remind of the bread you find at Jim's or Pat's in Philly.  The steak is tasty but not too salty.  The whiz is hot and plentiful.  The onions are caramelized and delicate.  Solid grillwork.    The fries were OK.  Could be a little crunchier but they make great vehicles for more whiz!

hOQMZltMMyguCwYMAban6Q.text: Being from Philadelphia at one point I love this place but tonight 1 a.m. in the morning and in a vacation what a nightmare trying to deal with the fat guy and Chris trying to order a hoagie with oil and state it wasn't cooked 3 hours go out of a container and put on the grill again do yourselves a favor do not go there late at night they have no clue what you're doing and you're only there then work the late hours a complete sham

alAXhEaV4ojykutPA9gS-A.text: Not that great. I've had cheesesteaks in Philly several times and this does not compare. Not to mention the steak was dry because it had been cooking and sitting there for who knows how long. It wasn't horrible by any means but I don't think this place was worth the hype. Maybe we just went on a bad day I don't know, I would try it one more time but as of right now I was not impressed. They do not offer any sort of kid friendly menu such as hotdogs or something like that that was a downside for us as well.  UPDATE:  after reading a message from someone at this establishment who was unhappy with my review, I likely WON'T give it a second try. Seriously, for you to say your demographic isn't children which is why you don't serve any kid friendly food is ridiculous! You are not a bar or a club, if you were I'd totally understand and would not have even mentioned lack of kids menu. This is a freakin sub shop... and FYI there are tons of families in the area and having a few simple items on the menu MIGHT boost your business!  Funny I saw high chairs at your restaurant ... WHY? you don't serve kid friendly food! Oh well.  Lesson learned.

oit6gkyhzImXxks9aSY9PQ.text: This is "fast food "  Los Angeles style. I say L.A. because you see places like this all over... but what sets this apart from most is the food. Nothing mediocre about it. The sandwiches are huge (enough for 2) and very tasty. The Italian was excellent and would have done A -1 Imports in Long Beach,Ca. Proud. You can get "bananas foster". Deep fried string beans. I got this stuff home and opened the bags -- my sweeties ' eyes damn near popped out - the food is great looking but tastes even better than it looks -- that sandwich made me cry, for God's sake. I honestly wiped tears from my eyes.

YrxoxJOngYoHe2cqRLxJow.text: The place is advertised as a Philly cheesesteak and for me that means more than just some frozen steakumms! The steak was super dry and the onions and peppers were cut way too big and thick. Moral of the story is, for the people who have had good cheesesteaks or authentic ones from Geno's or Pat's in Philly, dont waste your time!

WMvjcJ7i2K0JVeYXUrR23Q.text: Great quick stop for a Philly Cheese Steak, especially if you are up late or getting off work in the early hours of the morning (as my fellow gravies do). The fries are good, the Phillys are excellent, and the cook is always tip worthy.  If you are planning to eat "in" then wear a nice thick jacket in the winter as the seating is all patio.

j-J_39szkrZnalsEqdISdA.text: The food is ok. The service is EXTREMELY SLOW!! The owners really should rethink how patrons are served one order at a time is very time consuming. Also i dont think the cashier should be handling food and money with no gloves! the cook should also be wearing gloves. very unsanitary!!

RnkEbFn4vQlJUhvMOStYIQ.text: Open 24-7, very friendly, generous amounts of meat and cheese on your sandwich!  How can you go wrong there?  Sign up with your email address and you can print a BOGO coupon, which they do accept, as I used it just the other day.  They didn't hassle me at all and actually thanked me for stopping by.  By the way, the rolls are amazing!  Super soft---a big sandwich.  Can't beat em.

LDo6NhmqOUmlvwN-nyO9Yg.text: Well, I tried.  I've lived in the Philadelphia area my entire life. I've eaten cheesesteaks at several different places, so I like to think I know what I'm talking about. I was looking forward to trying Pops, as many people have said they're the most authentic in the city.  Well, they tried too, but unfortunately, it wasn't the experience I'm used to from Philly. The meat wasn't browned enough. The roll was somehow too soft, which is weird because they use the same Amoroso rolls that are used in Philly. And then the whiz.... they poured it on top of the meat. Travesty, I tell you. In Philly, they mix it in with the meat so that you have an equal bite of cheese to meat. I honestly didn't think it'd make much of a difference, but i had a ton of cheese in the bites I took from the top of the sandwich, and no cheese on the bottom of the sandwich.   They did have tastykakes though. That made me pretty happy. I also like how they're open 24 hours a day. I'll have to try one of their breakfast hoagies (incorrectly named by Pops as "Breakfast Phillys".... honestly, if you go into a sandwich shop in philly and ask for anything called  "philly", they will not know what you're talking about).  So why the three star review if I was dissatisfied? Well, I hate giving low reviews to perfectly good businesses. I'm sure what I ate was a great sandwich. For people from Vegas who want a good cheesesteak, this is a great option. For people from Philly who've had the real deal however, you may be a little disappointed that it doesn't taste like it's from back home.

niPlchO1KttWX0js91_IDQ.text: Definitely worth the drive. A plus that it's always open which is a standard money maker in Vegas.   I had the Philly cheesesteak. The meat was properly seasoned, not too salty not too bland. The bread was soft and fresh. The mayonnaise was just enough to really kick up the flavor and of course, the cheese was completely melted and mixed with the onions to perfection.  Between here and capriottis... I couldn't say who did it best.

GyPtjTLIxkvMfQeV96lGVQ.text: I had the loaded cheese fries. Good food, a medium-sized portion. The fact that it's open 24 hours was a huge benefit. This is a nice alternative to fast food if you've got a craving for good-for-the-soul food late at night. I only gave this place 3 stars because the food is a little over-priced when compared to similar places. Also, the customer service was sub-par. Lastly, the building wasn't as clean as it should have been.

ty-x06VOqh38pf3a5dnSlQ.text: Closest thing to being in Philly :). Awesome food, great location open 24 hours.  Service is awesome , outdoor seating is perfect this time of year. This is a great place for great food fast.

Fg0SpmMU2M5gISrVxREh_Q.text: Not good . Jalapeno poppers were not what I was expecting . Tasted like they didn't wash them right . Just not appetizing. Cheesesteak not as tasty as expecting either .

KTpNZ220gMVueG72yeqyQw.text: Pops is amazing!!! I've been going there since 2001 when they took the establishment over n began doing Phillies the way they should be done I'm n east coast native n maybe not n expert but i do know a good sandwich when i eat one The manager Mike is a special kind of person he really goes out of his way to make the customers feel at home n taken care of U can even find him on the grill certain days  Pops is a must try!!! There sandwiches are like potato chips u can't stop at one n u will surely be back for another as well as telling ur friends If ur from the east coast n u haven't been able to get ur fix....... GREAT place

Hxk9HOZbghAE5Fx9rpADvw.text: So the cashier took my money but he had gloves on. Mm, doesn't that defeat the purpose of wearing gloves? Fortunately I didn't see him cooking my food, so I was okay.   Ugh, $10.80 for a Philly cheese steak with provolone, onions, and CANNED mushrooms!! You kidding me? Such a disappointment.   And yeah, all the tables are really dirty, no way I was going to sit there and eat.  Sandwich was just alright.

PXaG5DUT1GR8kmJtoziYqQ.text: Had pops yesterday for dinner it had been awhile since I had been there my husband an kids had never been. We ordered a number 32,6,3 along with chili cheese fries everything was delicious the bread was fresh nice size portions of meat on every sandwich the fries had the perfect about of chili an chesse sauce!!! Made fresh right as your ordering an doesn't take long to come out excellent service!

3nPJYYK9bBLFha2FLldRng.text: Awesome food! Highly recommended I've had a few of there sandwiches and I can say I've never been disappointed always satisfied and there zucchini fries are bomb and the banana fosters bits are delicious.

wuB5_PYnbBrERY2at-3CQQ.text: I am fanatical about cheesesteaks. Some friends and I used to road trip from VA to 9th and Passyunk in Philly to put Pat's and Geno's head to head. (Pat's wins that battle, by the way.)  Anyhow, POP's is even more fanatical about cheesesteak. Look at their website and the detailed manifesto explaining why they use Liberty Steaks, Amarosa Bakery rolls and other carefully sourced and authentic ingredients.  It shows in the finished product, a Pat's style sandwich with ribeye chopped on the grill. I order mine wit extra onions (caramelized to a beautiful brown) and Cheez Whiz. I recommend you do the same. Can't go wrong with the classics.  This is a True Philly style experience with a walk up counter, metal tables on a patio, and a mural of Ben Franklin on the wall, and it's open 24/7. It's a half hour drive for me but well worth it. Best cheesesteak in Vegas, easily.

PwDquBB3O1cT8S64h5z_oQ.text: We waited in the "Order Line" for about 20 minutes (somewhat long line) just for Italian Ice, the man behind the grill told me to just go to the register so I proceeded over there and waited behind the couple who was orginally in front of me in the first place. I was fine with the waiting until the man at the register automatically started ringing up the woman behind me without even acknowledging me or asking for my order. Another five or so minutes passed then the woman next to me apologized for them taking her before me and even asked if I could just get an Italian Ice to which the guy at the grill gave an annoyed look and said the other guy would get it. I waited another 5 minutes of nothing with no line besides the woman who was orginally behind me before deciding to just leave. The man ran out the back door to say he'd take my order when we were already across the street getting into the car. Never have had their food but for that alone i will NEVER EVER be back nor recommend it to anyone. I wish I could give this 0 stars for that alone.

SP0qLiHfU5P-yDxq-zeXHA.text: 3.5 stars to be exact.  I just went to Geno's and Pat's in Philly the 1st week of Sept.  While the steak is a lot more chopped up here I would say it was pretty comparable.  The bread is really what you come here for I think cuz I guess you could make a pretty fair attempt at making these at home.  Still good though.

x4bEDqIpah_ZkgTelbYPug.text: The Cheesesteak is the best in Vegas.  Outdoor seating only.  Go when the weather is nice.

HkEYTeHeJZNZS5lx4m5uxQ.text: Hands down, the best cheesesteaks in town PERIOID. You receive authentic cheesesteaks here the cook doesn't measure the meat down to a fraction of an ounce. This place is pricy but it's expected since all the ingredients arrive from back east daily  There is no indoor seating and the parking lot is small but you can usually get a space or park on the street.  Super easy to get to location off Decatur and 95.  Much better than Steak-out..

FdUacQqLzfByYKjzaCD_0w.text: Upon recommendation from a very good buddy, I stopped by and got a Philly Steak with provolone / onions / peppers.  OMG, it was fantastic!  It brought back great memories of my trips to Philly.  There was plenty of meat, just the right mixture of other ingredients, and the roll was perfect.  There is no "ambiance" to this place ... which gives it it's own "ambiance" (if you get my drift).  I probably wouldn't frequent this place at night, but it's well worth a trip if you're in Vegas and have a car.

Pdkl2bM-3AOQ5fQyQ1kQKg.text: Great food! Love sitting outside when the weather is nice, watching the cars go by while eating a yummy cheesesteak. It's quite a distance from where I live, but it's worth it!

zQfXszh6ysJFNykGK995VA.text: So so good. Makes me think of Philly. True Philly Steak is with Wiz.  Yummy!!!!  They import the bread from the east coast which makes or breaks a good hoagie.

W6iL9LIEAZddAV_ANH-TIQ.text: Okay, let me just preface something, I'm from the suburbs of Philly. This place makes a good eff'n cheesesteak! When we moved to Vegas, I knew there were gonna be some things I would not be able to get out here like Utz Potato Chips, Kunzler Ham, etc. I thought for sure the cheesesteak would be one of them until we found Pop's. Both Charles K.'s and Reggie M.'s testimonials are 100% True and to back it up popscheesesteaks.com The worst thing about this place, it's not open Sunday.

F330r3CoHpwzwAKhb8hb-Q.text: Went here in January. Wasn't anything special and they were out of pastrami so I didn't get a sandwich. My hubby ordered a cheese-steak. It didn't appeal to me enough to beg a bite from him and I was really hungry.. I ended up ordering by phone from the Blue Nile restaurant (yummy Ethiopian food - great choice). I did have a few fries though. They were alright. Only went once and was not really impressed enough to try it again. There are far too many culinary delights in Vegas to waste time on the mediocre. You are not going to miss out if you skip this place for another random sandwich shop.

D9Qd7eOf-r4DqdsF4jZLSw.text: This is the only place I've tried for a Philly since I been living on the West. I've been to Philly...numerous times, so I know what to expect and also how to order the sandwich properly. To me...the Philly was pretty good. Didn't go crazy..just with whiz, onions, green peppers and jalapeno. I devoured it. It's no Genos or Tony Luke...but it comes close enough. I will visit again, but only on a weekend day.

AFcCNv3Bh2ypOCBK7a_w4Q.text: OK, so maybe not the best cheesesteak I've ever had, but mostly that was because of the bread, which is mediocre at best. The steak itself makes up for that and then some or I'd have given this a lower rating. I'd say it's not like a "Philly" cheesesteak and you can probably get a better cheesesteak within the New York - Philly corridor, and maybe slightly outside of that area... But honestly, out on this side of the country where you can't bake good bread, it's the best you'll find for a thousand miles. Great cheesesteak, interesting but fun atmosphere, worth the drive way off the strip.

A91K2Bpd7fNwR6ktWEf_Mg.text: All it was hyped as. Sandwich was tasty and the roll soft. I was very happy.

ozlN_TNMlWpr40o390S40w.text: I have always wanted to check this place, and I finally did today.   I got the #2 without, a cheese steak with Whiz, it was amazing!!!  The meat was seasoned perfectly, the whiz was warm and cheesy, and the bread was amazing, I have read that they fly the bread in from Philly, and I must say it's well worth it.  I have had Philly's at several places and the bread is what put pops over the top.  I will be going back!!!

NSsoJzmFvZ96ETSwfgMbZg.text: Delicious Philly steaks. Made fresh. Best sauce for sweet potato fries.

LstpSvAMLnme82XGY1cKCg.text: Best cheesesteaks in the city, hands down. Would have been a perfect score, the prices are a tad high. Staff is super friendly!

WDevsFC-KiXiyAK8Cja8Ng.text: If you want a great steak and cheese visit Pops!  Open 24/7 and it's always very hot!  Don't bite right into it or you'll burn your mouth, you've been warned.

qHtjO2lxryn2tfbbrkqsdw.text: This place is awesome!  I think the staple is the cheez wiz philly.  I've been branching out and trying other things and haven't been disappointed yet.  They are open 24/7 too!Works awesome for the late night cravings.

23CPIZfYDkyt-ty5nG04qg.text: I didn't have my first Philly cheesesteak sandwich until I was about 35 on a trip to Philly.  I fell in love.  Pops is the best in vegas for the authentic taste.  They even fly their bread in from Philly (something about the water in Philly makes it better).  It really is a True taste of Philly... you gotta try it.

EeJzdKFdFmeSEnxOwgwqgg.text: Well this place was a surprise!  Driving around doing store checks all day, we bumped into this place right around lunch time.  I am highly knowledgeable in the cheesesteak genre and highly critical of places that don't get it right.  Pride of Philly (POPs) gets it right.  This has to be the best cheesesteak in Las Vegas (I may be wrong but I don't think so).  The bread, key ingredient in the cheesesteak genre, was excellent.  Had a side of greasy, hot and crispy fries.   Don't like cheesesteak, they have pastrami, grinders, and fried string beans.  Best thing about it was Steve, the cook, nice guy and not a racist like that Geno character in South Philadelphia.

_X0KUU7SJAZa6A7C86XZMg.text: We have been visiting POP's for years!  We are never disappointed by the food.  Awesome Philly Steak Sandwiches.  LOVE their onion rings. I love the quirkiness of eating outside.  Every time we have out of towners we take them here!

PkeudX6iid5J6UiaSK7-jg.text: In the worst of times people often think of the best of times.  Rex is no exception.  Gather around kids and let Uncle Rex tell you a story...when Rex was a small child he spent many a month on the East Coast. It was a magical time.  My father, who beat young Rex mercilessly if Rex called him anything but "The Future Husband of the Multi Talented Pia Zadora", was originally from the Northeast.  My father was an odd man, a brutal man, a man with big dreams and small child like hands.  On my fifth birthday he brought Rex with him as he knocked over a 7-11.  As Rex helped him tie up the store clerk he let me pick any one thing Rex wanted in the store.  Young Rex wandered around the store, trying very hard to not step in the pools of blood, Rex saw the object he wanted...Rex turned and said "Future Husband of the Multi Talented Pia Zadora can Rex have THAT?"  He nodded.  Rex kicked the 87 year old man laying on some of it...and picked it up. It was a bag with a delicious cheesesteak in it.  Rex danced. Rex smiled. Rex took the wallet of a crying soccer dad.  Rex was happy.  Rex and Future Husband of the Multi Talented Pia Zadora drove down the street, the sound of sirens in the distance fading...the smell of the cheesesteak wafting into Rex's young nasal passages.  A great cheesesteak is a gift from above.  A wallet filled with 20 dollar bills and an unused condom...icing on the cake.  After we divided the ill gotten booty, Future Husband of the Multi Talented Pia Zadora always took 70% (until I turned 9...but that is another story)...Rex ate his cheesesteak.  Perfect bread. Juicy shredded meat. Perfectly cooked onions. The right amount of whiz. Juice ran down Rex's chin. Juice ran down Rex's hands. Rex shook in delight. That memory, and the 8 months Rex spent on the run after Future Husband of the Multi Talented Pia Zadora ratted him out...will always be with him.  Pops Philly Cheesesteak is not only an insult to that memory it is an insult to all things with meat, cheese, bread or even hot foods.  The front page of the their website has a picture of their pitiful attempt of a cheeesteak...one of one of their abominations has green pepper on it. GREEN PEPPER!!  Let me explain something to all of you who are not from Philly...IF there was a place in Philadelphia that put green bell peppers on their cheeseteak...THE CITIZENS WOULD BURN IT DOWN!!!  It is ABSOLUTLEY 100% NOT ALLOWED IN ANY PLACE IN PHILADELPHIA!! Even if asked they WILL NOT DO IT!  So, first and foremost this is NOT A PHILLY CHEESESTEAK PLACE!!! IT IS NOT! END OF STORY!  Apologies. Rex passed out and needed a shot of "Happy Serum" to get up right again...what is "Happy Serum" you ask...heathen...it is 1 part gasoline, 1 part peach schnapps, 1 part wiper fluid.   Anyway, now that we have established this is not a Philly cheesesteak, let's talk about it from a cheesesteak on it's own merits.  First, the rolls are good, the sad part is you can tell the bread is shipped frozen or frozen after it gets to Pops.  Big mistake. It really messes with the bread. It isn't bad, but again it isn't East Coast good.  Cheese...never enough. Never. If you get provolone instead of whiz it is almost non-existent. Shame on you for skimping on the cheese.  The Whiz isn't bad sometimes but more often than not there isn't enough.  The meat isn't bad. It is done well, with one BIG problem...it is often dry. Not enough oil or cooked and then recooked, whatever the reason it is not great.  If you get to Pops on the right day and get lucky, and order correctly, it isn't bad...but the overall consistency is not there.  Lastly...the "Philly" part of the menu...the Tastycakes, the birch beer, the rest of it...all WAY TOO EXPENSIVE! At Glaziers Market you can get all the stuff for 1/5th of the price.    Here is my biggest problem...Pop's plays on East Coast memories and locals who don't know any better. That is the biggest crime. It isn't Philly. It isn't a great cheesesteak. It is over priced. It is inconsistent. It just isn't right. It just isn't good.  Most of you will never know better unless you go back east (and my next review for Pizza will tell you how to find GREAT east coast food), and they KNOW you don't know. Pop's has been a place I have tried off and on for almost 8 years.  Rex wants to love it. Rex needs to keep trying every 2 years or so...but much like when his father turned him into the cops at the tender age of 5...Rex is always hurt by Pops. Future Husband of the Multi Talented Pia Zadora and Pops...shame on you...you know better. Rex knows better. Rex deserves better. So does everyone else.

tClDIcH4sFNGOfxyMr1_kA.text: I like the feel of this place and the sandwiches are big and stuffing.   I've tried the Philly steak (w/ onions, peppers, whiz), BBQ pork hoagie, Italian sausage sub. Out of the apps I've gotten sweet potato fries,fried zucchini and the fried green beans.   All have been really good, but I love fried green beans so that hits this happy spot for me with sharing a Philly Whiz cheese steak. Very curious to try the bananas foster, fried okra and whiz wheels.  Open late so a plus for night owls like us. Since it's made piping hot to order, it's still nice and warm when we get home. You go to any other fast food and that crap is cold when we get home- another 10-15 minute drive on the FWY. MMM... night owls deserve something warm in the belly too.

dRyDSTwOBjUR0dKm7sjAUg.text: Ok... Ive had enough. I will NOT go one more day with the reviews on here that aren't addressed. If you rate POPs below 4 stars; then you are a complainer. First of all; my favorite food on a piece of bread is The Cheesesteak. I have been to Philly on numerous occasions and have been to all the touristy spots Pats...Genos... Tony Lukes and out of those 3 Tony Lukes is by far the best. Pops is the best representation of Philly in Las Vegas.  The grillmaster makes all the difference. Steve is far and away the man on the grill. Yes, you have to speak up; the man is from Philly and he doesnt reward meekness or stupidity. I like that. Its not a 5 star restaurant. The sandwiches aren't cheap; this isn't a 99 special joint. If they are just recooking your meat then speak up. Ive only had fresh meat and chicken. He brings his Amorosos in from Philly... So for those of you that are from Philly and complain about the rolls: you know nothing. I will continue to seek out Cheesesteaks everywhere that I live and in Las Vegas, I found my spot once again. Its called Pops.

c2_6-Z3dXLhKcgFZ4s-fng.text: Got the chili cheese fries which were pretty darn good. Boyfriend and I got the provolone and steak sandwiches. The meat had no flavor and pretty much sucked. I'm thinking it would have tasted better with the cheese wiz because the cheese had yummy flavor to it. Definitely was on the pricey side for a sandwich.

JnLgju-NRro7gkWlKpQ95w.text: You know that place where you get an itch to stop by at random times of the day. This is it. I am not addicted to it, but it does my body good. Well priced compared to some other Philly's in the area. Worth a drive by and pick up!

97Naqvn6CkpsFsMnio1vfQ.text: As someone from the Philly area, driving by had me pretty excited. Pop's looks like Pat's! However, I got a cheesteak, with whiz, onions, and peppers- but they forgot the flavor.  Everything about it was bland.  I couldn't differentiate between the meat and the onions. It was weird. And the bread was awful- it was soft and did not taste like an Amoroso. Looks were most definitely deceiving. That said, the patio is great! And so were the sweet potato fries.

RfewvNK5_GpNvHCH35waiA.text: Pops. A Las Vegas classic. Open all the time. They have decent pub quality fried mushrooms. This is like an east coast cheese steak stand. Outdoor seating and no restrooms. Bring a jacket at night, you'll be dining on Decatur

1okMpFZYA8lm9erV34TnKA.text: Best Philly Cheesesteaks in the Southwest!  Atmosphere/cleanliness: Small and well-lit.     Service: Good and quick service.   Food: I was craving a Philly Cheesesteak and like a lighted mecca just off the 95 and Decatur, Pop's stands like lone gunfighter in the blistering sun.  Except this cowboy ain't packin' a Colt Six-Shooter, Pop's is packing meaty goodness wrapped in a tasty bread device.  I highly recommend the Philly cheesesteak with Cheez-Whiz!  The grilled onions and cheesy, oozy goodness will put you in an immediate good mood and cure any hangover.  Order it with some zucchini sticks and you have a meal that will leave a lasting impression.

nwDx_UCNhN0ekuxIy7gnsg.text: 24 hour availability.. these guys always get me after a night out of drinking... 4th meal for the win. QmrFqHwl-7IS3sY8X9TTYQ.text: Food was good.  Fairly plentiful.  But the prices are just way too high for what you get. The guy behind the counter was a jerk too.  I had never been there before and was trying to place an order for my disabled friend and myself.  It always takes just a little longer.  But the guy was impatient and rude. Had been driving by this place for ages and always wanted to stop.  Been there. Done that. Won't stop again. Guy behind the counter needs to chill out.

r5cJjnsBcLmnphFQnmg-jA.text: This place is open 24 hours. The menu is pretty big so there are plenty of options. We got 2 cheesesteaks, one order of fries and two drinks. There bill came to $27... Which may seem a bit steep for a roadside stand. But the food was good. Although next time I think I'll skip the fries. They were nothing special.

ecLLA7mVUGQEbL-DKrhB_w.text: Everyone has a different opinion about Pop's, after a three week craving for Philly cheesesteaks, I came here after work to give it a try. I can see why the reviews are so mixed. The flavors of the sandwich is delicious, but does it warrant the price? Yes and no.   The pros: The bread is soft and spongy with a toothy bite to it. The filling is cooked on a well seasoned griddle which picks up more flavor as the day goes on. The Cheese Whiz is plentiful. The fried zucchini were some of the best I have had. They are not freshly made, but the batter holds firm.   The cons: The meat and fixings was on the skimpy side. Some of the sides are worth the $3.95, but items such as the pretzel costing that much is ridiculous. Especially since they are so cheap to produce.   One item I am tempted to go back for is their breakfast philly. From 7am-10am, or something close to that, they run a special where it is only $5. That would be worth another visit.

E3gXqmVwYXlpjtdcrlNEPA.text: A friend in Vegas brought us here and ever since, we always come back for more when we come to Vegas.  My husband loves this place.    Coming late at night is kinda scary but we always come no matter what.  So good and yummy... Can't say no to POP's!!

tm0DjNx1nd_hDK02UM5ngA.text: The most legitimately Philidelphian Cheesesteak Joint in Las Vegas.  The way they select the meats for their sandwiches is superb. Fat and stringy beef, just like the ones in the East Coast when I was a child. When you chew your bites, the meat sort of falls apart and melts in your mouth. I have spent years trying to find the "right cheesesteak" in Nevada and California for ages.   The problem I noticed when it comes to ordering a cheesesteak in any place is not Philidelphia is that the establishment can't get the ingredients right. They usually love to bastardize the recipe with their "lean, organic, and fat free" ingredients that fuck up every aspect of the experience, the taste, texture, and even the look. I couldn't believe how many people can bungle a SIMPLE recipe of melt-in-your-mouth CHEESE... and steak.   A proper cheesesteak is a sloppy and messy one. Sort of like a Sloppy Joe, but cheesy. Its where the wrapping paper still has bits of that "cheese paper" still encrusted and stuck to the sides after you are done and you feel like you want to lick it off your fingers and the trash. Cheesesteaks should have a pungent, cheesy, and greasy odor that alerts the entire block within the vicinity of your possession of a good cheesesteak.   And many restaurants couldn't even get the basic concept of it right. I was about to give up in frustration until I looked online and found this place on Yelp. My first impression was, "You guys are full of shit", but I had extra money on me so I ordered a classic cheesesteak with fried okra.   After the first bite, I went into a epileptic seizure where I relived my best moments as a 6 year old, experiencing authentic Philly Cheesesteak for the first time as a kid. From what I was told by the hospital staff, the cooks found me lying on the sidewalk with yellow cheesy saliva foaming on the edges of my mouth, and paramedics picked me up to drop me off at Sunrise Hospital.   My diabetic stroke was worth it!

axcI8v7Dyunbiv0Lwq_HNQ.text: I give Pop's five stars, with great relief. I live near Pop's and pass it all the time, but had been reluctant to try them out. I am very picky about steak. In fact, I don't even like Geno's (sorry) and consider Jim's the only place for me whenever I'm in Philly.  For my first visit, I ordered the #32 mushroom & peppers with Provolone. What a hot, delicious mess! I'm glad I ordered it to go and ate it in my own kitchen. Seriously, the bread is a little too soft to support all the fillings. It was damn good otherwise, maybe needs a little mayo and/or ketchup for the "salt" factor. The meat seemed to be of good quality and I didn't end up gagging on any fat or gristle, thank god.   I will definitely be back for more, especially since I don't have to worry about the place closing before I get there. Open 24 hours and not McDonald's is a win in my book.

2JZKUTbk5-DpAKOBOfFoWw.text: Solid if you are in the mood for a pretty legit Philly Cheesesteak.  I would recommend splitting the sandwich and never tell your doctor about this great meal.  I had the philly with wiz, onions and peppers.  Friendly staff too.

P0MsW47NRN3WGeKeDyrN3w.text: My first time coming here was after a night of drinking with the girls.  The place is open 24 hrs! I ordered the #6 mushroom and cheese philly and let me tell you something i cant remember a single thing BUT that philly! great food & awesome costumer service.

FWBMyXGZrXSys6a23VqzoA.text: Closest come too real Philly Steak in Vegas. No question what makes its True east coast style  is the CHEESE WHIZ and really good bread. Now no east coast guy so have no basis just local boy from the islands. I do know is lot of east coast peeps one was visiting from the islands. Always told me the key is cheese whiz if its  not very good then just not real deal philly. It been years since I came here just cause out of the way from my house. Years go by but somethings never change. Yay!!  I had the works with mushrooms. onions, and without question get me some cheese whiz. The meat perfect thinly sliced, cooked perfect, moist, hot, and top it with saute mushrooms/onions. The icing on the cake or this case philly. Cheese whiz. Hot! Cheesy, and enough whiz that it never ending cheese whiz down till your last bite. Not only last bite but know good cheese whiz all over your hands. The bread has nice crust on the outside, moist, and fresh baked bread feel. Put it all together nothing better too soak up long night of drinking at 3am Vegas style. Reasonable price for late night or anytime grubbing. Philly True Philly no room for sides. They have lot of different sides too choose from and not only steak can choose too make Philly. Really is there any other way then steak?? Think not.  The atmosphere without doubt not only adds so much too Pops with no True seating just open patio area and ideal place too hang out talk stories with friends. It open late at night. It perfect spot after long night drinking, hang out open area one that no need worry about shout over people have conversation with friends, and bonus get best Philly desert every seen!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Philly with the works!

fC43bHMCHLRaGkliX65--w.text: Always love Pops!  The food is prepared right before you when you order it! So there's a wait but so worth it! The food is always good! Reasonably priced, it's noisy because it's outside on the corner or Decatur and Alta, so the traffic can be a bit much. But well worth it! Best chicken & steak sandwiches I've found so far!

I love that they are open 24 hours! Very convenient. Their menu is huge too. Never seen fried cauliflower on a menu before. Cant wait to try that next time.

oHgb9BIbHdG4jW3HlnlLmw.text: Folks who say POP'S uses Steak-ums are dead wrong. You can't cut Philly steak meat nearly paper thin unless it's almost frozen. Otherwise, the meat shreds. If these people had ever used a slicer they would know better. I asked the manager about the meat and he said it's prime sirloin. Most places give you a lot of filler in their steak, POP'S doesn't! That's why you might pay a little more but it's worth it.

TxKz89cBNJh557U7Fl3ycw.text: Great stuff.. stopped by on a whim and ordered a Pepper & Cheese (with onions).. it was ALL TIME!  The Bread was crispy on the outside & soft on the inside.  The meat.. very tender!  The veggies had great flavor!    Service was quick & efficient.  Great quality for the price.. I will go back!!

Eat cheese stake we we have had in a long time.  You have to eat outside and the temperature was 106, but it was even worth that.  They had fans and water sprayers to cool their guests off.  The onion rings and cheese fries were delicious.  Would highly recommend.

eGRwOCJ1R3ITP3DfNT74Mg.text: Hands down the best Philly cheese steaks in Las Vegas! Where to start.... The bread is authentic philly cheese steak bread! the chew on the bread is perfect, and with all the meat, cheese and veggies it's able to hold all the yummie ingredients and not get soggy. The meat is tender and seasoned perfect, the green peppers, onions and mushrooms are sauteed to perfection and and so full of that steak flavor. The best way to get a philly is to get the WIZ! they put the perfect balance of meat, cheese and veggies, i really have no bad things to say about the place, i have been here many times and have never been disappointed in my selections, they are consistant in their food and the customer service is great.

If you like horrible food, this isn't the place for you. Their fried mushrooms are really good, their cheese steaks are perfect! You get to choose from cheese whiz, american, or provolone. They have things like peppers, onions, mushrooms, chili, bacon, and more! It's 24 hours so that comes in handy. I don't like the location at all but it's worth it. You order through a little screen and get checked out a few steps away. The prices are a little higher than I would prefer, but you get what you pay for.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I love the look of this place!

o-9B06KZgu39lBimVLPZlA.text: July 2018 gotta go to this place...the philly cheese steak sandwiches are the best in vegas. So meaty and they do not skrimp. You can add items to the sandwich like cheese whiz, onions, mushrooms, etc...a little hole in the wall place with outdoor seating. Just fantastic and the staff is really nice too. No drive thru. So if you want a hearty sandwich for breakfast, lunch, dinner, take on the plane, take it for home lunch this is the place to go.

QEdiuYSdnLmhXvRbLMVVKw.text: Awesome cheese steaks.   Gotta get the cheese wiz with it.  Haven't had a chance to try anything else yet.   It's just that good

547DOJ3xFfNwOtLjXH8jEQ.text: I'm originally from Philadelphia and it is hard to find a good Cheesesteak just about anywhere but pops has it. the rolls are from Amoroso which is key to a good Philly cheesesteak, the meat was grilled to perfection and the peppers I had on it were firm and not soggy. they also carry Frank's black cherry wishniak soda which is unlike anything like it that you may have had before. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for an authentic Philly cheese steak. the price was a little high but I will chalk that up to being as far away from Philadelphia is you possibly can without being on the West Coast and getting your ingredients from Philadelphia costs more. I will definitely be coming back here as I drive for Lyft and have to eat out quite often. I will also be telling my riders that this is an excellent place to eat

Zje6i4EKbBZfDPbAZkVxPw.text: The most disgusting thing I've ever eaten in my life no exaggeration and it's pretty damn hard to mess up a Philly cheesesteak but it was really really bad

-Eeb45DlHMElCwvtkqmyOQ.text: After driving by for years we stopped by late one Friday night. I tried the number 32 I think, steak/cheese/peppers an onions. The last time I had a Cheesesteak like this was at Pats in Philadelphia. This was damn near exact what I remember. Very good. Wifey had the Pastrami. She reports that it was meh. Kinda plain. But it is a Cheesesteak joint.  The place it's self is all kinda nasty. It's perfect.  Will definitely return.
