Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wow

O2XAw_ZdI-ipKXl_EbtMvA.text: Pop's has the best philly cheese steaks in Las Vegas.  It's even better than any of the Philly Cheese Steaks I had while living in Philadelphia. AND Pop's is open 24/7.  The prices are reasonable and the service friendly and helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9ZSKWQ2sOziwQTDKHZM5mA.text: This is an exceptional place for a cheesesteak sandwich.  It's a sandwich shop people, it's not a 5  star restaurant. Makes me laugh when people voice opinions as if they were eating at such a place. I am from Chicago so getting a good hot beef sandwich is what the doctor ordered. And mind you, you could be standing on the corner eating it too. Keep up the good work and stay strong. Keeping up a business as long as you have says something. See you tonight, got the itch!! Lol

b9htzBmYxjcVM8F-cwYDLQ.text: this was the most delicious philly cheese steak i have tried it was so filling! Seriously, it might be tiny place but the taste of the food is so good!! Can't believe i've lived in vegas for YEARS always pass it going to meadows mall but it has taken me 12 years to finally try it i wish i would have tried this sooner! If the line seems long its ok the wait is worth it and the food is made pretty fast.

Jrk4_1gxxVuY5EYGuMfS8A.text: If you're from Philly, this may not be your 5 star place. But if you're from an island like me, this is a definite 5 stars. First of all, this is not a sit down restaurant. It's more like a takeout. They have sitting area available. If you come here on a windy day like I did, the best place is your car to chow down the food. This place is located close to downtown Las Vegas so don't expect Strip like atmosphere if you know what I mean.  We ordered #1 whiz philly cheesesteak and some sweet potato fries. There's no best way to get a philly cheesesteak on photo. It's not the easiest photo to take. But the sandwich was soft, meat was cooked just right with right amount of whiz cheese. Sweet potato fries were very different from other places. It was pale orangey color with light salt and fresh tasting. It came with cinnamon water that you're supposed to pour over which we didn't know until later.  They take your order on the left side and when your order is ready you pay on the right side. Make sure you tip because "the grill man can't go on a date." I'm assuming he doesn't have enough money. But whatever the reason is it's always nice to give some tip especially when the food is freshly made, excellent tasting, and cheap.

VyMGFzdIbSS4O3nVRAAmxA.text: 3rd time here and I have to say I'm pretty disappointed. Pop's has the vibe and look of a total dive local hidden gem but, without the good cheese steaks to go with it. I feel 3 times was more than enough opportunities for it to rock my word. But every one I've tried is just "ehh". Wasn't bad wasn't good. The shinning star is the staff. They always have smiles on their faces even though it seems really, really, hot inside their work space. If they don't have it, owner needs to step up and get them some AC, they deserve it.

-6eiceiifDTYNAlOv2ZrCg.text: Heard about this place from a work colleague. Went and checked it out; absolutely glad i did. Its all about the food and less about the frills.  The portion size is good and the price-point is ok. If i had one minor observation; the meat could use a little more heat in the flavour department.  Ive been back twice and will definitely be back again soon.

4AnmW9V120bqPXRp6kRM_A.text: Been driving past this place for many years and have always wanted to try it out! It finally happened! Popped my "Pops Philly Steaks" cherry and had a good experience. I got the #4and hubby got #2 and shared the chili cheese fries. Service was fast and staff was friendly. Besides the traffic noise and the summer sun setting on my face, I managed to block it out and we enjoyed our food. We'll try something  different next time.

3Gmbpg8SJf9n7_wHiCXqFA.text: Great food. Has a drive thru. Carries a variety of options for the desired style of sandwich you wish to eat. Great price. Has outdoor seating only. Great customer service. Clean waiting area.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I love that they care about sodium intake

kjYnV1QS2V2eqxDFymFZaA.text: Cheesesteak was absolutely horrible! $10 and fries are extra. Very little meat, but tons of onions, and peppers. If I wanted a onions and peppers sandwich I would have ordered that. Meat has zero flavor and very salty. Horrible frozen bread. Don't know how this place does any business. No indoor seating, so have to eat outside in 110 degrees or eat in your car. Stay away from this phony place from Philadelphia!

lDqy6hIYVOYdMhCdc7Op-w.text: Awesome food, but the amazing staff was friendly and engaging. MIKE was welcoming and engaging!   Thanks for great food and service!

FOp8MZbjwoHIAPfDn3v-BQ.text: Stopped by at 3am, food was great. Ordered fried mushrooms, fried okra, jalepeno poppers, mozzerella sticks, buffalo wings and #23 philly cheese steak sandwich.

Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried okra
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Philly cheese steak, muchroom peppers and onion (#23)

WKUO1psftXh_f8Q-t_9Z5A.text: Husband went here the other night and was served by Asante and Derek and he says the food was great!! He had the wings and fried mushrooms. He will be going back tonight for the Philly cheesesteak.

pACjAVhcHlkYhi6qZOCy7Q.text: My favorite Philly Cheesesteak place!  Being a west Coast guy all my life, I can't compare it to the "real" Philly, but this sandwich is good sized, has great flavor and a reasonable price.    The menu allows for many variations, including Cheez Wiz.    We also had fried Okra.  It was a good sized portion, properly prepared and fried, and had good crunch and flavor.   We took our order home as it's getting hot in Vegas and the outdoor seating can be less than enjoyable.   If you like Philly Cheesesteaks at a reasonable price, this should be #1 on your list.

PdMvoGZunCqGvxtX-3-WZA.text: I was craving a philly and cheese fries, as was the wife.  So, we made a special trip to Pop's yesterday!  The short story:  Service was excellent! The Philly with cheese whiz, onions, and mushrooms was so savory, and the cheese fries were equally as delicious!  Her Cheesesteak with provolone and regular fries was on point as well.  It was cheat day on the diet for me.  I gained some weight from the day before.  But, so worth it!!!!  Go to Pop's!

ewgio3UhzXgezoNBzTLB0w.text: Great food, solid service..   We got a Philly, wings, sweet potato fries, regular fries and the fried mushrooms.. all above expectations.. definitely coming back!

8YGnFl-5o-ffj8EIqkF-Fw.text: If you looking for a great Philly Cheesesteak or a great Pastrami sandwich, this is the place.  I'm from Cali, and this was my first time at Pop's.  I wasn't sure of the place, but decided to stop.  Let me say......the food was great, the service was prompt, and the people were friendly.  That says it all in my book.  I took my three grandsons with me, ages 14, 14, and 10.  The four of us thoroughly enjoyed ourselves munching on the Pop's fare.  I highly recommend Pop's.  I'll be hitting it up every time I'm in town.

cUwiiRO0dmffRD5NwJEHNA.text: Once upon a time I craved this place! Tonight was our first visit back in about ten years. I think my memories of Pop's outweigh what we got.  The menu is extensive, but they don't really explain much. We ordered 2 #4s, one with onions and mushrooms and one with just peppers, an order of zucchini and mozzarella sticks(oh hubby!). The ordering window is now covered so you can't really watch them make the sandwiches anymore.  We got our food to go and waited for our order. It is outside, so be aware of the noise from traffic on Decatur.  The sandwiches are not bad, though they forgot my mushrooms. Hubby enjoyed his mozzarella sticks and the zucchini wasn't too soggy. Overall, I think we'll wait a bit to give them another try. I miss the mushrooms!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

R7HVDg-VU0vExHzwlwBdrA.text: What's not to love?  Cheesteaks in every variety and customized to your liking. And they're available 24 hours a day.  I had the cheesesteak with mushrooms and provolone "wit-out" onions, but added pizza sauce.  Then I added fries and a drink.  And just like the famous places in Philadelphia, you eat outside.  (Truthfully, I'm not sure I'd do that in summer in Las Vegas!)  The cheesesteak was very good.  The fries were standard frozen fries, but they were hot and crispy, which is always a good thing.  The service is friendly and the food is good.  And with 24 hour walk up service, it's a great option for late night food in Vegas.

qtvn8iRCg53TQOlqhBeNxA.text: Is this Chinese food or a cheesesteak? Not very good. The meat is not chopped properly . This quality is not good. Waste of money. Pretty much my 1st negative review

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CbXwNT1ANaEl4FNdWmfPAQ.text: This is a very good place to eat at My fiyance had a Swiss Philly cheese steak and I had a turkey sandwich We also had fried mushrooms next time we're going to go-to breakfast

bqIeLls7q7i82oSZqDjsWQ.text: Definitely my favorite place to go for a cheese steak. Will drive the distance to go here! Be conscious that its is all outdoors so keep weather in mind, but absolutely worth it. Yeah, its pricey but the flavors are more than enough to satisfy that craving.They make the food right in front of you and they do it quickly. Their menu expands past  Philly cheese steaks and fries, I really love their Italian sub its phenomenal!!!!! And dont forget to order the sweet potato fries, they are served with an apple cinamon sauce that makes them over the top!

vgrpaVx8YnUb24iQnVb3rg.text: This review has been a year coming. I'd never had a Philly in my life, so my boyfriend decided to introduce me with Pop's. I ate a full cheese steak, an entire order of fried mushrooms, and then half an order of their fried banana bites (oh man, how I dream of those golden mouthfuls of deliciousness). Everything was absolutely killer, so much so that despite being stuffed, I was tempted to go back for another sandwich, you know, "for later." I was in love.  One housebound night several weeks later, I was hit with a cheese steak craving. I ordered in from the highest rated delivery place I could find and was promptly let down.  Don't get me wrong, it was okay, but nothing more. Since then I've tried half a dozen sandwiches from as many restaurants and as it turns out, I don't crave cheese steaks; I crave Pop's. They set the bar high and ruined me for other places.  Beyond the food quality, the atmosphere is great. Open outdoor seating makes a great place to bring a casual date or good friends. It's fun and comfortable, with great service.  The only negative I can think of is that once a line forms, it doesn't let up. But I can't fault the place for doing good business. If anything, it's a testament to just how good Pop's is.

ya3v_Kt1cfpCkmi-GF5wAw.text: Well ok food...poor pops they need to upgrade dinning area or at least clean it. I saw a yelp reviewer mention that they refried old fries when she ordered I thought that was probably not True. Well I watched them do the same thing with my order...omg I had a bad taste I. My mouth the rest of the evening. I ordered Philly steak sandwich wich was ok. I won't be back for a while. Also greasy sweaty guy sweating on top of the food he's making. Just gross.

dtU3Os7BLbP3eruEn0OA_w.text: Oh man! I wish they had this in Cali! Best Philly cheesesteaks I've ever had! Onion rings and fried mushrooms are on point!  Actually everything on their menu is delicious!  Great, especially after a night of clubbing on the strip!

cmOjtaBwt79y20CvC-1DLw.text: There are only a few things that I absolutely crave & Pops is one of them. A #2 (philly with cheese wiz w/sweet peppers is my all-time go to! Everything you want when you think philly cheese steak.

EHY9UvEp_Xqpy5omwNGpIA.text: i love cheesesteak...and this is probably gonna be one of the more authentic places in vegas.   I've been to a few in cali...but even their attitude is east coast here (not that i've ever been to philly haha).  I heard people ordering in philly on the food network...."with or without"  wasn't sure what it meant but i didnt wanna be foolish so i just said "with"  guess it means onions LOL.  I ordered the whiz cheesesteak and some wings.  they use the amarosa rolls from philly...shipped here from philly...and that is part of what makes the cheesesteaks good.  the wings flavor was pretty good...the wings themselves could be a bit crispier...but hey its not a wings joint...so good effort on the wings.  I hate the straws they use for their soda...thats my one beef.  i just noticed the coupon for 2nd steak at ,99 doh!  need to check with yelp more often!  seating is outdoor only...but has a neat back to the past feel....i wanna try their chili cheese pastrami next hahaha yummmmmm

LCkF6tRdzcae7UdSX2uI_w.text: I enjoy going to POP's from time to time in order to enjoy a nice cheesesteak. Unfortunately, their location isn't close to home or in a place I frequent very often. It is worth driving out of the way for, however, to satisfy my craving.  I always order the #2 Cheese Whiz Steak with onions. The gorgeous pictures on their menu always tempt me to order something different, but the memory of that gooey delicious cheese on top of tender steak just trumps all other urges. When it comes to sides, I've had the fried zucchini and the whiz wheels. The zucchini was alright. Nothing to write home about really. I didn't care for the whiz wheels. When asked what they were, they described them to be "like fries." They're nothing like fries. Rather, they remind me of Asian shrimp chips.  The service isn't amazing. Half the time, the person working behind the grill is very inattentive; doesn't really greet you and merely waits for you to order without saying anything. The patio eating area is a bit run down. The stools aren't the most comfortable to sit on either, but I guess it's part of POP's charm.

Q8gZA1GOhQdFzc_wY_KtOg.text: I ate here before but will never eat here again.   I should also note that my previous Yelp review of Pop's had been requested from Pop's! For a reward of  'FREE french fries' in which they did accept but that's just like cheating in my opinion. Where's the yelping officials on this one?  After working on the pops cheese steak truck for one day I realized this is not a steak and cheese at all. It's frozen meat "NOT FRESH" and they precook lots of that frozen meat and let it sit in water until ready to reheat for you to eat.  sound good I think not.   I won't get started on the sanitation of this place, pop's and pop's cheese steak truck must have it easy with the heatlh department because I don't even think he has soap on the truck for washing hands.   If I were you and looking for a steak and cheese I would look up other alternatives like some of these new food trucks around town like the "Yellow Lunch Box Truck" or "Food Slingers" in which they both serve fresh meat and it's even fresh rib eye. For a lower price as well.   The Vegas Villain

xUkv5CiaYY3OKcp1uxGKkA.text: With all due respect to the birthplace of the Philly, I find it hard to believe that anyone can top the sandwiches Pop's Philly Steaks has to offer! I've been enjoying Pop's since highschool and refuse to eat a philly anywhere else. They also have amazing Chili Cheese fries!

RJkpjpgHU8WzuXmDZlHgBA.text: Straight up the best Philly steak sandwich in town, and for as long as I can remember.  Purists get Whiz, but there's no shame in getting provolone.  Food is cooked while you watch.  The bread is perfect, soft but never soggy.  Wouldn't change a thing about this place:

yYgMT-kZHIwAep2mh8Dulw.text: Darn it, Wayne!  I wish i had read your review earlier.  I ordered the steak with whiz took a bite out of it and burnt my tongue ;(   Luckily I had a coke on stand by because it saved the rest of the meal :P  It's an out door eatery here, and the drive-thru order window is no more.  They have ceiling fan around the patio so air circulation is good.  The heat from tailpipe and cars on Decatur wasn't an issue, but the crosswalk bleeping noise was.  The steak are cooked already and sitting in a pan full of juice and goodness.  Once I order my steak they scoop a large amount and reheat it on the grill.  The steak was in the bread before I even paid.   Wow!  Came with a fork too.    Steak was good.. flavor was good, and the bread was really good!!  It was just enough, not too doughy.  Cost me about 10 bucks for a drink and steak with whiz.   Going to have to come back when I'm drunk to give it a real rating lol jk! :X

BHpdlKV5kAJmjFVm5DO0ig.text: I have eaten at all the legendary Philly cheese steak shop in Philadelphia... pats. Genoa. Jimmy on south street ...Tony lukes.... so I know a thing or two about a good cheesesteak. First of all you have to have good bread and pops gets there bread flown in from Philadelphia Amoroso bakery in Philly is the best bread around that area.. pops uses the best bread in town. The meat on a scale of 1 to 10 is a 6. .they don't use fresh rib eye meat. They give a generous portion. They could put more cheese on there steak sandwiches... All in all its a decent philly chesesteak.  The grill isn't to clean and I often worry about how long the meat is kept warm in that pan...they cook the meat in advance and it lays in a pan of hot water for who knows how long. The employees are friendly. One time they forgot to give me my receit and according to there sign that posted right by the window where u pay 4 your food if they don't give u your receit you get your food for free... What I told the person at the cast hurts if they forgot to give me my receipt at first he tried to give me the receipt but i said said no its too late so he had to give me a free sandwich he wasn't too happy.....

I7dMfh4V_zFgYPclAx443Q.text: first time there. bread was very good as the onion rings. the meat in my steak sandwich is a different story. I really wanted to give this place more stars. from my understanding, a proper Philly cheese should be made with rib eye steak. don't know what they used but it was just ok. not great.  all the effort on everything else just to skimp on the quality of the meat.

E5pLmOJKKv46JiJSyhIFGQ.text: Okay, the friends ravvvved about this place... and um, it was not up to par.   Apparently, it was a no-no to go on a Thursday night.   The Best "Grill Master" works on Friday and Saturday Night...  So, if you go, go one one of those days...   I must say though, the fried okra was awesome!

mTx08uTE5-DO2s_rwrNxlw.text: ooooh myy goodness..  This is THE BEST Steak and Cheese my husband and I have ever had.. Seriously.. it's an off the strip joint that has high top tables and stools reminiscent of the the 50's .. you can hear and feel the whipping air of cars and tour buses flying down the street.. walk up to the window, order from a board and watch your scrumptious creation being made before your eyes.  Talk about Mouthgasm at first and Last bite.. I said to Michael.. $9.95 for a Steak and Cheese?  I hope it's good.. I couldn't finish Half of mine.. the meat was piled High and so tender and well seasoned.. I had mine with the original cheez whiz!   Michael, who considers himself to be a Steak and cheese snob.. couldn't stop raving.. and believe me.. it's well worth the trip.. top it off with Fries that were nom nom nommy and Root beer.. well it was a couple of happy New Las Vegans  lololol   Vegans in name only ~!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1MQ23W1x1C4wrL-xiVLhxg.text: Ordered fried mushrooms and okra for myself and hot wings and fries for my husband.   *- Okra was really good but the mushrooms was horrible! It tasted as if the mushrooms were over-due or something. I also couldn't help but notice that everything wasn't freshly prepared. Everything was frozen until ordered.   -* husband likes the wings and fries. I didn't get a chance to try any because I was so disgusted with the mushrooms. Made me lose my appetite.

fs2oZBgedAL6OSwg6un84Q.text: Great hot sandwiches the cook makes it right in front of you. Best hot sandwiches I've had in Las vegas so far!!

jfK0-uxzOrJZXzUygATBRw.text: We had the fried green beans and fried sweet potatoes- excellent! Also the cheesesteaks were really good. Will definitely come back.

W5bkY0JPwDpnmYgrNB-vXw.text: This is the closest thing to an authentic Philly cheese steak that I've tried.  I ordered the Cheese Whiz ($6.99) with grilled onions.  Lots of meat flavor with the grilled onions.  I think getting cheese is a must for these Philly steaks because without it, it would be very dry.  A little pricey but it is a big serving and could be hard to finish by yourself.  Also ordered french fries ($2).  They were the thick ones and they were okay, not great.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese Whiz &amp; fries
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese Whiz w/ grilled onions $7

HHe8WSIPbCIiHLDDGJknaw.text: #32 Peppers & Mushroom Cheese Steak is grilled sliced beef with grilled peppers, onions, mushrooms, and your choice of cheese. This is the best cheesesteak I have ever had! I've had them in Philadelphia and, I have to say, POP'S is so much better. The meat is to die for! It is cooked to perfection - juicy and full of flavor. The vegetables are cooked with the meat so the uber beef flavor envelops the vegetables like a warm blanket. Just like Pat's, they served Cheez Whiz. If you're not a fan, try it on the side first. The provolone cheese melts to a gooey goodness and covers every bit. The Amoroso bread is wonderful. It has a sturdy crust on the outside, light and airy on the inside. It has a subtle french/sourdough taste to it which works great with the steak. Thumbs up, way up!

s4RdPvzN-fTZaKeAzTI8wA.text: I've been coming here with my own pops - a native Allentownie with high steak sammy / hoagie standards - since I was in grade school. Pops has always approved of Pop's. I'm 30+ now (sigh) but Pop's has stayed consistently amazing through the decades. The fact that they are open 24 hours is just icing on the cake.   I've been getting a "Pizza Steak" (Steak + Provolone + Pizza Sauce + Onions) since they opened. It was great then; It's great now. Feeds me for two days. Dad copies me a lot but also needs a hoagie fix every now and then, which he also loves. My boyfriend subscribes to the church of cheeze whiz. I don't do cheeze whiz on steak, but he swears by it. All in all: Whatever you get, you can't go wrong.

-j5Bn8kdL39_HIugQtmlJQ.text: this spot for sure has me coming back for more. might be a bad thing...  I've gone this spot a few times already, and haven't really had any issues. you for sure don't want to go when it's windy. since you order outside and get your food outside, chance is you'll find yourself sitting in your car eating.  the quality is ok, but the flavor is good, if not perfect. good juices coming from the sandwich, the flavors pop. if your into getting the whiz on the sandwich I would suggest just getting that on the side in a cup so you can just add it as you want...they a little heavy handed on that cheese sauce for sure.  but honestly, no complaints. got a fan here for sure

4OkXXJEdS6eqCsoKeTGgkQ.text: Still the best Philly Cheese Steak without having to purchase a plane ticket.  18 years in this town and I have not found anyone more authentic then Pops for cheese steaks.  Yes there are many places that claim they have a philly, but no one really has a philly other the in philly, however pops comes the closest to what I remember after living in Philly for many years.  It is close enough to make you want to go back to philly.  This place is good, they have a variety of cheeses you can put on and are even creative with some toppings.    Open 24/7 you cannot beat that.  One of the best an worth the drive to that side of town.  I will post a picture so you can drool....

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A Philly with cheese wiz &amp; onions along with sweet potato fries, YUM!!!!!

V9vhQ3Nw6c1MU7pEfQeQUA.text: This place is so amazing when it comes to Philly Style Cheesesteaks. If your from the east coast and just miss that real mouth watering Mom & Pops style Philly cheesesteak, then come here. Plus here they aren't stingy with the meat, trust me on that and you will be so satisfied. This is a must go to spot in Vegas.

DEzR3IsIUrfxlS7LjD0vWQ.text: I really wanted to like this place. And I really wanted a pastrami sandwich.  God knows I was craving since lunchtime. So dinner time came and I decided to pick 2 up for the wife and me. Well, the pastrami sandwich was as dry as the vegas air. NO MUSTARD, NO PICKLES and just a hard bread that felt was a few weeks past its fresh date. On top of all that, they were cheap on the meat too, which often most pastrami places over stack or give a good sizeable amount.  40 dollars, 2 sandwiches and 2 fries later wife and I were left very disappointed,  will not come back and I will not recommend this place to anyone I know. Just trash. Pass. Pass pass.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Here&#39;s the very dry pastrami sandwich no pickles, no mustard and stiff bread.

G9cGjr3ka8rSpcjJtfJtyQ.text: Absolutely delicious!! I loved the food and will definitely be back for more. The prices where a little high at $10 for each sandwich. They load the sandwiches up with lots of meat and whatever else you'd like. So they make it worth it... I usually get the pork BBQ sandwich and who ever I'm with usually gets a Philly cheese steak and we are all always satisfied!!

35ILIwOlpZuGeAnmGpM72A.text: My first time going here and it wasn't bad. The food came out quickly (since it was a cold sandwich) and it was fresh. It was my first hoagie since actually GOING to New Jersey and getting my first hoagie ever! It wasn't bad, but maybe my expectations were higher than they should be. I mean, we aren't actually in Philly so I shouldn't expect the hoagie to taste like we are. But it wasn't bad either. It was pretty good. But the price was a bit high for the quality. $10 for an Italian Hoagie was wasn't as big as the picture made it look and bread that didn't hold up well to the oils after time in the fridge But again, I might just have way too high expectations after having a REAL Philly hoagie.

LmXB7g31fcK7lld3cdx5Pg.text: This is my favorite philly spot in Vegas.Always super fresh and lots of meat and cheese!I would recommend this whenever you come through town.

uf_ecP5R7s9qNyKW9fKFaQ.text: Wow!  Just had lunch at Pops. We lived outside of Philadelphia for 9 years, we feasted on Philly cheese steak sandwiches regularly, sampling different ones around the city and surrounding area...and...drumroll....Pops was better!!!  We are huge Capriotti's fans and it just so happens their second restaurant was in Kennet Square, PA where we lived. We were thrilled when they came out west. So whenever we are in Vegas we eat there. We decided to try Pops on our way out of town today.  We are so glad we did. We had #32 with provolone. I can't stand fatty meat, I gag on it. This was perfectly lean yet tender and moist. I never thought I could eat the whole sandwich but I did as it was so delicious. A guy in line told me that their chili is great too. He goes there for the chili cheese fries.  Don't be discouraged by the appearance, it's a dive, yet all the tables were clean, etc.   Enjoy...we sure did!

x9MuYCSUtU2KlZuLcTArAA.text: First time going to this place. Love it! Had the pork BBQ sandwich. Totally worth $10. The pork was fresh and juicy and the sauce was just the right amount. Made fresh and very fast. I highly recommend it!

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pop&#39;s on Decatur
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ pork

iKYJUk4GMU1skUeslueBsg.text: Love this place! Came here one night and decided to try it because I always see lines of people.  It was pretty busy that night and I waited for a good 20-30 mins before they took my order.   We tried the peppers & mushroom cheesesteak and the cheese whiz cheesesteak. Also two orders of whiz fries.   We split the cheesesteaks in half so we can try both. I tried half of the peppers & mushroom and half of the cheese whiz. Peppers & mushrooms is really good, I recommend 8/10! Great amount of filling inside and bread was so good. All it needed was a bit of salt imo. The cheese whiz is really cheesy and good, but a bit too salty for me, 6/10. It can get messy because of the cheese.  Cheese whiz fries were bomb dot com!! 10/10  After paying, if you like hot sauce, make sure to ask the cashier for hot sauce because that stuff is amazing. I have a feeling it could be a hot sauce from a bottled sauce we know, but cant pinpoint which one. Either way, taste great in the cheesesteak & with the fries!  :-)

M_s-qRjwA2qXNnQF4COxnA.text: After strong drinks at Franks Tiki bar I was in much need of subsidence. There was only one place in this vast desert oasis that had what I wanted, no needed. I needed bread, Cheez wiz and steak. Fried mushrooms, and fried Mexican wagon wheel chips with more wiz had to be ordered it was the cure. Only Pops would do. (Wrote this still tipsy FYI ) So good.

Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagon wheel chips and wiz

JxyWgH7nAEMyqaF6Lz1rtA.text: Oh so good! Who can resist a mouth watering Philly cheese steak??? Great french fries and the fried mushrooms are bomb! Quite large and reasonably priced! Food is definitely quality and the workers are always helpful.... The menu can be a little overwhelming for the first timer but once you've been there you'll breeze right through it.... And don't forget this is Vegas and the guys surly do appreciate the tips!

Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Philly cheese steak provolone plain yes it&#39;s that good you can get it plain!

gHVrGBmkLFdhF7tVkDlSgg.text: Pretty good stuff here! I'm from Philly so personally I love this place. A pretty far drive from my part of town but it's worth the trip!

GrXtNU_gzFA9yPWzZbs4Vg.text: I always come to this place and the food is always on point. Friendly service and I like that you can see your food being made. I ny complaint is there's no inside sitting. When it's cold outside thou really can't sit outside and enjoy your food while your freezing.

5utVPToxll5wN3p4nTClYg.text: Just moved to Vegas from the Bay Area.  I've decided to hit the neighborhood spots. To find Vega's hidden gems.  I saw some great reviews about Pop's Philly cheese steak.  I just knew it was going to be an great food experience.  Ordered the #9 and the chili cheese  fries. As always when I have an negative review I never bash or criticize the food.  So since the mob was a great part of Vegas. I'm going to use an analogy from a great mobster movie. My experience turned out like Joe Pesci's experience did in the movie Goodfellas when they shot him in the head down in the basement. I just knew that Pop Philly cheesesteak was going to make me a made man. Instead I  got shot in the head and there was nothing I could do about it.

567jmT6haN23rtteBXMasw.text: This is a really neat little spot for the locals here in Las Vegas.  I finally got around to trying it.  Wish I had tried sooner.    You order at the window from the cook.  You can watch him make these wonderful Hoagies.   The wonderful onions, green peppers,  and mushrooms and your choice of cheese.    Their is seats outside to sit in to watch the traffic go by.   It is very colorful hand murals on the walls.  And the food is divine.  The meat is very very tender and the tastes is amazing.   I did not expect it to be so good.   Now I go about three times a month for lunch.  This is one of the best kept secrets in Las Vegas.

buB7nH8jl1kGaxjBNJX5Bw.text: Pops does remind me of the cheese steaks I used to eat as a kid growing up in Delaware (short hop-skip-and-a-jump to Philly). The rolls are even spot on! Of course I get mine with cheese wiz and add mushrooms - so good! I can usually finish about half - it is so big and full of meat and just messy enough so you really look like you enjoyed yourself!

vrwV15OAPA9my-0VS-P9iA.text: Geno's better stay in Philly. Best steak I've had so far in Vegas. Personally I got the cheese wiz madness but the fried shrooms were great with the marinara sauce. I gotta say it felt like Philly minus the cook kicking you outta the line if you didn't know your order.

Dnv_52NdrUy_NQGbAqeKog.text: I'm not known for being a cheese steak fan, but I do love cheese. Add in that this place is about a mile from home for me, and that it's 24 hours, and it's pretty much kismet that I would finally come here and actually really like it.  First off, its a bit  pricier than expected: spent $25 on dinner for me and the BF. As others have said though, the sandwiches are beyond huge enough to share.  We got the #32 peppers and onions cheesesteak with provolone ($11), added on sides of chili cheese fries ($4) and an order of wings (10 for $8), and a Franks black cherry soda ($2).  For the price, the sandwich and wings were good portions. I didn't think the same thing about the soda or fries though- but then again, I'm not a soda person in the first place, though I understand this brand is apparently something special.  The sandwich itself, in addition to being huge, was stuffed full of meat and veggies. The cheese was a little light for my liking, and it was slightly on the dry side toward the ends of the sandwich, but it was good. In the future, I'd probably stick to the mushroom one though. The chili cheese fries were fairly standard and a smaller portion than I expected but we still devoured them in record time. The wings, though, were a surprise. I ordered the mild ones rather than hot, and still found these to be surprisingly spicy. I'd definitely hesitate before ordering their "flamin'" style, I can't imagine how much hotter they must get. Portion was good for the price, wings were an average size without being too small or overly fried or breaded. Huge portion of ranch for dipping. I liked how easily the meat came off the bone, too. A little less messy than usual.   We ate at the patio area, and it was noisy and difficult to carry on conversation, as others have said. However, it wasn't a total turn off and in fact kind of added to the experience. I'll have to come back and try the sweet potato fries...and the breakfast sandwiches... maybe I'll add the Whiz next time, too.

Cez9JdCfiOQnl_YVWcnOPA.text: Pop's Philly Steaks are some of the best Philly Cheesesteaks in Las Vegas. This place is open 24/7 with very limited parking.  Pops Philly Steaks is located off of the 95/Decatur exit. A few blocks down, sits at a small intersection. There is a large sign for Pops Philly Steaks, so you can't miss it. There is limited parking, so, just be aware of the availability if you are coming during peak times such as lunch time during the week-day or dinner.  This is a order at the restaurant and pick up your meal when your name/order is called. There is a variety of tables and benches for you to sit on at Pops Philly Steaks. All table seating is covered as well, but just note that all seating is outdoors. It can be hot, especially, if you're going during mid-day during the summer.   My family and I ended up getting the following  [1] Philly CheeseSteak with Provolone [1] Philly CheeseSteak with Cheeze Whiz [1] Mozzarella Sticks [1] Fried Mushrooms [1] Chicken wings [7 count]  Both Philly Cheesesteaks had the meat, onions and cheese. Due to the type of orders, all of the food came out rather sporadically. The Philly Cheesesteaks came out first. I had ordered the Philly CheeseSteak with Provolone. It was delicious! I had tried my boyfriend's Philly CheeseSteak with Cheeze Whiz. It was amazing! Between the two, I actually preferred the Cheeze Whiz over the Provolone. It gave the Philly Cheesesteak more of a bang and added a variety of additional flavors. The bread was a perfect touch.   The Mozzarella Sticks were deep fried and not too loaded with the breading. The sticks were thin, not thick. We had received the order hot out of the kitchen, so the cheese was still melted and mixed well with their Marinara sauce provided.  The Chicken wings were really good! My daughter enjoyed them thoroughly. The wings were good sized, not too small and not too large. It was crispy on the outside, and not overdone. There wasn't too much breading and there was more chicken then breading on the wing, which is great as well!  The meal came out to approximately $40.00 which included [3] drinks and a bag of chips. Well worth the amount of food, and great food quality!

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KMidTRG_dRPsNwFuSaGi6A.text: As much as I hear about Pops, I was honestly expecting more.  Cost: 5/10 -- could be better, but also could be worse. Flavour: 6/10 -- if it weren't for the cheese wiz, the lack of flavour in the meat would be very obvious. Size: 10/10 -- I was able to split it into two separate servings.  They do have a wide variety of sandwiches to choose from and the cheese wiz is yummy (if they remember to put it on the first time).  I got mine to-go last Friday and it was about 11:30 at night.  The wait time was brief as there were only a few customers at that time, but I'd much prefer waiting longer to get what I asked for vs. having to drive all the way back to get it done the right way.  They offered me a new sandwich or a drink for the trouble, but 1. I don't like to waste food (I just asked them to add the cheese on top) and 2. I already had a drink that I purchased.  Hopefully next visit they will get it right the first time around.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #32 Peppers &amp; Mushroom Cheese Steak w/ cheese whizz.  Went back
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #32 Peppers &amp; Mushroom Cheese Steak w/o cheese whizz bc they forgot it

a32YQezNp9qoVDcZHN5WJQ.text: Open 24X7 it seems. Infront of the Arizona Charlies Decatur hotel.   Average price. Many options. We took chicken whiz But the taste is below average. Unlike other philly which we tried. Not recommended if expectations are high but good enough to beat the hunger.   Philly are really big and sometimes good for 2 people.

7vr_Jhh7EfnqZFLyd4W-kg.text: Pretty good spot. For Vegas to be a town of "sin", folks that don't sleep and party all night, its very hard to find restaurants that are open late and that are good at that. The customer service is good they help you figure the philly that you'll like. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars because the fries were soggy instead of crispy and philly didn't have any mayo. Maybe original Phillys don't come with mayo but without it, the sandwich is a bit dry. That's okay I'll request how I like it next time. I also look forward to trying the spicy cauliflower wings next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken philly, green pepper, mushrooms, and pepper Jack cheese

rSD9VWrPxbrvUsoGB4Ne8Q.text: Since we just had a breakfast buffet in the day before we decided to eat Philly cheesesteaks in the morning since Pops is open 24 hours a day. Philly cheese steaks #32 are good as usual. The fried mushrooms and green beans were also excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aDzkAEQE5aUtQ4dSHdaAjg.text: Awesome! You can just forget going anyplace else for jalapeno poppers w/ your super awesome, hot, delicious Philly. This place is over the "Top Pop!". Seriously good eats!

Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge! Yum, good enough for two!

qBgcYgaJxbviOL0AcWAA6g.text: So I have lived in Las Vegas 21 or 22 years. Lived all but one year on the west side of town. Going home after work I would always drive by pops and tell myself I need to try that place. So after 20 plus years, tonight I did. The outside patio is cool and has a old school vibe to it. The seats would be something you find at a 50s diner. For my first time, looking at the selections wasn't daunting. I ordered the number 7. Basic cheesesteak with peppers and onions.....I decided to eat it outside. Yeah was still 102 out, but didnt feel that bad. My order was ready within 10 minutes. The service was good, friendly. The cheesesteak was pretty good. Peppers were a little sweet, but the bread was great and the meat was tender and juicy. My fries were cooked right, and it was a good meal. Seemed a bit pricey, but I'm all about supporting local businesses. Good food, good vibe, and good decision I ate here finally before I went home.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesesteak and fries
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Patio
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Popular place

pGxcC4as6QqSwQbHCnwWyQ.text: I've been to pop's twice now and twice my order  was incorrect. No employee seemed thrilled to be at work the night I went and it was dead. This second time around it was a simple order 2 philly's, 2 fries and came with no fries and when I had to wait it took a little over 4 mins and finally took it out the bag and they were soggy and a little undercooked. Overall I'll be okay not returning to Pop's. Save your money!

By8bqmrZkiaKmrRmomz88Q.text: This tiny cheesesteak stand is hard to miss and I have driven past it for years. Finally stopped by and I see why there is always a line outside. Good food at a low price.   Important info: parking is a pain. Outdoor seating only. Always because of their ordering system. The line does go pretty quick though. Not good for more than 4 people in a group because the stools and tables are all stationary so you can't get together. A group of 6 of us went and a few of us stood around the table but it was tight.   All that aside I thought the food was very good. Cheesesteaks either the best or very close to the best in Las Vegas and for $8 or $9 (depending on the toppings) you can't beat it.   The steak was really flavorful and with cherry peppers and onions on a really solid hoagie roll was a solid move. I could easily eat one myself, but my wife and I could have split one and shared an appetizer.  Speaking of appetizers:  Mozzarella sticks were about the same as low quality frozen ones.  Buffalo cauliflower bites were surprisingly good. I don't usually enjoy cauliflower, but these were really good.  The pretzel with orange honey butter was interesting. The pretzel was still cold so not good there. But the butter was delicious. If they had just cooked the pretzel so I could dip the warm pretzel in that yummy honey butter I'd be all about that, but the undercooked and still ice cold pretzel wasn't appetizing.  All that said if I needed a late night quick bite in the area I'd stop by and get a cheesesteak and fries. I don't think I'd make the 20 minutes drive from my house or go out of my way, but I'd be happy to go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretzel
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesesteak with onions, cherry peppers, and provolone
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orange honey butter

Z1EduvC7QXlWoRGG3n9ETg.text: A late night Philly never hurt anyone. It certainly didn't hurt me. . .  Pops is delicious. Classically, I ordered a Philly with Whiz and Onions (just like I would in Philly). The bread was soft, but not too soft. The cheese, cheesy and gooey. Onions cooked well and it all tied together for a fantastic late night splurge. My only complaint was the the cook went heavy on the salt. Doubt if its a continuous thing . . . just that night he shook the container too much.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Whiz with onions

sAtZ1Seizi5jEqy3h7Zs_g.text: This place has to be one of the best sandwich places in Vegas. Every Philly is amazing. I had the traditional Philly with Cheeze Whiz and it was piping hot but so delicious I lost some tastebuds but well worth it. Many times the meat can be dry but not here. The sandwiches are made right in front of you when you place the order. Awesome fact this place is open 24 hours.....get your fix any hour of the day....it is Vegas after all!

zagBOlTNEiTyMYraT5ApJQ.text: The best Philly Cheese State ever....and fries  and, and, and!   Nothing bad and the service is extraordinary!   Everything on the menu is really good and fresh!    Even the cheesecake!  Save room for the cheesecake!

0ceKwlFJpSsWh8qn2Z6Xwg.text: Like everyone else, I drove past this place a bunch of times. Finally I gave in and stopped by. I am glad I did. There were plenty of options to choose from. I ordered the #32. Steak sandwich with green peppers and mushrooms. The taste was there(soft bread, flavorful veggies, and seasoned meat), the size was good, and the price was fair(cheaper than Jimmy Johns,Jersey Mikes,and Port of Subs). Alexis and the guys provided great service and the wait time was not bad for a fresh, made-to-order sandwich. I will definitely be back to try other options on their menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #32 steak with green peppers and mushrooms

2msQc8a_RtMmbehXj7zmhQ.text: Heard about this spot thru my sister in law and it had to be a spot we hit up wile being in Las Vegas. Definitely worth the trip off the strip. the guys and ladies working we're super friendly and curtious and made us even ordering our food and awesome experience.. definitely making this a new spot to come to ever trip we come out here.. do yourself a favor and try them out!

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Philly cheese steak

evyq9qNFXAqbYoDPPC9BPA.text: My first time here and my experience was fantastic. #6 was excellent. Great staff great food fun atmosphere great place to stop and eat outside especially during a long bike ride!

uFkscCIoB61TnIPUwT6ffw.text: For authentic Philly Cheesesteaks, POP's is the best place to fill your cheesesteak craving, whether it is at 12pm, 4am, or whenever since this place is open 24/7. This popular local joint sits on the corner of Alta and Decatur. It is really hard to pass it with its vintage looking POP's sign that sits on top of this corner stand. The parking lot is small so be prepared to park on the street or wait for parking during busy times. Everything is made to order and you can peek through to watch the grill master at work. Beware, it gets pretty hot though. There are various cheesesteaks to choose from and side dishes such as sweet potato fries, fried okra, fried cauliflower, zucchini sticks and many many more. For those who want their cheesesteak fix but want to be a little healthier, they have a cheesesteak salad so you don't have to feel too guilty. And if you can't decide, there are pictures for all you visual people. PRESENT! After you have ordered you can enjoy the sights and do some people watching from their outside seating area. There are some high tops and low tops. During the summer days there are misters so you don't have to eat in the heat. Prices are more than reasonable since the cheesesteaks are enormous.   Tips: Please tip the grill master as he has no friends and can't get dates. (That's what the tip jar says anyways).

nX7BpGBGjpTCIHvHszUoLQ.text: Why have I never been here before? I pass here all the time. Stopped in today. Best Philly in Vegas! I got onions, peppers, mushrooms, and cheese whiz on mine. So messy! So good! My boyfriend got BBQ pork and fried mushrooms. I tried a mushroom. Good stuff! Came with ranch dipping sauce. Only thing I would change would be sink to wash your hands lol! Great Covered outdoor area to eat your sandwich. Lots of fans keeping you cooled off! Very friendly staff. Speedy service. Clean! Would eat here again for sure. Sooooo good!

GVXOvtzhDVoMOv_QxFD6YQ.text: I was excited to try this place because I haven't had a real philly since I been to philly drove by today and decided to try since I wanted the meat to be the star of the sandwich I ordered a philly plain with onions and light wiz the sandwich was meh it had pre made meat not fresh rib eye like I expected bread was soggy and it didn't really have any flavor would I order again probably not on the plus side they have philly water

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tXcTK8ebjqNebucWwuowkQ.text: Good Philly!  Had me the reg with mushrooms and provolone cheese. Props all the way from TX!

dQOtLctwZEcRufx7dvRqTw.text: The cheese steaks are amazing. Open 24 hours. A hidden gem in Vegas. The food comes out fast. Pops carries Tasty Kakes and they are a treat. The prices are very good.

h6Wp5iEqRTYjkSrFq74kxg.text: As a life long Philly resident and recent transplant to Vegas, I'm searching for a great cheesesteak. Pop's gets points for using Philly Amoroso's rolls and offering Cheez Whiz, but misses the mark with the meat.  The texture of the meat is totally off.  Paid about 8 dollars more than the same order in Philly.  Close, but doesn't quite make the mark.

JXq5s4S42MH3OtF6B3dF5Q.text: Cheese steaks in multiple varrieties.  Not bad food but I thought it was a little pricey...a little over $11 for one cheese steak and a soda.

fKSu2xbE21nEE9WSY_TUdg.text: awesome philly cheese steak, I am from the east coast mid Atlantic area and Pop's has it on lock down for cheese steaks. it's well worth the trip to try this place out. Also they have tasty cakes... Another mid Atlantic staple for a sweet. thanks Pop's for being out West

ry-CYrCUpMxeV11wC4NbPw.text: *sigh*  I really wanted to love this, but it was just ok.  After reading all the positive yelps and testimonials on Pop's website, I was expecting a fun and delicious experience.  I imagined myself giving my order to a gruff but charming grill master, who would ask me 'wit' onions? in an authentic Philly accent.  What I really got was a grill master who was just gruff and apparently couldn't hear my order, because when I got my cheese steak home, there were no onions on it at all!     Ok, the cheese steak itself:  the meat was not fatty or greasy, but slightly bland.  I enjoyed the cheese whiz and the bread was very good.  I think if they had included the onions, things would have been tastier.  Also, in the hours since eating the steak, I have been a bit 'indisposed', but this in and of itself has never been an index of whether I would return to a place if the food tastes good.  (masochist!)  So all in all, I think I would try it again probably.  But I'll also try their competition in town and yelp the results.  :)

jJeaYl7QGKoPjYdQ52hvwQ.text: BOY!!!! This place is off the chain. Open 24 hours? Man you can't beat that. I simply LOVE this place. Why the 4 stars you ask, well for one thing I really didn't like their pastrami fries and yes it was enough to bump it down one star. For one thing I strongly believe that if a business/restaurant deserves 5 stars, you better believe that everything they serve and their customer service is top notch. And I failed to believe everything on the menu was good, but you better believe that their philly cheese steaks are probably the best I've tried in LV and in the Bay Area.  The first time I was here I ordered the philly cheese steak with bacon and swiss #9. It was just as good as advertised and just as good as it looked while the cook was making it. I also ordered the cheese whiz fries and boy was that also yummy. I also ordered fried 'shrooms, and those little mouth watering bites were simply just awesome. It was the first time I tried anything mushroom fried in batter, and I was damn glad this place was my first. The second time I ate here I ordered the pizza philly cheese steak.....mmmmm, was that yummy it was like ordering on of my two favorite things and smashing it into one nice juicy hoagie. I also ordered cheese whiz fries again, but this time I had the master cook add some bacon in it, man was that good.  If I really had more time to spend in Las Vegas, I sure would come here a few more times and try more off the menu. I also love the fact that this place is open 24 hours. With me being on Vegas party time and coming home about 3 or 4 in the morning after the casino, this place just becomes a savior.  Thank goodness for Pops Philly Steaks open 24 hours and its yummy juicyness of flavorful cheeeeeeese steaks. Keep up the good work guys, when I'm back in town you better believe I'll be back for more! It's like philly cheese steaks from heaven. YUM!

X6Gxu9CR7-Ue_gNG9VXyVg.text: I did not eat here-my fiance did. He loved it! He is a big cheesesteak fan and critic and it passed his test!

gkW_U5p8-L7IorULJSJfng.text: Honestly, better then cheesesteaks in philly. And I am from the east coast and have been to Gino's and Pat's. The ONLY place to get a cheesesteak in Vegas is here and its open 24 hours too.

D4sGqfXeCmq1aJ-FA8aBkA.text: The Menu is vast and clogged with cholestrol filling items. It was right up my alley. Love that its open 24 hrs. Wish the drive thru was open though.

iCf58WjCQNAQqNzyfOC0dQ.text: This place is downright delicious.  I was craving cheese steaks as soon as I came back from philly and this place came recommended as one of the best in las vegas.  It's the only cheese steak establishment I've ever seen in sin city so I thought I'd give it a try and I'm sure glad I did.  It's just a really good cheese steak.  That's all there is to it.  The bread is soft but not too soft.  The steak is cooked just like it would be in Philly and the toppings are plentiful and tasty.  There's also many different variations to choose from like the cheese, peppers, onions, and what kind of sauces you want on it.  I always go steak 'wit' provolone, peppers and onions.  Writing this review right now makes me want one.  I guess I'll have to settle for Philly's Best tonight, but that's another review.

rlL1enBk1uOcZABXnP_WGA.text: The only reason that they don't get 5 stars, is because I was expecting it to taste just like it does in Philly as they use the same bread, meat, and cheese. It didn't,  but it was still delicious and I will continue to eat here!

PfELO5WrBtelb0ip7a1m4g.text: Tried this place a little bit ago. The guy was nice and was helpful in my decision, but unfortunately was not wowed. It was not bad, but not great for me to go out of my way for a second trip. But again I like super flavor and they are probably catering to masses. I can see this as a great place to hit up during a night out.

DGFLhPHKtUimAhQ7etftYA.text: In Vegas for most of May working at the House of Blues. One of my buddies was jonesing for a philly cheesesteak. All ingredients are shipped from back east, the rolls are perfect! Excellent cheesesteaks, Steve was the grill master du jour, nice job! They even have Tastee Cakes!

whSGwQEKDKQNmOysHC0J-w.text: Finally, I've found a cheesesteak place in Vegas that gets it right. Wiz, Amoroso rolls, steak and onions. Classic.  Pop's even has the look and feel of an authentic Philly Cheesesteak place: order at the window, outdoor seating, food served in baskets.   No question about it, if you're looking for authentic Philly cheesteaks, this is the place. Anyone who doesn't like these sandwiches also wouldn't like Pat's or Geno's or Jim's from Philly.

4UKpar4S96dQPF9ok0U1Ew.text: It's good and the sodium levels are not as high as other places. You can really taste the flavor of the beef but if it cools down then it'll start to taste kind of bland, it's better to eat it right away while it's hot. I love how it's 24/7 and the staffers are friendly. I usually get a #4, #6, #34 and I have yet to try # 32. If you want an awesomely tasting cheese steak but without the added sodium (salt) then I would highly recommend POP's.  Sometimes I get the Chilli Cheese fries with pastrami which is also good but can make you kinda heavy.  Some say the cheese steak is bland but that's because there isn't as much salt like other places which can really alter the flavor/taste of the cheesesteak., so if your lookin out to have more foods with less salt then I recommend this place.  I don't think the drive through actually works to get your order, I mean I went to POP's like 33 times and it doesn't look like they actually take orders in the drive through, if they did, i'd probably give POP's another star.

bemek9Q0YNdUQrHnQLEyng.text: As someone who grew up in Philly....not impressed.  Pop's gets props for the Amoroso rolls, but the cheesesteak was completely flooded with cheese whiz and overall lacking in flavor.  I love the building though (it's an old converted Wienerschnitzel) and the neon and logo.  They do have Tastykakes and Frank's sodas (!), so if you are craving some Black Cherry Wishniak, Pop's is your go-to place.  I'll try Pop's again maybe and get the provolone instead of the whiz, but my initial assessment is that there are better cheesesteaks in this town.  Most of the other reviews already have the alternatives covered.

HlN_5Wde17T4Mj0Vsiuvtg.text: Ok I have heard many great things about pops and I'm sure it's just as great as the reviewers say!  I went to pops yesterday to get a Philly steak and I  observed that they have a wide variety menu. I was starting to order and notice that they use the same spatula and grill for the pork and the steak which was a complete TURN OFF!! I don't eat pork at all and I haven't in 7+ years other than that give it a try but if your like me you will pass

je8c828HtKry5pJ1lPhpwg.text: If review was based on taste alone - 5 stars  But they lose a star for no indoor seating and for the staff being kind of blah. By kind of blah I mean they weren't necessarily bad but they weren't great either. I understand its a small place to not have indoor seating but if you are going to only have outdoor seating you need to have a drive-thru too in my opinion. I went on a pretty chilly day and had to stand outside to wait for my cheesesteak. Worth the wait for sure but they would probably do more business if you could sit or even order indoors. I don't know about you but I don't exactly enjoy standing outside when its 30 degrees in winter or 120 in summer. And when its windy and you are trying to eat outside everything is blowing all over the place. They aren't something you really want to eat in your car either (can be messy).   The Philly Steaks are by far the closest I have had to Philly out here. I'm from the Northeast and these are pretty close if not right on the money (its been a while since I've been to Philly).   Overall - looking forward to my next visit but I will make sure its a nice day out.

fsog0Ljwa0qyW4gUk-fqMw.text: I would give this one star - except it's one of the few Philly Cheesesteak places in town.  Meat was dry and underseasoned.  Bread was decent.  Just no reason to ever go back.    Don't know why you'd serve a sandwich with meat as dry as this.

DMELyxeA9hAluzc_L_5SRA.text: The best Philly I've ever had and I am not a huge red meat fan.  The sandwiches are huge my 2 teenage boys have a hard time finishing these so who cares if they're a bit pricey. Dang now I'm craving one!

h0GUwG_VMD7ZWAW529TQ4Q.text: Not sure what has happened to Pops, I hope they get back on track.  I don't like being to negative so I won't say what I think about my last sandwich here.  Let's just say one star Is what they have become.  The Philly's here are good, one of the better places in Vegas.  I usually get the Cheese Wizz Cheese steak with mushrooms and onions, along with a side of cheese fries.  They have a decent size menu with  cheese steaks, chicken philly's, hogies and more along that type of food.  The only set back is outdoor seating, not to nice mid summer and in the wind.  I suggest take out much better in front of a good sporting event.

yMP11VamSqP37QNivz1U0A.text: I have been in Vegas for more than seven years and I just tried this place few weeks ago & Definielty knew what I missed out on. Best part about this spot is it's 24/7 & and there's no drive-through, you actually got a park your car and go up to the front and order from 13-15 different things off the menu. I tried the pops famous Philly cheesesteak with jalapeno, pepper jack cheese, grilled mushrooms & onions. The best Philly cheesesteak you could ever have in the Southwest. Very authentic, you can definitely taste the freshness. Prices are good. I think I spent around $12 after-tax buying a bottle water along with the cheesesteak. Must try place in Vegas. Definitely will fill you up.

4cQkHHPD3qoERnhEV8_ZFg.text: Best cheesesteak I've had, very good and nicely proportioned.    It's been here since forever, so you know it is good if they are still around.  I usually order the cheese wiz with onions, even though I don't like onions, they are very sweet and tender.  They also have some of the best chili cheese fries I have had.  Give em a try and see if you agree.  Only bad thing is the fact that it is 100% outside, so if the super hot, crazy cold, windy, rainy, etc weather that we always seem to have, it's not a very good place for lunch or dinner.  But when the weather permits, have a philly!

KT3tYvP3ssfMvghMWwTcrw.text: I am not experienced as to what makes a good Philly cheesesteak.  About all the ones I have had are lacking flavor for me, so I have never been a fan.  But the ones here are pretty good.    I would go here more if it wasn't in an area I loathe driving to, but that is probably a good thing as these are very bad for me.  This is another area of Vegas where I'm afraid to get out of my car.  The huge iron fences on the windows when you order from here says it all - this neighborhood is crap.  Don't kill me people but, I am not a fan of the cheese whiz on these sandwiches, as I think it completely ruins the flavor.  But I am a fan of provolone.  One thing I should mention is that they had soft pretzels on the menu when we were there last time.  My husband, who orders soft pretzels pretty much everywhere he goes wanted one, and was informed him they took these off the menu, because no one really orders pretzels at a cheesesteak place.  They went in back anyhow and dug one up for him and warmed it up with some of the cheese wiz on the side.  Very cool of them to do that.

cEwJGIxJwVIxDzVdmAM94A.text: Excellent bread, excellent LEAN meat (I hate it when I get a disgusting piece of fat in there...none to be found at Pop's!), and the same traditional toppings as you'll find at Pat's or Geno's right in the city of brotherly love. I love that there is no indoor seating (it's in an old Wienerschnitzel building) because it adds to the character and uniqueness of the place, which I am always on the look out for. The sides are not the best or the cheapest, but hey, you came here for the sandwich.

11r61dTx2nQ5Vwd6rB9-Fw.text: One of my favorite in sight hidden gems. For years people drive by this place and shrug it off. Do yourself a favor and stop in and get a 32 with Cheese Wiz and a side of breaded mushrooms. You will hate yourself for eatting so bad, but it tastes so good.

Zs60gDf-OabrtM05qfdCPA.text: Pretty far off the strip but definitely hits the spot after a night of drinking and clubbing.  They are also open 24 hours.    Plenty of cheese steaks on the menu, made a variety of ways.  We tried the cheese whiz steak, provolone, american, the hoagie, 3 cheese and chili, the chicken steak, and the bbq pork grinder.    I personally liked the bbq pork grinder the most.  The bbq sauce was addicting.  Then the 3 cheese and chili cheese steak since it had so much flavor.  About 10 dollars per cheese steak so not the cheapest you can find but definitely worth the trip out here and cost.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hQOg6zsxxKd6_hKNy5c9Cg.text: I'm not sure how many stars to give this place.  I enjoyed the employees they were very pleasant but the food was very average.  Not the worst cheesesteaks I've ever had but in the bottom 5.  Not enough cheese or flavor.  At $10 it's way too expensive for extremely average food.

jYgH7dILE2M8zvfjh6OCZQ.text: Probably my favorite drunk food of all time. I've lost count of all the 3 a.m. stops Papa D and I have made here to get our favorite #2 - a cheese steak w/ whiz, just like they do in Philly.   We even had our Christmas Eve dinner here two nights ago, much to our kids' delight.  It may not look like much, but they make some tasty cheese steaks!

i1IDFruzkqYngGkBd6j4Uw.text: The chicken philly was over priced and under seasoned.  We paid $22 for 2 sandwiches and we were not impressed at all.  The Cheese Wiz was only on the top of the sandwich not on the bread.   The bread was dry and the chicken was bland.  It was a big let down.

eFOpLjHtFFkpmaoGX2RKjA.text: If you're looking to spend a lot of money for mediocre food that compares to what you can expect from the fresh sandwich selection at a gas station, this is your place. I'm not opposed to paying a premium for premium food, but that's not what happens here.   The place looks pretty dirty, the people working there have zero personality, and the prices are absolutely outrageous. Do your self a favor and keep on driving the next time you're in the neighborhood and thank me later.

btFTYmIlNBBFnjXAzFUj9w.text: Wow how dare this place have the nerve to call themselves a Philly cheese steak place!!!!!   I WOULD NEVER EVER EVER EVER EVER GO BACK HERE!!!!!!!!!!   YUCK   There "Philly steaks" are tasteless its like eating bread filled with wood horrible. I was so pissed off because by driving by it looks like a place that would have great food and its always busy, So i decided to try this place I felt ripped off it was way over priced for lousy food.   PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE, do not eat here if you like good food especially if your use to traditional Philly steaks!

iEZ9SWO61wpNoS1mKj2c8Q.text: Sandwiches were good fries are ok. The banana foster was really good the service was a little slow but not to bad they didn't ask if I wanted something to drink if you like eating outside in the hundred degree weather then it's worth going for a lunch but don't expect anything special

WbDht6HKVvBQjP-GbVSOuw.text: If you like authentic cheesesteaks you will be happy with this place. A bit overpriced

RFfHLNNmEdth1dqpgznvnQ.text: I always see this place while driving over to my bf's house and I've always wanted to stop by and try it just because the big POP'S sign really stands out.   I came here with my boyfriend a few nights ago to try it out. There was nobody there except for one worker who was cleaning up the eating area.  We walked over to the menu to figure out what we wanted. We decided to get the #32 (mushroom/bell peppers/steak/cheese) to share with a side of chili cheese fries. I liked that you could watch the person making your food for you, there was even a sign that invited you to do so. The guy made our order pretty quickly and we took a seat at one of the high tables.   First we tried the chili cheese fries, which was delicious. I love cheese whiz! Then we both took half of the cheesesteak and began eating. I knew it was Bomb after the first bite. It tasted even better after I stuffed some chili cheese fries in it! Yes, I know that sounds unhealthy, but I don't care! lol.  All in all, this place was good. The worker could've been more engaging though. He didn't talk or smile at all, which made us not want to go back to the counter to order dessert. We just felt like we were bothering him or something, even thought there was no one else there.  I'll definitely come back next time I'm in need of a late night bite!
