TbOYvuknTV368gyAmB0yZw.text: Benn coming here since the 90's & never have had a bad sub. For steaks, I order a #4, always great. For breakfast, you can't beat their bacon & egg hoagie. Sooooooooo good!!!

e3K_rKqcGYh9TMez5M9oaw.text: ever since moving to las vegas, i've been scrambling to find substitutes for many of the places i used to eat at in the bay area... one of them being a place to buy a good cheesesteak. back home, i had the honor of being able to eat at the cheese steak shop, with locations all across the bay area... not to mention amato's in south san jose, which quite possibly has the best cheesesteaks you can get back home.  my search has lead me to pop's. this spot meets my expectations based on my sensibilities... which is, i enjoy a good cheesesteak, though i've never had an authentic one in philadelphia. pop's offers a cheesesteak with cheez whiz (which is apparently what they use in the authentic philly joints)... which is good, but i easily prefer the cheesesteak that uses american cheese... and the one's that pop's serve is definitely on point.  in one of my visits, i ordered the three cheese and chili cheesesteak. and let me tell you... that particular menu item is absolutely evil. it's one of those things you can eat that's so flavorful, but you know it will wreak havoc on your internals. i'm not having that again for a loooong time.  that being said, i'll definitely be eating here on a fairly regular basis, and i recommend this spot to people who aren't too much of a cheesesteak snob.

9byaYsxQK_6sBXJILa_bBA.text: You're supposed to go for the whiz, but I was wooed by their patio. There is no interior dining here, and no, the patio is not fancy, but while I was chewing on my wonderfully soft hoagie stacked with meat and cheese, I couldn't help but admire this mildly grimey but charming outdoor eating arrangement. I felt like I was on an adventure in another country, anonymous, unable to speak the language, and unexpectedly eating a Philly cheese steak. It was wonderful. Sometimes a place just transports you, and for some reason Pop's was that place on that Saturday afternoon.  I admired their plethora of fried offerings from okra to green beans to mushrooms and zucchini. Alas, the only thing I could sell my husband on were the sweet potato fries. I didn't want to consume an entire heap of fried okra alone, so we went with those. We shared a steak hoagie with American, not whiz, and onions and peppers.   The sandwich was solid. The star was definitely the roll. And, the sweet potato fries were as good as any I have sampled, especially because they were served so hot that I could feel my fingers melting beneath the wax paper. I was tempted to pour their magic coconut water sauce all over them, but I showed restraint. If you are braver, definitely pour away and let me know the results.   I of course adore the building and the fact that they are open 24 hours. I am sure we will have a 3am cheese steak sometime in the near future, and when it gets cooler, I will definitely go back for the unexpectedly charming patio.

vaMMQ3PPy507Tcy0In4K5w.text: Been going to this place for years....... Hadn't been there in a long time and happened to be on Decatur today and we stopped by........ We should have just gotten one hoagie...... We split one and that was more than enough for both of us, ended up saving the other one for later..... Not a fan of fried Okra but we had some anyway, it was so so, I prefer the zucchini .. Don't understand the complaints about the prices, i think for what you get its fine.....We didn't bother eating outside since it's too damn hot this time of year, so we just brought everything home and it was pretty darn good.... We'll be back for more next time we're on that side of town........

4xJJ484N1IaLHWjudO8mVg.text: We swing by pop's every couple of weekends and it's always delicious.   The sandwich is huge and always stuffed!!  My favorite is cheesesteak with extra wiz, mushrooms and onions. Simple and deilicious.  Their fried okra is also tasty!  I would definitely recommend this place.

ytTXxhcUUmMVj3bfWextPA.text: If your hungry at 1, 2 or 3 in the morning and don't want to spend over $10 for your meal, well look no further. POPS is open 24 hours and the sandwiches and sides here are just so yummy!!!!  The sandwiches are made to order, and are great! I usually get the chili fries or deep fried okra as a side to go with my sandwich.   It's an outdoor walk-up orders type kind of place. Open outdoor seating. It's in a convenient location near Meadows Mall, right on Decatur. Easy to drive pass this place, but I'm sure you won't miss the huge POPS writing on the roof!   Parking lot is small, but there always a spot you can get since they are super fast with getting orders made.   Don't worry for those who are not really into philly cheese steak sandwiches, they have salads and chicken and other options as well. So there's always something that everyone can order.   This is a place that i highly recommend!!! Well worth your $10-15!

tR60xVPxoU2epo7DpA_tLw.text: We used to come here a lot. I like their taco salad and their sandwiches. One day my girlfriend got brave and tried a Philly cheese steak. She doesn't typically like cheese steak sandwiches. Her mom also got a cheese steak, but I went for a BBQ pork sandwich. Later that night they both got up and went to different bathrooms and threw up. My girlfriend was up every hour throwing up. We can only assume it was food poisoning. It was the only thing they both had eaten that was the same. They were sick for three days with it. Never eating here again.

CoPIrIXrwJHt4Xq2PyiRgw.text: First time I stopped at Pop's, I was hooked on their sandwiches. Best place for a late night or early morning craving. Little pricey, but for the taste and variety, you can't beat this place!

nDFUjOIxPZRplbDDjCZ_fA.text: Everything was delicious! No complaints had the #9 will grilled onions and cheese fries... Could not finish but amazing.

bEE2ljX9IgDs47crWf7Xsw.text: Ate there around 10:30pm ish last night.  Around 1am ish, me and my little 6 yrs old boy has food poisoning from that place.  We're at the UMC urgent care right now.  Hope that help.  I've also filed a complaint with the Health department.

yEmdL3qS78jLn8E2LOcnTw.text: Pop's has been there for some time and while it looks it, don't let it scare you. Locals know they make a great authentic Philly Cheese steak. Some may think $9.99 is pricey but it's not for the size, amount of fillings and the flavor. They make it right in front of you and they have an awesome menu of variations and sides. It's patio dining which works best for evening and overnight dining. They do not have a drive thru but service is very fast. This location is 24 hrs which is a blessing for late night runs; I'm glad I moved back to this side of town. With their Philly's and wings, they have seriously changed my Sunday morning Football plans... I can dine in at home!

DJUPX2PTRJ1rCMm_MpQlfw.text: Always loved this place , since before it was pop's.  Great Phillies but I prefer their bbq pork , and chicken. Just repeat several times what you want. They don't always hear substitutes, add ons..

DAryj8J635SR-4QIXUWKCQ.text: Loved it! Some of the best philly steaks I've tried. Everything is made in front of you so its fresh..you have to eat outside which is a little inconvenient since its hot out but still great place!!

AmkLFBWQ9kgASxNwMe8GMg.text: It was late and my wife and I wanted cheesesteaks and since pop's was open we deicided to try this place out. It is small and all outdoor seating but since it was a nice night it was not an issue. The food we ordered was not bad considering it was pre-cooked and just waiting to be used. It was kinda a turn off but since it tasted awesome, we overlooked that part. The portion they gave us was HUGE we could of easily split one but since I can put food away I was not complaining. Also the fried banana foster was not good so stay away unless you just want to try it

qfwV4m56ukoyRDEclszmhg.text: First time trying and didn't disappoint. Although I paid 4.99 for double meat and mine looked about  the same as my wifes and she didn't get double meat but other than that it was pretty good. Free refill and the cheez wiz fries were good, good dipping for sandwich after all fries are gone lol

AeaqE12TVGurTWgGToAQtA.text: Dang... what a great philly cheesesteak found in the middle of the desert in Las Vegas! It was tad expensive ($9.50?) but it was well worth it. It had a good amount of grilled bellpepper, mushroom, onion, and of course, cheesesteak... Delicious! I also had a chilly fries and it was ginormous... My friend and I barely finished our own chessesteak and chilly fries.  They were greasy, delicious, large portion and mouth-watering.. Too bad I don't go to Vegas too often.. When I visit Vegas again, I will make sure to come back to this place!

WTrWH_bZBcDMpnlRGQHp2g.text: BLECK!  they pre-cook there flavorless meat and veggies.... do i really have to say more? the "sandwich" tasted like one of those ones you take out of the freezer and put in the mircowave for 2 minutes....  i barely would even consider there food edible if starving to death.  just gross.  and just a side note, it was 11 for the sub... you can get 2 subway footlongs for the same price and skip the chance of food poisoning

d89cEzvlyIZFe8Rt5_5G7Q.text: My first time to Pops, and the I got the #32. The steak, peppers, onions, mushrooms and provolone cheese steak. Very good! The bread was very moist and soft. Tons of steak and fixings on the Philly, couldn't finish it all. I would have liked a little more seasoning, but will be back.

GUbvkKFWlQ6WnJ1HZAiFXA.text: Love the sweet potato fries and the dipping sauce is amazing, wish they had A1sauce  for some of the steak sandwiches... but the food all in all is great and you get Alot for your  yummmmmmmy

KXxTHgg5CanWIaCiVbYFOQ.text: I think this maybe one of the best Philly cheesesteaks  I've had! Loved the sweet potato fries. Haven't been here in years, how could I forget?! The sandwich will easily feed two - it's a little pricey, but it's worth it

SL4ZXBW-NH6Dim9fynXXSg.text: Being the carb fiend that I am, I'm very particular about bread. The bread at Pop's cannot be beat! They have a story about it on their website - but in summary they ship it in from Philly and it's freaking amazing. Perfect balance of softness and chewiness.   The steak itself was great. They use sirloin so there isn't any grizzley pieces. I topped mine with cheese whiz. Props on them layering steak, cheese, steak so the cheese gets evenly distributed!   Menu was extensive. I wish I was drunk and not eating here on my lunch hour so I could have gotten a little more into some of the cool things (fried bananas foster? Cheese whiz wheels?).   I mean I guess the atmosphere is "authentic", but dining literally 2 feet from Decatur isn't all that great . Maybe on the strip or on a cute neighborhood street it's fun to dine al fresco, but Decatur rather sucks.   The best cheesesteak I've had in Vegas and I've tried quite a few!

I5QA6OePVJ0PlgZQpZQlvQ.text: I didn't know there was so many different  cheeses to put on my Philly cheese steaks, he asked me what kind of cheese I wanted I was lost I said "Philly cheese" lol but on the real I love this place.   the corner location scares me with so much speeding traffic i always think about a car or truck crashing into people trying to enjoy this place be safe...

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wcwM65ENVRT_zOVZF90v6Q.text: This place is pretty good. I'm from San Diego and a local told me about this place so I decided to stop by and check it out and get away from the typical buffets.   For starters, the food is cooked in front of you and visible through the window. When you receive your food, it's warm and ready to be devoured. Another great aspect of this place is the amount of meat that you get for the price. The Philly steak's is between $6-10 and I believe is properly priced. Another positive aspect is that this place is 24hrs. After a long night at Vegas and there is a need for cheap grub, this is a good place to check out.  Now for the things I didn't like about this place. For one thing, I enjoy my Philly steaks with a little kick of hot sauce. There is a small charge for hot sauce. Yeah I know $.50 is not expensive, but come on now, a charge for hot sauce. Secondly, side orders are extra. Who gets Philly steaks without fries or something? These negative is very minor, bit it did disturb me a little bit.  Overall, I would rate this place a 3 1/2 star but because I don't have that option it gets 4 stars. This place is one little spot that needs to checked out of your tired of going to the typical Vegas buffet's and restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A #2 with onions
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

t00zprRjC3iRavRfcDNsQw.text: Maybe if I was really drunk this would be good. Sober one of the worst phillys I've ever had. To put it in perspective think your average cafeteria cheese steak. Bad quality meat. Average hoagie bun. Cheese wiz was good but who am I kidding cheese wiz is always good. Not impressed at all with this place and I will not be back. Even if I am faced I will walk past this place I am 90% sure... Haha

yWBWfbJ9i4W-UvtY9jCavQ.text: So I was driving by and hungry and yelping ( yes I'm not supposed to yelp and drive). I see the four stars and 120 something reviews and pull in. I order a sandwich and fries for around $14.00 bucks.  So I just ate my food... The following thoughts cross my mind... 1) WAAAAAY OVERRATED  2) WAAAAY OVERPRICED 3) SUPER DUPER GREASY ( in a bad way) 4) I CAN'T BELIEVE I JUST WASTED CALORIES ON THAT SH*T 5) DAMN YOU MISLEADING FALSE 5 STAR YELPERS!! 6) WHY DID I GO SOLEY ON AVERAGE TOTAL STARS? READ THE REVIEWS WOMAN!  I tried this place and can absolutely positively say I won't be making an encore appearance- EVER!  I have had a better sandwich at Great Steak at the mall or maybe even Starbucks. Right now I am really regretful to have wasted a meal here wishing I would have gone to Subway or IN and OUT instead. Seriously, this place had a piece of dry whatever bread which a bunch of overly greasy crap in it. No special flavor, delightful texture, wonderful aroma, extra special something..NADA. The only reason this place is getting two stars is because the fries were decent and well done( which I like) but still average.  Also, although the cook was extremely friendly and helpful he handled the money and then went directly to cooking without washing his hands or wearing gloves. Can we say GROSS or FLU?  Help me help you. Don't let my review go in vain. I'm trying to do a public service here. PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEEEEASE don't fall for the hype and avoid this place. If for whatever reason you must visit go for some side orders and be on your way.

a_dlm29wnjIBGEtXJZEIlw.text: Las Vegas hidden gem! Pop's is a mom and pop sandwich shop that serves top notch Philly cheese steaks and a plethora of other delicious grilled and fried foods. I recommend the bbq pork sandwich and fried zucchini. I don't live on that side of town, but whenever I am in the neighborhood I try to stop there. They are open 24 hours so stop by any time.

cNyNmIUtC4ylI9Gj_DqBjg.text: The whiz!!!  lol the best late nite munchie food on the Westside!  Love it!

V8Ii3nHvkWH4133MWH47SQ.text: Found this place about 4 years ago while running some errands. I remember it was across from a car dealership and their tables were outside close to the Street. Well, it might not be at an ideal intersection or neighborhood but I'm always down for a good Philly!  I've gone here 4 times (could of been much more but its kinda far from me) and this is what I've tried:  Provolone Cheese Steak, Mushroom Cheese Steak, Peppers with Mushroom Cheese Steak and Cheese Whiz Steak  = All Excellent!!  Fries: the fatter type when you can actually taste the potato! Must have with their cheese steaks!  * Bread is made and flown from Philly, Sirloin Steak is cut, marinated, packaged and shipped from Philly, Wisconsin and New Jersy Cheeses but the Kraft Cheese Whiz is manufactured from Philly..... Did I mention that they get most of their stuff from Philly??!!!!! Can you say Authentic??!! Well, this place saves me from flying to Philadelphia to grab a cheesesteak because whatever their doing here, their doing it genuinely right!!  If you want a Real and Excellent Tasting Philly Sandwich that'll fill you up for a fair price then I suggest trying this place out!

69wzGai6jJ8XVHrhE9bhvA.text: If you have never had a Philly cheesesteak, and your trying one for the first time. Pops is the place to try them for the real authentic Philly cheesesteak taste, it doesn't get any better than this

_J9orNMmjtPIXre_gwvMxA.text: Once upon a time, this place was a Straight From Philly Steakout. (Then again, once upon a time it was a Weinerschnitzel & then it was a Weanie Bender, but that's beside the point. :-D ) When it turned into Pop's, I wanted it to be as good as Philly Steakout, which I miss terribly. They largely kept the same menu, after all. However it is not quite as good.  Don't get me wrong, it's still pretty decent. I still come here from time to time. And of course, middle of the night dining options are always good. However, the phillys aren't quite as tasty as their predecessor's. It seems like maybe they really love oregano. A lot. Like, really a lot. That appears to be the main flavoring that they use to distinguish themselves from other philly joints. Chicken phillys are better, not so over seasoned. I really want to love the cheese fries, but at least when I go there in the evenings the old, old fries are just thrown back in the fryer for you. Now I know that some places double-fry their fries. However, if you double-fry really old fries, you just get nasty over cooked & over greased fries. It's a consistent thing here. Perhaps during the daytime I'd have better luck w/ the fries.  Also, I've witnessed several times where people will go from money handling to directly touching food. Not a cool thing. Soo, yeah. Not terrible, but just ok.

I8vEbIbZG8BxYgbydzPhWA.text: Thisi is the best cheesteak place EVER! We see him set up shop every year at san genero as well and with all that other food around still end up buying from him!!!! #1 They have cheese whiz which alotta places dont Yumm the steak is always tender perfectly cooked. I have had almost every combination of sandwhich possible. They are just number one for me and my fiance, he proposed  on our 2nd anniversary there we go every year  for our little memorable meal together!!!!! Sweet potato frys are delicious we always get a double order of the mushrooms and the zuchinni is good as well. Definately a place to go if you want a really good cheese steak!!!!   O yea they have tasty cakes!!!!!!!!yummmmm!

runaX01UHmBUPZUVysCBHg.text: Ever had a random convo about food with a random person in a bar? Well, this is where my convo ended up.   Sitting at It's a Grind coffee shop on desert inn and durango at 3am, a couple stumbles in, orders, and bumps into me. As a rather "fluffy" guy, they asked if I knew anywhere for food and open late. I suggested Porchlight behind of the coffee shop, Girl 1 says I wants fried cheese, Girl 2 said steak and onions, I say "cheesesteak perhaps?" The couple then proceeds to say, "Follow us!!" I seriously got a little scared on the way there, kind of out of my comfort zone of West Vegas...but I'm here to say, TOTALLY WORTH IT!!!  I ordered a regular cheesesteak with onions, half provolone, half cheese whiz, peppers, and onion rings as a side. SO GREAT, best cheesesteak i've ever had. Other notables are the fried zucchini, fried cheese, and hot wings. The menu is huge so take your time. I was rushed because the couple assumed I've been here before, put me in the front of the line.  Service was excellent, cook laughed at the randomness of our story.  Get out there and try a TRUE philly. So great.

RlQR-eGxoRdbdxq-6FAjCA.text: I tried Pop's because I love me some good cheesesteak, and they offered a 2-for-1 coupon on their site, so I couldn't resist.  This place is tiny with minimal covered outdoor seating. There's a walk-up window where you order and pay for your food. The service is nothing special; not horrible but not the greatest, either. The guy that took our order was also the cook, and he makes the cheesesteaks right in front of you.  Both, my husband and I, decided on the #2 Cheese Whiz Steak  w/grilled onions (the onions don't automatically come with, so be sure to ask for them), and an order of fried okra and onion rings.   Cheesesteaks: The bread was nice and soft and held up well to the decent amount of filling. The meat, on the other hand, was kind of dry and lacking in flavor - it needed some seasoning.   Fried okra and onion rings: They were both perfectly fried and not too greasy, but they're the frozen stuff that you get at the store.  All in all, not a bad place, but I've had better.

BCaZ-WvNXRwcb_zsIBl8Ew.text: I like Pop's for the middle of the night munchies.    Steak with mushrooms and provolone is my usual, with a side of fries.  For some reason It's always really, really windy whenever I eat at Pop's.  I need to create an excel spreadsheet to find the correlation between barometric pressure and cheesesteak cravings.

OgBvJ-IGCwFhF3LvaS7auQ.text: I might change this to a 5 after a few more visits. But sooo good. Love the Wiz! Philly style and 24 hours. Thankfully I don't live close. A little pricier than expected but, no actual complaints.

duwp-APzHLyM8OUWnGE05Q.text: Hands down the best Philly steaks we've had in Vegas so far. After a night of drinking they're even better. Definite comfort food to the max.

cE_cFdvdi-wZwjC8wxAt6g.text: I've never been to Philly, but if their cheesesteaks are better than these... man, I need to book a flight.   The food is good here. The cheesesteaks are filling, have a ton of food, and are perfectly complemented by their fries.   My only issue with them as that I feel like I overpay a little there. I know it's good food, but it's a cheesesteak! I think I paid like $13 last time I was there for my food. It's obviously not a ton of money, but I don't feel the place/food matches the cost.   Still, though, it's good food. And they prep it super quick.

oA95Oxe3Q86MltGbxGGzAQ.text: i came here a couple years ago with my dad and low and behold my grandmother moved down the street from them.  these cheesesteaks were just as awesome and pretty good.   i love the flavor and they cook them as you order them.  i would recommend them and will be going back when i go visit my grandmother.  just delicious!!!!

3vKgKQOO3cY-1VJCOex0aw.text: I've been coming here for about 7 years now and frankly not a lot has changed & that's exactly why I love this philly joint. I always get the #32 and as always leave home stuffed and happy. The customer service is phenomenal and I always receive a nice warm smile from the cook and cashier which is hard to come by these days. Love this place great Phillies and even better customer service!

8Y2FObs7vlIlC829Xtidpg.text: I use to come here all the time when I lived in this area but haven't been back in awhile. Awesomely, they've expanded their menu and add fried zucchini, fried mushrooms, salad options, sweet potato fries and other cool side dishes they never had before! I'll have to try them with another visit soon.   This time I got chicken, provolone, onions and mushrooms. Sad to say, it lacked any flavor at all. Apparently the original owners had sold it and that could explain the change in quality. But still, I have to go back and try the yummy looking options they've added. They are also a walk up window and only have a few outdoor stools and tables to dine at, so be sure to be dressed accordingly with the weather if you decided to stay and eat there.

JPoiL9l9Eh_dU8ux8VmQTg.text: Pop's make Philly Steaks like they do in Philly with Cheese Whiz!  I had a specific craving last week for a good Philly Cheese Steak sandwich so I Yelped and gladly found this place.  I like my Philly Steaks with provolone cheese and the works; mushrooms, onions, and peppers.  This place did not disappoint.  The steak in these sandwiches are thick, and pack ina lot of flavor.  I was actually able to finish the entire thing in one sitting.  I love the french fries too.  This place has one of the best Philly Steaks I have ever tried.    The only downside was that it was scorching hot outside when we came here to eat and we were sweating while trying to enjoy our food.  They also serve Italian shaved ice here to cool you off but we didn't try it..  Good idea though.  The oustide atmoshere is pretty chill and a different way to enjoy the Vegas environment in the neighborhood in which the place resides.   If you want a good, authentic Philly Steak sandwich, come to Pop's!

t1__B2uHv2rr-gHCna09cw.text: Not a fan of the philly cheese steak here. I thought all sandwiches were made fresh to order but not Pops. They have many different sandwiches but I ordered a classic philly cheese steak, as I was leaving the front window I see the cook pull meat out of a pan that had been pre cooked already, right then and there I was disappointed. Sandwich was okay and a little greasey. I haven't been here in awhile and maybe they have changed their ways of cooking a fresh philly, at least I hope so.

jVuddiw08qt8gc3RnZvkSg.text: This place is DANGEROUS.  I ordered a Philly cheese steak with provolone and peppers thinking I'd be underwhelmed, but whoa, this was good.   The bread was soft enough to soak up the evil meat juices but strong enough to protect my fingers. The sandwich was about the size of my head, but I easily could have eaten the whole thing if no one was around to judge me. I can't wait to go back after a night of drinking at Frankie's or any of the other area bars.

14WSuA6IizNzPi54iG-buw.text: Pastrami on a long roll, filled with Pastrami, grilled onions, pickles and mustard. Yes! Not the best but getting there.

e0MFvwwVYlms2_i9hb5bgA.text: How do people think this is a real philly cheesesteak? The meat has NO FLAVOR, the mushrooms are clearly out of a can and taste gross and have no flavor at all. Its in a shady location but it does have a legacy behind it. Its cool that its open 24 hours but it tastes SO BAD so who cares?!. Tried the Italian ices and they tasted awful as well. Stay away from this place. Looks really dirty as well there are other places I would choose over this place for sure.

R155-d3KKz1pFg76MlrKhQ.text: Is every one crazy this is the worst place to eat in las vegas its in a very low class area very dirty flys everywhere and the food is horrible taste like freezer burn and high priced i found a long disgusting hair in my sandwich the owner/manager dident even care to make me a new one please dont eat here you will get Sick I reported them to The BBB

g9rl_YDkPZl8jtEa3LZBBw.text: Nothing negative to say about Pops. You get what you pay for, so if you want toppings beyond what your sandwich comes with, you need to speak and pay up. It can get busy depending on the time and day of the week, so be prepared. Its pretty much a Vegas landmark.

bd32K_K6BabZKAf0SZZ22w.text: Solid. Forget the big name restaurants. Get by this little gem. I have said it before. The best places do what they do and do it well. No exception here. Cheese steak sandwiches were great. I have had several from Philly and these sandwiches hang. I also tried the turkey hogie. Best sandwich I have had in a while. Walk up order move to the right and pay. Some have commented on knowing what to do but we didn't have any problems. I don't hand out 5 stars. They have to be earned. Pops earned all 5.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey and sheesh. WOW.

D6wyaqzeA6mtwA4ONSWqKw.text: Great Philly cheesesteak with real amarosa rolls. If you're from Philly and miss an authentic cheesesteak. This is the place for you.

oKIZER3PkuMOnY4MNUaFOQ.text: This is definitely the best place to get philly's in town. Absolutely delicious! The chili cheese fries are amazing as well. The philly's are huge and they make them right in front of you however you like them. It gets pretty busy there, but is definitely worth the wait.   Oh and parking kinda sucks when it gets busy. I always feel bad parking in front of people's houses when there's no parking available in the small lot. I assume the people that live in those houses are used to it since Pops has been there forever!

92oritw1Z46VKsGjil7eTA.text: If you're ever craving a great, local version of a Philly cheese - steak sandwich, then this is the place to go! Hands down the best cheese - steak sandwich in the greater Las Vegas area. They take their beef and season it with a flavorful mix of spices and herbs while they grill it up. The beef is never greasy always tastey and then served on a toasted, warm bun. Then they give you the perfect amount of cheese to meat ratio and serve it to you with a side of fries and drink if you choose. They are also open late for those of you who have a late night craving or are coming out of the club. This will curb any craving and your only regret is that you didn't buy 2.

ZpDXSYHr8ffHzo3AHkbC8g.text: Ordered the American cheese steak and it was amazing . Wife ordered hot wings and okra and wow that was yum too . Next time the Oreo churros

TLGgjEfm2eUz-UlnOqL4mg.text: Best place to get a Phili. Probably my 5th time here. The employees were great and accommodating. Everyone should try this place at least once. Support local businesses.

xW0W-YV4v8AKq-KY6jiTQg.text: Pops is the best! Their sandwiches are absolutely amazing! I only wish they had a location closer to my house!

FhBsX09XxgeDDgwIEWYzIQ.text: Pop's is my go to place in Vegas for a Philly cheesesteak.  I'm working my way through the variety of steak sandwiches. My favorite so far is the #2. Cheese whiz. I add onions, bell peppers, tomatoes, and provolone. It's a delicious combo. Tonight I'm trying the zucchini sticks for the first time. I've had the fried green beans and they're good.   Must try!!

TWr3RCF75wGEbhzhFkyS6w.text: Waiting 30 minutes just to order when only 5 people are in front of me. Need to speed this process up. Especially when it's lunch and people need to go back to work. Review is only on the line wait. Owner needs to create efficiencies to increase revenue.

c6UCY4idaik2Ow8sb2VqVw.text: Between you and me Nothing for nothing  The food is under rated. The meat is processed. I guess I will have to explore other Philly Steak restaurants

RlQbl1lOT7oaEbEQTXIq4w.text: Highly overrated. Fair to middling cheese steak sandwich. Onion rings were good, but pretty hard to screw those up. Long wait for food, one man operation and he does a lot of prepping between orders. I feel quality and quantity did not justify the high end price. Will not return. Have had better in other places.

1uP5WvaQmtCFHgjANPMs5w.text: Good Phillies but man you could pay for it later. Good selection, but ingredients could be more fresh for sure. Location is nice, with their outside dining. All in all ok, there are much better Phillies in town though.

_vxYz2H7AgRWXGGfGGChJw.text: Best Philly in town. Have been going here since I was little. Vegas born and raised. My son is a picky eater, but not when I tell him we are going to pops.

MOldlirN075liNZGL9B9Ww.text: Great food! Love mom and pop restaurants and this one definitely hits the mark. Only 2 complaints are there is only one way to get in to their parking. And if you are on the opposite end of the street means u-turns or driving through small streets to get there. Second was the use of nacho cheese for their chili cheese fries. While still delicious, I feel using shredded cheese instead would have made a difference. All in all, I will be coming back to try their other menu items.

LKXqJ-nkgaXlLflB0AkxJQ.text: The food was alright, 7/10, but their customer service is terrible. The male cooks are rude and rush you to order. Super expensive for mediocre food. Wouldn't recommend. Also wouldn't come back. This is a one time thing.

J5e8DaBcGfZ9DAaMcH0blg.text: I love me some Pop's Philly Steaks! Lots of options for ordering, almost too hard to decide! But I'm always left with a happy belly.

Wn661OYabpfzM_VpLsBj3g.text: I've heard great stuff about this place, but was pretty disappointed. Nothing was bad, just rather bland. I regret wasting my cheat meal here.

AfsB0YET9L0WC48IRZOqpw.text: We had read good reviews about this place and we were in the area, so we tried it! Was not disappointed at all! The service was great and the food was perfect! We will return!

Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Wings were great! We had the hot sauce. The service was fast and very friendly!  We will make this a regular stop!

rVnac6Y362SlWJWLyUxWCA.text: horrible service!! naaaasty food! ugh! sooo displeased! worst experience ever!

k4dpR_xGPbJtZCsL-gbpCw.text: Not perfect, but the most authentic  Philly Steak in Las Vegas.  You got to order like you would in Philly.  Whiz and 'Wit:  With Cheez Whiz and Onions.  Hmm... So tasty.  Any "authentic"  Cheese steak place that doesn't offer Cheez Whiz, just isn't.

94V7dAA6VaJTrxJOv_Q1lw.text: I love this place best Philly steak on Decatur lol jk the best in town

24latNZ1m-_drmC_OQWTdw.text: The difference between Caprioti's is they use real beef...Pops, as good as i tastes is barley beef.  I saw an empty box of "philly meat" out back as i walked to my car and read the ingredient label..wow, please dont cheap out by using food starch added meat products and claim it's better than Caps...Shame on you.

8ilK8nAfnTZiVzyx2oy6og.text: Good food. Had the cheese steak with wiz and onions. A lot of food and close in taste to Philly with only the bun kind of throwing it off. Not a bad taste but you can tell bread not from east coast. Stop by it'll be worth it.

eITlspoK9OEEmWlK3WoDMA.text: Whiz or Provolone? This is a great place to eat a Cheesesteak or any type of fried food for that matter, speaking of which, try the fried bananas (I don't remember what they're called). Food is definitely worth the drive.

rjBVFziY_LgLqo-_CjdStA.text: Oh yeah! This place is great! I have had the privilege to have authentic Philly cheese steaks right in Philadelphia. I have had Pats and Gino's and Tony Lukes right in Philadelphia. This place is very very close to what you would get at any of those two places in Philly. The cheese whiz and steak! I love it. You should try it! I wonder if they have broccoli rabe like Tony Luke's that was fantastic!

N2gp3mfhdO9f24X8asEtdA.text: order the pork grinder (my favorite) .. only to be bone chunks and fat..guess i'll have to find another favorite

rq2DIPpMgWp9mFsARVWYrw.text: not sure if this place taste's better than any real philly cheese steak, i.e. Gino's or my other favorite philly steak place in austin, i.e. Texadelphia, but this place has some good philly cheese steaks. they  have different variations of the philly cheese steaks to the classic.  you can choose what cheese you would like (swiss, provolone, mozzarella, and cheeze whiz), what meat, and what other sides you would like  i.e. mushrooms and grilled onions.  the most important thing about this place is that THEY DO NOT SKIMP ON MEAT.  the sandwiches are about $7-8, but they're big and full of meat.  i usually get the classic, sometimes adding grilled mushrooms to it.  other times, i love getting the pepperoni pizza...grilled beef steak with onions, also fried with some pepperoni and some tomato sauce, and finally topped off with mozzarella cheese.  there is so much meat in that one and so damn saucy!!!!  i also recommend to order the sweet potato fries and the sweet tangy sauce to dip it in.  Another plus is this place is 24hrs.  what a great place to eat after a late night of drinking!!!

vJulE_eBz22GoT--PpIJ9Q.text: Pop,  You probably need to get on the same page with the guy you had behind the grill on Friday afternoon (12/18) because my wife asked him if the meat was grilled to order and he said "no". I noticed him pulling our order out of a pot next to the grill, and reheated it on the grill. That my friend, isn't the "real deal" I stand by all of my reviews. In fact, I take reviews very seriously, and I have the experience needed to leave such reviews on this forum as a former chef and restaurant owner. When I say that your meat was tasteless and boiled I meant it. I think I have had enough cheesesteaks in my life to know what the "real deal" is, and yours unfortunately wasn't.

VRDlIbr77ZqeegkSJk25xw.text: The closest thing to a Philly cheesesteak available in Las Vegas! It's very hard to find authentic cheesesteaks here, this is the place to get them. They are delicious! They also carry Tastykake products which takes you back to Philly. And the cheese wiz fries, yum!!

-CaBEsjXKbNIEz_SLIVY2A.text: My friends seem to love this place.  They will drive the distance.  We ordered a couple things off the menu.  Provolone Cheese Steak was good.  It would've tasted a lot better if it had more flavor or some sort of sauce.  I split this meal with my friend.  It was pretty fulfilling if you ask me.  The Cheese Fries were alright.  The cheese tasted to artificial for me.  The cheese probably would've tasted better on nacho chips than on fries.  The Jalapeno Poppers were good.  Everything probably would've tasted much better had the weather been warmer and indoors.  This place has only outdoor seating.  It's been around.  The cool thing about this place is that they make sure they get your order right and give you your receipt.  If they don't, your food is free.  It's stated on the wall...  I'd give this place 3.5 stars, but since my friends enjoy eating here I gave it a 4 instead.

XQzNtcUTvfhj2UOeKhl96A.text: Great sandwich and great sides to go with them. Portions are very generous. I love a sandwich that can fill me up. This is where I go when I want a Philly or Italian sandwich.. Best in town!!

jFUxOtVwGVtbI3g-Kt5JFw.text: Okay well it's a friendly environment , open 24 hours and it has a lot of flies flying around. I don't suggest wearing a muscle shirt because I'm wearing a muscle shirt and it got into my bra which was gross so I gave my order to my dad and went to hide out in the car .

sXvzOcu1rbj9aeRbw9S2ow.text: I've been meaning to check this place out for a while now and I wish I had better news.  Pop's is pretty hard to miss. The giant triangular building has been serving up Philly's 24/7 for years now and has become a local favorite. Pop's exudes that hole in the wall atmosphere and really belongs on Diners Drive-Ins and Dives. Yes the Ben Franklin mural has seen better days but for me this mildly grimey look just adds to the experience. There is no in door seating just the outdoor patio so dress accordingly. They menu is pretty big, tons of philly variations along with plenty of deep friend snacks and TastyKakes (you get a free one on your birthday!)  I am sure the guys here can produce a edible work of art with the cheez wiz but I was a little disappointed in what I got. My bacon philly and a bottle of water came out to twelve bucks; for the price I expected more. The philly was surprisingly dry and lacking flavor. Normally adding bacon to any dish is an improvement but here it just added a rubbery textured ingredient to otherwise soft sandwich. The hoagie looked great at first but became soggy and fell apart as it soaked up the grease. I've heard rumors that the place was sold a few years back had hasn't been the same since.   I might have ordered the wrong thing or just been there on a off day so I am willing to give the place another shot. Perhaps until next time.

CHBzoMQGdFd35C583FTwDQ.text: Loved the delicious food and the atmosphere. I'm told it's completely authentic but having never been to Philly I can't say for sure.  Employees are SUPER nice. They gave me some boiling water so I could heat up my sons bottle. Happy customers!

rcfF3nLmg4ILftO-2yTFMg.text: Some background: I have lived in and around Philly for 29 years, and just moved to Las Vegas in July. I used to live down Passyunk from Pat's and Geno's, and for the last 4 years I lived near the Dalessandro's (the real king of Philly steaks). Soooo I think I am fairly qualified to give this review.  After finding out that Pop's was a short drive from my office, I decided to head down there to devour thousands of delicious calories in one sitting. I wish I saved those calories for something better. What a disappointment!!   I asked for my go-to, a cheesesteak hoagie (typically it's steak, cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion). He told me mayo was included, and I told him no mayo please. After waiting 5 minutes for my steak, I get it in a paper bowl thing with a fork stuck on top. Never saw that before... Sat down, pulled apart my steak to put ketchup in there, and I realized the thing is slathered in mayo. NASTY. Brought my steak back to the counter, told the woman at the register about the mistake, and they made me another. I had to get this to go since I needed to be back at work. Back at my office, I take a bite of my steak and there is some kind of vinegar flavoring in the hoagie. I don't know if the onions were cooked in it or if the guy thought this would be good or if was just suffering from temporary insanity.... Ugh. I ate it, but only because I paid $14 with a drink and chips.   First, the prices were a little much for what you're getting. My cheesesteak hoagie was $10. I used to pay $8 at Dalessandro's. It's $6.50 at Dalessandro's for a plain steak and it's $8 at Pop's. The quality was a 2 star compared to Dalessandro's 5 star, so confused on the mark up of price. Maybe because the rolls are shipped from Amaroso's?   If you've never had a Philly steak, I can see why you might like these. If you have experienced the best of the best, you will walk away disappointed. Between the price, flavor, and authenticity, I won't be returning.

8peOtbbQHsnD1VqfiPCjbQ.text: Open 24 hours so that's a plus! I ordered a mushroom cheese w/ onions and an order of fried mushrooms. ($14) The sandwich was really good! It sucked because the guy doesn't even ask if you want lettuce, tomato, or mayo like most places. The staff wasn't friendly either :(  All outside seating so if you're going in the summer, I would go at night.

7d2LA1nyCziNMns-U3y4xQ.text: Wow wow wow! This place is delicious , I've had several phillys before and I must say this one is by far my favorite in las vegas, can't believe it took me so long to try here! Will definitely start being a regular here. The bread A+ very soft and good and just yummm! I ordered the number 32 couldn't go wrong.  Definitely try it if you ever get the chance worth the try.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H_sHkDMdW5wYqDm5JQiPXQ.text: This place has been around forever and rightfully so. Reasonably priced for a quick bite and way better than any fast food chain. Their Italian ices are amazeballs!

40jGuV6ZBV8lC3dWX9pfug.text: Heard a lot about this place. Old school eats. Tried the #6 steak provolone onions  and shrooms. Good steak very tender, provolone melted all throughout. Onions grilled and sweet. Maybe canned shrooms though ( slight draw back ) otherwise very tasty flavorful. Bread was soft and fresh. Will return , good locals joint. Eat well and often !!

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pops Philly Steaks

9DXpAzq_BuvGq9fAAMDmiw.text: Really long wait can't say I was really impressed. It was descent but not the best Philly streak in Vegas.

-ly1Hso5w5bkTm_HAP8fDg.text: We've come here twice in the past 2 years we've been in vegas.  I have no idea why people can even rat this stuff considering it's run poorly.  Both times we went and ordered our food they screwed up our sandwiches. Mine was a philly with mushrooms and peppers. NO ONION.  I went up and told them there was a mistake so being that it was 11pm and pretty cold. My boyfriend was eating his food and I had to watch.  Okay well he tells me it was really flavorless.  How do you kill the flavor of the meat?   I had to completely agree when my order was ready 7 minutes later... I went for a bite and expected there to be gooey cheese on it and SOME seasoning. Nope.  It was so bland I couldn't eat the rest of it and decided the second try was the  LAST TRY.  I don't get it, we came at all the way out from our side of town to try it.  We even went as late like everybody's recommended. Still awful service. Not to mention the two guys working were miserable.  I rather spend the money and go to Green Valley's Buffet and have them make me a Philly COOK TO ORDER.  At least there the meat was juicy, flavorful and I could SEE what the hell they're up to in the kitchen.

iCTf-AKz9ODUG5vhmN5Rog.text: The Good:  A mom and pop's hole in the wall, called Pop's Philly Steaks.  They are open 24hrs, I don't know if I would hit this place up too late as it is in a bit of a sketchy area.  Good solid cheesesteaks.  Not quite as good as the ones I had in Philly.  The Bad:  Tiny lot and only a few outdoor tables.  The Ben:  If you are craving some cheesesteak wit whiz then it might be the fix you need.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nP3A5A0KcpO6NUeGagHLLg.text: I want to give it more but.... Outdoor seating is just a killer cold without space heaters and the basic sandwiches are a little bland, they need to have condiments for guest to use.

MnRe18RiktU_Sml5g1Y-xg.text: Food was- ok Service was- ok Probably be back if in the area and craving cheesesteaks

uLzQRG1_i8NLiQPzh52eKQ.text: Lets start from the beginning...its on a busy street corner. There isn't a drive thru like you would think. Small parking lot. It's noisy, kinda dirty, more expensive than I thought. So, just like the 2-star rating says, "Meh, I've experienced better".  If you want a big sandwich for $12 and it's late...Pop's might fit the bill. For the money I'd rather go to Roberto's.

YzV4BlLO0AiPig8GD_ZLVA.text: We saw this place on pawn stars and thought to check in out. We're glad we did. Got the cheese steak with wiz. It was  one of the best cheese steaks I've had out side of philly.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese steak with wiz.

Va2Dy_C4Y8xSuNz-_-GDTA.text: Forever curious about Pop's, the sun and moon aligned for me to give a shot during a recent lunch break.  Off course it was almost triple digits outside and the thought of eating in the swelter of the day was out of the question.  My order was pretty basic.  It consisted of steak, chez wiz, mushrooms and a pretty tasty bun.  It was a treat so I did not have to pay.  All in all, it was decent sandwich but nothing I would seek out during the dog days of August OR at 3:30AM on the corner of Decatur and Alta.

GVzN5bR4Q5f5HQ898qKwcQ.text: Great Philly joint. Definitely has the drip factor that is needed in a cheesesteak! If it's not dripping it's not worth it. Being open 24 hours is awesome.

89-kJj5uUJG_0sBjjyY2pw.text: Well we got the # 4 Philly Cheese Steak with provolone, the #8 Philly Cheese Steak with Mushrooms and provolone, and an order of fries. The cheese steaks were fresh and delicious.  Good price and quick service.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #8 Philly Cheese Steak with Mushrooms and Provolone.  Pop&#39;s Philly Cheese

KOPB7kctiWgfGJzeOHRcBw.text: Ive driven past Pop's Cheesteaks for years, finally decided to give it a shot after a late night out. I took the cashier's recommendation and ordered the #32 peppers, mushroom, and cheese. I really wanted to enjoy it, but it was decent to okay at best. As juicy as it was it just seemed to lack a unique flavor. The portion size was terrific though, some good marks for that. The whole time i was regretting not going for the cheez whiz steak. Maybe next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Piping hot off the grill. Heavy on the meat and cheese but a little light on flavor

abclQwVn6eUEv5GXbgqV2g.text: Pop's Philly Steaks.  A real hole in the wall joint if there ever was one.  But man did it satisfy my craving for a good cheese steak sandwich on that Saturday night.  Got a #2 Cheese Whiz steak sandwich and some onion rings.  Greasy?  Yes.  Pricey?  A bit.  Good?  No doubt.  It was pretty darn good.  The onion rings were good thick onion rings, and a fair price of 3.95 for what they gave you.  I got a free side of ranch with that, no complaints there.  Food came out minutes after ordering, took it home and devoured it.  For 15 bucks overall, I got my money's worth and a full stomach.  Limited parking as it sits on a corner, outdoor undercover seating only on tall diner stools and tables.  Reminds me of the old snack bar days at the baseball fields as a kid.  I'm not from Philadelphia so I can't compare it to other cheesesteaks, but I enjoyed clogging my arteries for one night.

zmi_yKFko99BPKInAlNIsQ.text: Feeling a little ripped off after looking at the pictures on Yelp before I ate here. $10 for a sandwich and there really wasn't much meat. The mushroom steak sandwich was ok. I didn't even notice the mushrooms, so I am wondering if they were even in there. The bread was a little stale and would have been much better if the sandwich had been wrapped and taken home.   My son had a chili cheese steak and it looked awesome. He loved it, so if I come back I'll give that a try. Overall I would say this place is a little over priced for what you get.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom cheese steak (where&#39;s the beef?)

dOxLUG7tBOpuR5FpopggdQ.text: Good bread, good meat and they are willing to do the sauteed onions without peppers if you want.  The only downside is that there really is not much to look at other than traffic while you are eating your food.

ShtNIJ0fstVTn4OBmy5n2g.text: I really like Pop's. Huge menu, freshly made, friendly service, open 24 hours. What could be better: safer location, bigger parking lot, indoor dining & maybe bigger sandwiches. The only thing that you should care about, is: I will be going back here again & I will recommend Pop's to my friends.

84KagW_PlWiewIKnOKKOLg.text: I loved Pop's.   My roommate and I stopped there one night, and got 2 cheesesteaks to go.  He got the one with chili and cheese, I got the mushroom and provolone with onions.  The service was good.  The guys were nice enough for being in a hot kitchen in the middle of the summer.  They were attentive to us, and filled our order perfectly.   It took about 15 minutes or so to get home, and we were worried that the buns would be soggy.  They weren't.  The sandwiches were perfect, tasty and HUGE!  I was stuffed!  The onion rings were to die for, and I loved the Pennsylvania Dutch "Birch Beer."  SO good.    I want to try the fried okra next.  Hopefully I can make it back soon.

f-zfQ4ZtS5aeKpyFIVaNMQ.text: Great place. Will definitely be going back. Wrote a blog about it. Check it out below delectablehideaway.blogs...

CpI4cZuNHymDdHqNsSLhQA.text: First time here really good. Food was hot and cooked when ordered. My husband is from Philly and he says it was good.

Ks21WeykbNEVNwzQTO39Mw.text: Terrible customer service from the large man behind the counter!  I drove in at around 9:30 to get one of the sandwiches, that they are currently promoting on a couple of large scale banners hanging out side of their establishment. I thought what a good deal for a sandwich only 6 bucks n i could get a nice breakfast snack, but all i ended up getting was an attitude from some guy who for some reason decided to fight with me. I went to inquire about said sanwich and was quickly cut off by him saying "we dont have no 6 dollar phillies, not ever." (Noting that the sign  specifically reads breakfast phillies, steak, bacon, or ham phillies.) To wit I replied, "no I'm talking about your sandwiches on the sign" at which point the Genius behind the counter puts his brain in high gear and repeats "We dont got any phillies for 6 bucks." its like no sh!t Sherlock! Thank you so much for explaining to me that you only have a slight grasp of this thing called communication, how enlightened I am now to the fact that you do not sell 6 buck phillies, and thank you ever so much for the attitude of treating me like I was a 5 year old instead of using commen sense and telling me about the sandwiches I was inquiring about. I left with nothing other then anger, fustration, and a bad taste in my mouth from your customer service skills. Perhaps look elsewheres for your morning meal or you may have to fight with him as well!  update: tried them out again for the first time in a year and got a totally f#d up case of food poisoning ughhh they used to be so good...

Go3en7AHUCOC4E6R5L28ig.text: Love the taste! Fast, friendly service! This place has a relaxing atmosphere, with outside seating under umbrellas. I will definitely go back for seconds.

FVwzBDjCpR_JY7ajwVDanA.text: I  had been wanting to try Pop's for the longest time.  And every time I drive by the colorful stand, I think to myself "Why on God's green earth have I not been there yet?".  Well, all this anticipation contributed to the big let down.    I love anything authentic.  And supposedly all of the ingredients (rolls, cheese, meat) are flown in directly from Philly itself. I ordered the provolone mushroom cheesesteak, and it was just OK.  Maybe I needed to order the cheese whiz to make it more authentic, but I just can't bring myself to eat something that artificially bright yellow.   The roll was definitely piled high with the tender meat.  I only ate half because it was so filling.  But it wasn't as seasoned or flavorful as I was expecting it to be.  The mushrooms added some flavor, but that was it.  Perhaps I am just not a phillycheesesteak type of girl.   There were 2 people ahead of me in line, so there was a bit of a wait. I am just grateful I went in the spring and not in the middle of summer.  I doubt i will have any cheesesteak cravings any time soon, but it is comforting to know that if I do have one, they are open 24 hours.  *Yelp 100 Challenge: Review 26/100*

Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Extras menu

geZg4bphIhc1SjM6a2u2Pg.text: I have never been to Philly but I can't imagine it's any better than this.  The #32 with wiz was the bomb.  My entire office hit them for lunch and got rave reviews all around.  I am craving another one just writing this review!!!

Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #32 with wiz

K0K6Xx6XXgKiBT5WBMccVw.text: Burnt and greasy......best thing about this place now are the French Fries.  Sad it used to be really good, don't know if they changed owners or cooks or what but this is the second time in a row that the cheesesteak was burnt and super greasy. I took 2 bites and threw it away.  Waste of money!

xTSU7XXFZA8ll75SAHBcOw.text: If you want a philly style cheese steak for a reasonable price, Pop's is a good choice.  They even have Frank's sodas.  The cheesesteak comes in several varieties including wit whiz, american, provelone, and cheddar.  The steak is flavorful and grilled right before your eyes.  I would avoid the sides though, not only are they prepackaged items like zucchini sticks, mozzerella sticks, mushrooms, etc, but they are all fried in the same oil.  They did not look good. Still the sandwich is one of the better philly cheesesteaks in Las Vegas so give it a try.

DsTt8lrzMM913jNd45ok9A.text: I'm not from Philyi so what do I know? I do know that over the years, I've had cheese steaks from a lot of different places that don't seem to know about bread or flavor. Pop's is pretty fantastic as in "Oh, There's Pop's. Stop the #&@%!@%& car!" Really tender. Cooked right in front of you. Hard to beat. It may seem a little pricy until you're holding a pound of food in one hand. Damn'it, Now I want to go to Pop's... LOL

Q0G1DYuwmejRvhcZXJpt5Q.text: The guys are always really funny and friendly and they don't mind if you're picky, or confused on how to order. They always are super helpful and the food is delicious!!

RAVJ-JwOD82yahOQ9AGb0Q.text: Great food but they gotta get it together for Uber eats.. I order and it gets canceled EVERYTIME!! And when I call they just hang up.. not kool.

jQQvvBLwcp19FHhekgEY-A.text: Went to Pop's last night. Got a cheesesteak with onions and cheese wiz. The meat tasted hella suspect and just had an overall odd taste to it. I wouldn't recommend this place at all based off of my first experience. How you gonna pretty much have one item and it tastes funky?

HdfrFkw9R3Ad5AzEdtkWqA.text: So gooood! and open 24 hrs. this place is the best. I will come here everytime I'm in town from now on.

FwX4DHGgBSVEc_6xf4UsPw.text: Great people, great food.  Pretty darn hot sitting outside (even in the shade) but worth it for the food!

yItAaPLFOks5KW4gh7l6JQ.text: Been here to many times to count and have never been disappointed amazing food great staff and pro 2a what more can I ask for.

AAWYDiccNbsmNCSijPqFag.text: Really great Philly Sandwich for a great price! I love the #1cheese wiz with the extra onions. It's also great that they are open 24hrs a day. The crew really seems to work hard cause it sure does look hot in there but no matter the product speaks for itself. Fantastic!!!

GLmbxN1rplMr4H4FpMshgQ.text: I've been eating too pops cheesesteaks for over 20 years it's always been a really good cheesesteak place but recently I visit them after not visiting them for over 3 1/2 years and got a disgusting cheese steak  This was absolutely the worst cheesesteak I've ever ate in my life I saw a box of steakumms  Wich is fake meat... absolutely disgusting!!!!!!!!!!  If you want a salty and nasty cheesesteak that will leave you with a heartburn for over 48 hours then this is the cheesesteak

PIaBHYR7R1rpyn3ZMUnPbg.text: I've enjoyed coming to Pops for years. I ordered the cheez wiz sandwich which I usually get, and it was great as always. My main concern was the False advertisement. The cheez wiz is now $10.99, which I personally think is pushing it. Regardless of that, it was originally $9.99 and that's what it still says on their menu. That definitely needs to be updated. Aside from that, my experience here is always great.

EdghUIsraOKx8D0VsIj0hA.text: It doesn't look like much but the sandwiches are legit. You go to one window, order by number and if you want onions or not. You can watch your masterpiece sandwich being made. Its ooey gooey cheesy goodness

2_ECB9xs1zrL66vr-zS5MA.text: Wiz Wit. Nuff said.   I really like pops. The meat is always flavorful and plentiful. The bread is always soft and  $10 bucks is good for me considering the size of the sandwich. Wifey and I often share one.   I usually ask the man on the grill to top off the wiz and he always says the same thing with a smile, "messy but delicous".   Indeed sir.

IwNoi0fcj0T17AQzhjvvJA.text: Love this place. Im a bit weird when it comes to marinara sauce, but I gotthe pizza Philly cheese stake w/o the sauce and it was bomb. There was a bit of a wait but totally wotth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9i7JE8mHpJkNMwv3pOU7Rg.text: Used to love Pop's.   I frequent the place regularly and have for years (I posted a pic of me being the Duke just to prove. The last two times I've been in though, they have a new young grill man who cannot handle a big order. Worse than that, he doesn't seem very willing to fix your order when you are literally watching him screw it up.   He is completely incompetent and has left me Not wanting to support this business any longer. I'll remember how good the steaks used to be and how much I used to love it. That's the reason I didn't give it one star.   Goodbye Pop's.

lSB7eecxjQ68EQTUNA1VCA.text: Best philly steak sandwich so far I ever had in Vegas. Always perfect every time I have craving for a philly steak sandwich .

HKQd_8oavC0VpPlo-r9i4w.text: If it's good enough for Chumlee, it's good enough for me. Amazing cheesesteaks and super cool vibe.   We ordered a cheesesteak with provolone and onions and the jalapeno poppers. Couldn't gather up the courage to go full blown cheese wiz yet, but there's always next time. The cheesesteak was outstanding. Amazing flavor, packed with layers of meat. Provolone oozing off the sandwich. Give me anything with cheese that oozes and I'll dive in, face first. Jalapeno poppers were good too! Not super spicy, but hits the spot.   They make every sandwich to order, and take one order at a time at the window, so the wait can get long, but it is so worth it!   Love the vibe of this place. All outdoor covered patio seating. Retro bar seats. And a pretty sick mural of Benjamin Franklin holding a perfect cheesesteak. If you are down with a dive, check this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gimme dat cheesesteak.
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Close up, onions and provolone.
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jalapeño poppers, ranch, and a cheesesteak. Top that.

QOLMSK0SuehFexoQuiZgIg.text: I must have passed this place so many times before i actually had the chance to come in.   This place is delicious, we ordered:   philly steak sandwich with cheese, mushroom and onions, onion rings and fries. Everything was delicious. I will be back and want to try pastrami as well as other sides. I could not be happier with a greasy sandwich.   It can be hangover food, it can be guilty pleasure or it can be dinner but either way you are not missing out.   PS they have breakfast on their menu and IT IS SERVED ALL DAY

XD9X6YBbx8phyV6RwcuC7Q.text: Probably the best place in Vegas for cheese steak. Definately better than steakout which claim to be the original. Another nice thing about pops is they give a military discount.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

w61xVOqa5LynY1NakhW1lw.text: Gotta love Pops! After many years still the standard for Philly steaks in Las Vegas... Don't forget to also try the chicken sandwiches, pastrami sandwiches and chili-cheese too - wash it down with a bottle of Coke! Always fun to order up fresh hot sandwiches, chat with the cook and other customers in line. Place was busy for lunch as usual, we sat outside and enjoyed the buzz as people driving by got jealous looking at our food and smelling the aroma of that steak!

nTLM3g8G6NCufb4mOEq8mA.text: Sadly....I must give them only 2 stars. :( after reading some of the reviews....I am guessing that they used to be better then they are now.   I got the okra.... And it was really really slimy inside. Yes I know it's okra... But when they are fried well... The sliminess goes away and sadly this was not the case for them.  So sad as I love love me some fried okra. Flavor (2/5)  I also got the fries and they were just fries. Not really crispy.... Kinda sad soggy fries. My bf liked the fact that they gave ranch with it.... But eh... Flavor (2/5)....I would've given it 1 star but since my bf loved the ranch I gave then another star for the ranch. :/  For the main course I got the #6... The Philly with mushrooms and cheese.... OK... The bread was freaking awesome! Perfect chew and softness... Just perfect. BUT the meat... Mushrooms and onions were really really under seasoned. It was very blah. I mean the Philly cheese steak at subway tasted better then this. :( very disappointing since this is what they are known for. (2/5)... And that is being generous.   Service was OK... Nothing mind blowing....(2/5)  Ambiance was.... It's a mom and pop type store.... So it was kind of ghetto.... Without the cutesy stuff that u normally see in a mom and pop... And no bathroom at all either (1/5)  Will I be returning.... Most likely no.... One it is too far and for the price there are other things that I would rather eat.  The prices for the sandwiches ranged from $10 and up and the Specialty sides were $4.... And as nothing that I had made me want to have another bite....I don't think I'll be returning. :(

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big chunk of onion found in my sandwich.... Too much for my taste buds....:(
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #6... Very bland...:(  (2/5)
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #4....(4/5) per the bf...

DyRWTEGxKUsiXG0RGY9Uyg.text: I have a thing for cheez whiz...  So I occasionally crave this place and I always order a Philly steak sandwich with magical cheez whiz, grilled onions and mushrooms. Once I have it, I'm good for months.   The food is always already precooked and I can understand that for busier rush times but that doesn't make sense when you show up here around 2 or 3 in the morning. The location is also a little scary being on a busy corner in a shady area and there's no indoor seating.   With all that said I love the super thinly sliced steak and this place has been around since 2002 with an old school vibe operating out of a building that was built in the 60's. Its open 24/7 and has a drive thru. It's definitely not like the stuff from Philly but it's still pretty good and ultra messy which is how it should be.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Messy, as it should be :)

5jPYwndOkePZv3oGrJ3r7A.text: Not what I expected from a Philly steak sandwich. The meet was flavorless and the bread was completely soggy from all the excess water release from the beef. I know condiments are available to customers, but to add them after the meat is cooked defeats the purpose of buying what i consider, is a finished dish

maS6977bn2AlIe_KCF9H0Q.text: YO. This place is super plug. The sandwiches are about $9-$10 a piece but you get what you pay for. The sandwiches are thick and full. The meat is super juicy and the melted cheese is to die for. We got a side of fried mushrooms & fried green beans. AMAZING.  There's good enough seating, and there's a cool bench to the side that you can sit on.  The customer service was amazing as well. I'd give them 10 stars for service if I could.   Food 10/10 Ambiance 10/10 Service 12/10  Highly recommend!

SEJPLcw7KLn7V3QqvnnJEA.text: I wanted to like this place. In fact, I wanted to make Pop's a regular spot of mine that I frequently return to, but it's going to be more like once a month type visit. My cheesesteak was just okay and I wasn't really blown away by it. The meat tasted fresh and had a good amount of grilled veggies, but I think what upset me the most was the top and bottom of the bread was soggy. It was like eating a sloppy mess. The cheese fries weren't anything spectacular either. Pop's is really one of those places you don't get a desire to eat unless you feel like pigging out or need to eliminate a crave.
