M2cz6G_5U2nXP1Xe-_Ihlw.text: Who doesn't love a Vegas classic. I don't know what I can add here that others haven't but a 24hr walk up with a huge, delicious, cheap menu and speedy service... Of course 5 stars!

SfYK48sFjSDv2nKtQGy4bQ.text: Came here as I had a taste for a Philly cheesesteak.  I was in the area as I had just left the New York New York Hotel. I was there with my nephew and sons so it was a total of 5 of us. We ordered various cheesesteaks , fries and drinks. When I saw the cook put the frozen meat on the grill I knew the taste would be compromised, but I was hungry and we were already there.  Once we got our food, I will admit the sandwiches were hot but the rest left a lot to be desired. The mushrooms were from the can , the meat was not brown but at all, the grease needed to be changed for the fries as they were dark brown, the onion rings were ok . I was very disappointed because I had heard great things about this place. Wouldn't come back. I will stick with Straight out of Philly over this place. Sorry no photos

P65YxsJaEBhr6J6MJq5ePw.text: Not my first time here but me and my son absolutely love this place if you could see how his face lights up when I say.  Son throw some clothes on we going to Pop's talk about some pep in his step.  1 of the few places that will get him of that gaming system quick fast.   The staff here is great and we love the fact that everything is cooked to order.  So just know if it's busy don't expect your food in 5 mins.  Which is not a problem with me we prefer hot and fresh food.  Just a heads up!    There is no indoor seating so please come out on a good nice day or night if you want to eat at the establishment.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili cheese Philly.  So that&#39;s where they hide all the gooey goodness
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili cheese Philly

F-yx3T51zcKzsDzTL-JvnQ.text: Love, love, love this place.  It is on a corner, old building, seems divey.  Steve is the one who takes your orders. He is cool.  Nice guy, with a good attitude.    I ordered the beef steak with onions, provolone and whiz.  It was super delicious, I am in love.  We also had the chili cheese fries, whiz fries and a beef steak with peppers and onions.  We also ordered the hot wings and they were very good, but very HOT. Next time, I will go with mild.   I highly recommend the food!  This is also a great spot to stop by on your way home and grab an order to go.    I can't wait to go back and have another cheesesteak and try a hoagie.

MYjFOXyLa--dSIIIR_zTcg.text: A staple in town for as long as I have been here 2001. As close to Philly as your gonna get here in the desert. Provolone or the Philly cheese sauce chicken or beef real good Philly. Only negative is bread is ok and only outdoor seating.

5eVxd5IFMuQXn2ewNEFEIg.text: I'm always apprehensive to try a cheesesteak outside of the Greater Philadelphia area, but they had all the right ingredients, and I had a hankering for a cheesesteak.    Cheesesteak was pretty good!  Whiz with onion is the only way to order and I believe it was served on an Amoroso's roll too!  Good proportion of chopped steak to whiz and the onions were sized perfectly to the gooey mix.  My only mild complaint is that there was an odd seasoning on the steak... soy sauce, magi or something that threw off the steak a bit... not sure what it was... not bad, but it was unexpected.  Such a simple sandwich that's difficult to get right...  In Vegas, Pop's probably does it best.

gTjzm8ezaLPSJr-ksjKmKw.text: Solid 3 1/2 stars!  I suppose Pop's is a bit of an institution here in LV, probably one of the oldest places here where you can get a Philly cheese steak.  Hard to believe that I work less than 5 minutes away from here!  I can now come here whenever I want for some steak!  I probably would have given a 4 star if I had just stuck with their mantra...any of their famous steak sandwiches.  Possibly some fries.  We kinda did a detour by ordering things you wouldn't ordinarily get at a Philly cheese steak place so that took it down a notch.  Came here on a late night (probably the best times for one of these) and wouldn't you know, Pop's was hoppin'.  Parking lot was full!  We had no problem waiting in line though, goes pretty quick.  Wifey and I ordered:  *#4 - Provolone Cheese Steak ($9.99) *#35 - Pork Bar-B-Que ($9.99) *Fried Okra ($3.95)  But of course, best thing we had was the Provolone Cheese Steak!  Roll was light but still fresh tasting, there was a lot of meat & cheese in this sucker!  Oiliness galore!  Just like it probably should be.  Fat = FLAVOR!  Meat was seasoned well and was the focus of the sandwich.  Basically meat, cheese, bread.  Pretty damn delicious cheese steak.  Took away a star though for the rest of our order.  The Pork Bar-B-Que sandwich they said is an award winner but I just didn't like it that much.  The pork was overly stringy, but the sauce?  It was wayyyyy too sweet!  Like almost sickly sweet!  I was looking for more tang or bite to the sauce.  But the sweet was just too overpowering.  Really not on my want list.  The fried okra was OK, it was just really fried okra.  A little bland but fried fresh, could have used a bit more seasoning.  Plus it didn't really go well with our sandwiches so it was kind of forgettable.  Prices are fairly reasonable, but man paying nearly $10 for a sandwich gets to me for some reason - I guess it's because we have so much cheap food in town.  I mean come on, I can go downtown to get a prime rib dinner with sides, salad bar & dessert for the same price!  But thankfully Pop's cheese steak is tasty.  I'll be a regular at Pop's especially during my lunch days at work.  But I'll just go for a steak sandwich from now on!  #sweetmeat

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YGr8HvgEN1T_DeQCXHB3Zg.text: Excellent Philly cheesesteak!! They have lots of options. If I could change anything, it would be the dining place; it's open and always windy.

VJqmMnmbeIHQNbgnZx08Iw.text: Best Cheesesteak sandwiches in Vegas. You don't want to miss this local haunt that is only a few miles from the Strip. Note they have a covered patio but no inside sit down facility.

vF0SnBiRR2dHSPEXDtjM9A.text: Listen, four stars because at 1am in Vegas this is the only place which serves one of the most authentic Philly cheese steaks around.   It's Nevada folks, not Pennsylvania.   Perhaps deserves a 3 star rating.  Keep in mind it was at 1am! Open 24 hours! They had me at hot pretzel, I add mustard. Yes, mustard that's how it's done in PA.  Try it, but beware...you will be addicted.  Now, it's a walk up with handful of outside tables  and nothing special.  Trust me in that, please scroll through my pictures and read those signs :) Sweet potato fries, tasty.  Fried green beans, always hits the spot. Now, I was with a friend and we shared. Except the hot pretzel.  Let me be frank and honest, that hot pretzel was my dessert.  My cheesesteak consisted of provolone and mushrooms. I even always order that on a burger. Another time I was previously here I had capacola, salami and cheese.  The capacola was a bit tough and I was slightly disappointed. I Never ordered that again.  Guess what made up for it- the hot pretzel ha;) The Italian ices here are good.  Again though, what's my usual dessert... spot  But, if a hot pretzel is not your dessert choice.  Please order the cheesecake, can't beat it.  It's sweet potato maple and it may sound different.  Yes, it is different in an amazing way!

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheer whiz...

eSXFerZ45QUINkKffCFZ-w.text: Not good, first bite tastes good and gives you hope but as you keep going you begin to realize how basic, bland, and extremely SALTY the food is. It's so salty you just taste the salt at one point and it stays in your mouth for so long after you're finished. The fries tasted old and dry. Leaves your stomach hurting afterwards. Sorry, but don't think I'll ever come back.

k1QURTf0Qp2R87MDH-fzNw.text: My go-to-place for a cheesesteak sandwich. A #6 with mushrooms and onions $10. Also some of the best chicken wings around. 10 wings for $8. No sauce needed. A True hole-in-the-wall joint.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

T4RJ5MhEVHp6Ggo98cHPLg.text: As always this place never fails!!!! The food here is amazing and you get a lot for what you pay. The workers are really nice and super friendly. As always, I'll be back!

ub2YFJ6pwBA0AvjcU_obvg.text: My roommate and I came late night around 10pm and we got the number #32 and some regular fries. The fries were the only thing that was good. The philly steak was so bland and plain. No flavor no nothing so blah. No good but not bad. The ranch was good with the fries but that's about it. The tables were dirty and it was fully staffed. Disappointed with the food tho.

3udCGNZkXROB-X2cyTGO4w.text: Stopped for lunch while leaving Las Vegas,  North on HIghway 95.  We each had the #32, a cheesesteak with peppers, onions & mushrooms. The cheesesteak was one of the best I had in a long time.   Pop's gets the 5th star for having Cheese-Wiz & the thin beef steaks found in most East Coast shops. Fries were also good. Just crispy enough & not greasy.  We will definitely stop again the next time in Vegas.

no4cYKab22_pysW7p2gwaQ.text: Wow....when i took my new jersey girlfriend i was hoping for a taste of home for her. I had eaten here years ago and it was amazing. I dont want to waste alot of time complaining. Needless to say if u have to ask where the cheese is on ur cheese steak sandwich (which was pricey for what u get)? Prolly not going to b an impressive meal. $30.00 later and we felt let down by this vegas icon.

1_WL4i9rdz_A_GfiIZrZvQ.text: Been in Vegas since '94 have driven past many times and always meant to stop by. Well, curiosity definitely killed the cat. I can't really begin to describe the poor tasting cheesesteak I had. I'm pretty sure the actual steak was steakumms or some other byproduct beef, there was som weird pink compressed square of "meat" on the grill. Couldn't finish it and tossed it in the garbage. Pretty disappointed

BxJ2MNiZGLL4emh_EAOb5g.text: This place is better than Jersey... Best steak I've had on the west coast period!!! Yum yum yum!!!

OMmp9zPI9aEjqRluHTdDvA.text: This spot is the business! The meat to bread ratio is perfect! I highly recommend this place plus it's open 24 hours! The hidden gem for dessert is the Oreo churros! Those things are fire too! Just remember if you order a philly cheese it's gonna come with grilled onions unless you tell them no! I like grilled onions so I wasn't trippin! Can't wait to come back into town to try the other sandwiches! Definitely got a customer for life!

WsC8COi9m8avwfcx-NNs4Q.text: The best cheesesteaks hands down!  The rolls are always fresh and the steak is plentiful and tender.  I love a sandwich with provolone and my husband likes his smothered in the Whiz!   The sides are also wonderful. Our favorites are the fried green beans (the ranch is stellar), wings and the fries.  Not much better than unwrapping a hot, cheesy Pop's philly steak sandwich. Great, now I'm hungry!

C5D_58KNSKUuutmPeQR1jg.text: omg the really real cheesesteaks. I got cheeze whiz steak. partner got cheese whiz with green bell, sweet, and hot peppers. both were huge and so delicious. very soft and steamy roll was not greasy, though we don't mind grease. saw another customer order the pork. must try that next time. if you're craving a killer Philly cheesesteak you must try this place.

CKZWAU40on1VIeaR3IgEFw.text: The food here are always great and the service is awesome. I love the Philly cheese steak and the deep fried banana. My kids love coming here and enjoys the layout of the place.

KKYzKpQFtEwp5vc_tpi-Zg.text: Came here around 5:45 and it was steadily busy. We ordered a #6 mushroom cheesesteak with cheese whiz and sweet potato fries. They were getting a bit busy and overwhelmed so customer service was okay. Food came out hot and fast! It was a fine experience, nothing crazy.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside seating
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wall mural

1v_lxLQMbAHnsHpwfMGXbg.text: First off its EXPENSIVE!   The man making the sandwiches gave me a funny look when I asked for JUST turkey cheese and bacon. I don't like condiments and I don't like vegetables. But he hooked me up on the #36. It was delicious, but was. It worth $12.00??? UM, NO!  Adding bacon costs $2.00. Ridiculous.  This place also advertises bananas foster. I was expecting some deep fried banana caramel goodness but...it tasted like deep fried cheesecake bites...in fact I know it was. Somebody has to fix that, either fix the menu or fix the product ordering.  It's open 24 hours but I assume if you go here at 3 AM you are drunk...and this is pretty pricey for "drunk food".  My life partner and I shelled out almost $32.00 for two hoagies, two drinks, fries and fried cheesecake AKA BANANA FOSTER bites.  We agreed if the hoagies were $7.99 instead of $9.99 (not including extras) the pricing would be spot on.

l8KR2Sg5Zjh3NaE5FpTAAA.text: Huge POPS fan! I highly suggest checking this place out. Never had anything that wasn't good. Bring your appetites and plan on a trip to the gym to burn off those calories. BTW... go with the Cheez Wiz for the real deal Philly!

zevY1dOxmLG7CRj16aNDPA.text: I went on Saturday and got the Mushroom and cheese philly. It tasted great with melted provolone cheese melting through the meat. I am really happy it's opened 24 hours so if you are in the mood for something other than fast food late at night this is a place to stop by, it's located across from Arizona Charlie's on the West of Vegas.

AuoqET8XkOl0QN0T7Ivs4g.text: Drive past here all the time, figured I'd give it a try.  I ordered a regular cheese steak with provolone cheese, onions, peppers, mushrooms...was delicious and quick.

iOz9V6VFn4LEUMJthz3gjw.text: Pop's puts out a good cheesesteak sandwich. The bread is good and holds up the fillings well. I am signed up on their email list so I get coupons from time to time. I had a coupon for free whiz fries and my wife likes to eat those as a meal so we headed out to Pop's for dinner. It was a nice evening and plenty of people were eating outside at the tables on their patio. There were about 5 people in line too but it moves pretty quick. I ordered a Whiz w/ onions and extra cheese. The sandwich with free whiz fries was almost ten bucks, not bad. My sandwich was  good but some of the meat was cooked a tad too long. The whiz fries were good as always.   There is no place to eat inside here... Just a walk up window and the tables and chairs on the patio and no drive thru. I kind of like it like that.  Open 24 hrs.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qsUat7lYZS_Evc3vtDzF0A.text: So to be warned, it'll never beat Geno's or Pat's. People from Philly know what I mean so if you have that expectation you'll be disappointed. That being said, these are hands down the best Philly's in Vegas. Juicy, dripping with Whiz, and grilled right in front of you. Literally can't get anything better anywhere in town

5fgo-DS4Xfqsyi_gqu4auQ.text: I've been in Vegas for almost two years, and though I've driven by here a few times, I never stopped until tonight. Let me tell you, I'm a bit disappointed in myself, because this place is delicious, and I just cheated myself out of two years of fantastic sandwiches! The number 32 with onions and American cheese is savory and delicious, and I can't wait to visit again soon!

k1fb3y63EYud1RzBdUpfUw.text: After standing in line for 15 min. on a really busy street corner that was so loud you could not have a conversation or talk on a phone we ordered 2 # 4's steak with provolone and 2 sodas  32.00 $  The sandwiches came up and I un wrapped mine excitedely only to find that the minescule amount of cheese had almost completely stuck permanently to the paper rapper .So no cheese on the steak , the alleged steak was DRYand flavorless.Where was the fat? the roll was ok . My orange Fanta was sublime. but really 32.00 bucks!

6pE4uQ2mTUws_zeUWT3iNQ.text: Love this place.. I drive a distance just to come here...it is well worth it!! Great place !!

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Nu8oQasGEWNGP7T6dMahlw.text: The best food in Vegas....this was my first time here and didn't know how to order so asked the cook to help he was more then happy to help....that was so sweet ... graet customer service...need a spot to hit go here there on fire.....

57rVOa1rdSoZoGCXYOXRDQ.text: While there is no ambiance to speak of except eating outdoors in the heat, a mister is present, and the food is really tasty.  Changing it up a bit, instead of my usual Philly Cheesesteak Sandwich, this time I opted for a Hot Pastrami Sandwich instead, and was not disappointed.  While not heaping with meat, the roll was filled enough; smeared yellow mustard on the roll gave off just enough tang to the moist, lean pastrami embedded along with it; and the overall effect with a side of Fries was quite satisfying.  I will most certainly be back!

T2dyueu8ZNMUVqjWaIrJ5w.text: Seriously...never mind the humble appearance.  This is as good as it gets.  The ordering reminds me of the old fashioned diners/cafes and the food is dyn-o-mite!  I've never lived in Philly, but my friends that have tell me this is the real deal place.  The sandwiches always come piping hot because they are made to order. Nothing sits around.  That makes for a bit of a wait when picking up, but hey...good things come to those who wait.  I just read that Pops now delivers????  I'm gonna be a regular on their route!  Whether you are looking for a mid-day fantastic lunch or stopping by after a night out, you will never be disappointed!

pSR2sJUdy9Ip2B0CuVWhzg.text: If you like Philly Steak this is the place to go. Food is good service is ok a little slow at times but its not bad.

mwCxxv-4CX9EVIsnDQ6v0Q.text: I've been coming here for years and despite the amazing food and service, I haven't had a chance to write a review, so here's the amazingness in a nutshell:   Pop's may look like it's in the wrong area, but what it lacks in appearance, it more than makes up for with quality and service. The food is absolutely ADDICTING, service is quick and friendly, and they've never ever gotten my order incorrect!   I recommend this place to people all the time and the verdict is always the same: a new favorite.   On another note, this place is probably the only decent 24 hour fast food joint in all of Vegas.

HMBrbl5lmtXLo1x0h5BFhg.text: Got myself a number 2 with some cheese fries. The food was good.   Pro- plenty of meat, good food, lots of selection in menu, customer service was good, place looked clean.   Con- and I believe everyone that has posted a review would agree, price just doesn't add up.    It is "expensive" for this type of location, and food, but ultimately it's good so I couldn't really complain much.   I would definitely recommend you give it a try.

FQkxAgIV-lRE9kN8X917aA.text: First time here in almost 10 years. Sammiches are still huge and easily shared by two. Freshly cooked fries are good but most folks seem to go for the sweet potato variety.   Fall is the perfect time to drop by and sit outside. But grabbing to go is good as well. Be sure to grab extra napkins!

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. With bacon, peppers, onions, tomatoes and lettuce
Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jccG3AOqolSpWAwFExSDlw.text: They have good food always busy.  It's open 24/7 so you can stop by anytime. The service is soso but food makes up for it.

O-fJzDezt82macEEuUVJ7Q.text: I think I could have had a better philly sandwich at Capriotti's, a place that isn't even known for their philly sandwiches.   While I do like fast service, getting served already cooked meat, onions, and mushrooms swimming in meat juice and reheated on the grill isn't what I was hoping for. Three distinct flavors that should all be tasted in a good philly, and everything tasted like the meat juice. I asked for American cheese and I think I was given provolone, on account that it was especially stringy for whatever reason. There was so much bread in comparison to the meat, onion, and mushrooms that was in the sandwich.   The frier was broke or being cleaned, so I couldn't get any fries or other side items to go with my sandwich.  I always hear positive praise for this place, but for all the years I have occasionally bought food here, I have yet to have a good meal here that would make me understand the hype.

JSYdx_GrDXE7FPKjXWgA0w.text: Visited them for the first time since we were close by,  they were amazing.  My girlfriend & I both got #4's which were Philly Steaks with provolone. We added extra cheese,  mushrooms & onions & themn got a drink wich came out to around $24. Definitely worth it,  service was very quick & the sandwiches were hot,  fresh & overflowing with meat.  Try them if you're in Vegas!

QqyY3yPXCwYnUx5sGoBAbw.text: The food is good I've been going to this since 1992 . I went last night around 10pm I ordered a #6 very good folks. The guy taking the money and giving you your food was very rude . He was yelling for people to come get their food and slamming it down on the counter.  If you pay with credit card  or debit,  he demanded a tip... saying "so how much can I take for my tip" His hands was dirty and rough looking as if he just worked on a car.. I didn't catch his name but if you go you will know who I'm speaking of..

aO855GgPmvpLO6tN7VVAlA.text: I love Pops!   I'm from the East Coast (Baltimore) and Pops has the best cheese steaks I've had on the West Coast. I always get the #32 with Swiss cheese and it's always on point.  I also thank them for respecting that my husband & I are veterans by always giving me the Military discount.  The people leaving bad reviews are obviously not cheese steak connoisseurs.  You can't beat the price for all the meat you get and it's always hot, fresh and delicious.

PjMY8JnMe4WCm0pYV6deUA.text: This was the worst philly cheese steak I ever had as soon as I discovered a metal bag tie inside the meat half way through eating the sandwich luckily I could spit it out before I started chocking on it and would have had to go to the hospital. This is not what I expected for an 11.99 plus tax sandwich. See attached picture

iMBHE9-XgA75MNvwOa_Y2g.text: Came here on a recent trip to Las Vegas based on a recommendation. I thought it was a bit pricey especially since the fries are almost $4 for a small portion.   The cheesteak was pretty good. but I don't have much to compare it to being that I am an LA native, and I have never been to Philly :(   My bf did have to add a little salt to the steak meat, he said it needed more seasoning *shrugs*  Would I return to Pops when I visit Vegas again? Yes, I would. I want to try the green bean fries.

DP0LnJoUPnm0cgBXFUOSlA.text: Best philly cheese steaks in Vegas! They ship their rolls from Philadelphia and they offer cheese whiz. As an added bonus they have tasty cakes. It's almost as if you're in Philadelphia. I love this place.

xG_pQWT-GXyq1V4p1NlC4A.text: Well, this is an iconic Las Vegas eatery and as someone who appreciates anything left of Old Vegas I think it's important to preserve and advertise whoever is left.  Unfortunately, the last 2 times I've eaten here the food has been complete slop.  Granted, both times have been late night excursions, but being a 24 hour business that shouldn't make a difference.   Few weeks  back I grabbed an Italian sausage sandwich with peppers and it was an abomination.  The entire sandwich was drenched in something resembling marinara sauce but it had very little flavor and was so messy you couldn't even really call it a sandwich anymore.  Tonight, I got a philly (their claim to fame) and once again it was just complete slop.  The bread doesn't taste toasted, the meat has very little flavor, very few peppers and slimy canned mushrooms.  Worse, they just dump a ton of Cheez Whiz on it and expect that to make up for the utter lack of taste.  Pretty sure this will be my last time, but I will give them props for variety and business hours.  I hope they bring back some quality soon, because this stuff is like food you cobble together yourself out of the fridge when you come home from a night out drinking.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

b6uQqL_Jij3j8hPSTeWHrw.text: When I initially went I was not impressed, in fact I was very disappointed! But I decided to give them a second chance and now I see why they have great reviews!!! I will continue to go there and enjoy the great sandwiches and chili cheese fries...

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UIiAXtWvdwzyxwtOuxPGkw.text: GREAT FOOD, there Phillys are the best in town, local restaurant, not a chain one. Food is always hot, staff is super nice and its a great atmosphere to bring friends and visitors when in town. We visited here when we were here on a vacation and loved it, not that we are local we go here all the time.

7H7mQEX7QcC1B8_61HYtlQ.text: Not a real Philly Cheesesteak! Went there with high expectations because any place that claims to have Philly Cheesesteak better know how to make a Philly Cheesesteak.  Not here.  Being a native Pennsylvanian and growing up on REAL Philly Cheesesteaks, this was a big disappointment.  Meat was not cooked to order on the grill, instead, probably cooked the night before( or worse) , put in a big pot and then simply re-heated on the grill when orders placed.  This process allows meat to sit in its own juice making the bread extra soggy.  So soggy that you can't pick up the sandwich with your hands.  He gives you a fork to eat it.  WHAT??  The meat had absolutely no flavor, very bland and chewy.  There is a reason that people stand in line in Philly to get a real sandwich and they don't mind the long wait because they know it will be the real deal.  Pulling meat out of a pot is not acceptable to call yourself a Philly Cheesesteak.  For all those leaving good reviews, well, I guess if you haven't had a real one, you just don't know any better.

nrK4NLgoX8rqgRcmfR514A.text: Amazing philly cheese steaks. Great quality, people are nice, parking is easy, fun place to go to

2iZfLtpxlmZF7HlUd4XYWg.text: How could I have missed this place?  For $9-$10, you can get one utterly amazing cheesesteak.  I've tried chill cheese, barbecue, pizza, even fish cheesesteaks.  And somehow each one is just as amazing (though the chili cheese one is my personal favorite).  Their menu is to the point, but they have a lot of options within the cheesesteak and fry families.  Even their chips are good.  I see that they have Italian Ices as well, but I'm not even bothering with that until the weather warms up.  I've driven by this place so many times.  For YEARS now.  How could I not have explored this amazing place before?  I LOVE cheesesteaks!  It boggles my mind, is what it does!    But I'll put it this way: Now that I have found this place, I will make up for lost time.  I've already hit this place up several times in the last month.  Heck, I even hit it up on Christmas Day night after being over the whole turkey and ham thing.  24/7, they never close.  I could get a cheesesteak at 3:17 A.M. if I wanted to, and there's no force of man that could stop me.  Truly a marvel of modern invention, this place.  .....  And if you haven't gathered, I've quickly grown to love Pop's in the last month.  Wow.  Cheesesteak.

QZ2Aj2V_yLrF81ND9aUXGQ.text: Best Philly steak sandwiches ever! And the pastrami chili fries are hands down best fries I've ever had!

JMQwM6k5FpS7Xt3_mlPPeA.text: Sandwiches are good but the jalapeno poppers, i believe are frozen & the fried green beans are as well. Do not get those items off the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Don&#39;t get the jalapeno poppers or green beans. They&#39;re not freshly made they&#39;re frozen

vcNM19gWCKVO_bJ85HWSsg.text: So so good! Great service, outdoor seating, fresh ingredients! The pride Jose has in Pop's is inspiring!

vbd3SvqypKb9sj25BnjD0w.text: This place is a little pricey for my taste cause I like to go to cheap restaurants, but it is delicious. The first time I ate there I got a philly, sweet potato fries, a tasty cake, and a drink. I spent $20 just for myself.  I've been inebriated almost every time I've been there, but definitely worth trying trying at least once.

LvT8twJ5a0C2YLMY75vpuQ.text: Love this place!! Delicious food, quick and easy.  loved #9 and the onion rings were one of a kind!!

0NOnjwTDr1LTvpXl9UZpnA.text: Got a cheesesteak, this was so gross, I had to throw half away.  They have gone way down hill.  The meat was so disgusting, it had no taste and tasted like dog meat.  $10 for a steak sandwich is alot, but if it's good, I wouldn't mind.  You couldn't give this to me for free.  The only good part of it was the roll, (Amoroso), you can't go wrong.  I'll be making my own steak sandwiches with Amoroso rolls from now on. Born n Raised in Philly, I know my shit when it comes to steak sandwiches and this place should be closed down.  Will never go back.

6T8qJcZ6gp_kuuqQJX5h7g.text: Not bad at all. I love the cheese steaks from my favorite place in Rhode Island, but I will settle for Pop's. They did a great job seasoning the meat. Some places forget to season the meat. It's so good. Perfect amount of meat and cheese. The bread...absolutely yummy. I'll be coming back when I get a craving.

photos.caption: Photo of Pops Philly Steaks - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #5 with Mushrooms.

l_tFyI7axrUCp86kdMuLHg.text: If you want a good (and I mean GREAT) cheesesteak in Vegas, pass up Pops and land yourself at one of the many Capriotti's. I've had a few Cap's sammies ($8 medium cheesesteaks with mushrooms and peppers) - amazing. Drove by Pop's mid-Saturday. Was starving so decided to try it out. $10 later, I was bummed. The shrooms were canned and tasted like it. Yuk. The meat was dry. I had the provelone on top, still not a moist sammy. Wished it had been a Capriotti's. One star for being 24-hrs.

bbm7BBb-VcgwREEA4w5tjA.text: this was the most bland, tasteless philly I have ever had.  Soggy, nasty bell peppers. maybe weekends are fine, but don't do it on a week night !

w3NCIpsVZLr_nLbypXmxOw.text: This place is great, very filling and tastes good.  I get the bellpepper Philly with onions and fries. Can't beat it. Btw you gotta get some BBQ for your fries. You keep making delicious sandwiches, and ill keep coming.

Afb-HDijz_cI6lUHnnIyiw.text: I love the Cheese Steaks and Cheese Fries at Pop's. You can also get Birch Beer here which is very tough to find in Las Vegas.  The best part about this place is that it's open 24/7 . This place is 'Awesome'!

jzHewjjPxH_zsTJcFS7pbg.text: $14.00 for a cheesesteak and a soda. Gimme a break. The cheesesteak was a sloppy mess. Cheese wiz all over the place with oversized vegetables. Really? This is the first place I have been to in my whole life who has the ability to totally mess up a cheesesteak. If you've ever been to Philly and had a real cheesesteak from Geno's you would never ever try anything like this. You can go get a decent meal at olive garden for $14 bucks. And the sad part about it was it wasn't the price it was just a sloppy nasty cheesesteak with nothing going for it not the meat, not the vegetables and not the roll. Don't waste your time.

OPaLwN-rYQLJ_Uq56jCqoA.text: The steaks were hot fresh and juicy. Your choice of cheese onions peppers and hot sauce. Next time I am trying the pork grinder. Good eating!

VvsRaZxn6L8J2-kHN_KjFg.text: Ok.. so I'm not so sure about the cheese whiz... but I know I'm a huge fan of the Philly with the provolone cheese(it was not only a huge sandwich but it had tons of meat and cheese). YUM! Never been to Philly... but I'm assuming this place is the real deal.. everything is fresh and cooked right in front of you. It's got an old A&W(drive-up) feel and I love that! O and the fries... salty goodness!!

FulxRO9ZSh6irRjI-ttRhg.text: this place is a total hole in the wall. the parking lot is small and if you don't take it to go, you have to sit outside to eat. when you walk up to order, there's a guy that's making the cheese steaks as you order... we ordered a regular cheese steak with peppers, onions and mushrooms... when we got our food, we sat down and took my first bite.... YUM! it was pretty darn good....slightly bland but still definitely worth trying. next time i go to vegas, i'd go again.  if you can't make it to their location, i noticed they do have a food truck too.

0LmEHXXPqO8WuTa3bYxKLw.text: this place has good food but horrible service, they do not write down the order, they do no repeat your order to make sure it is correct.  they make you wait in the heat till they are done with what they are doing. there very expensive for being fast food - they charge you for everything, they have no "meals" but they make you purchase the fries when you didn't ask for it...not fair that is why the place is empty, people will try it once and never go back!!!

PouvRAyMTh0UExM98RmItg.text: My husband had gone to Pop's quite a few times when he was working near there and has always raved about Pop's. He kept telling me it's the best steak subs, sausage subs and meatball subs he's had since we lived in Pennsyvania.  He finally took me there just to prove to me that he wasn't just blowing smoke.  Well, let me tell you! He wasn't being totally honest with me. Pop's is even better than our old haunt in PA!  I had the Cheese steak with onions, peppers, provalone and marinara.  What a treat!  There was so much stuffed into this sandwich, I couldn't eat it all in one sitting!  The flavor was amazing. The grill master was on point.  He must have had 10 different sandwiches going on and never messed up one order!  Kudo's to you, Grill Meister!  They were all very friendly and never rushed us or got irritated when I decided to change what was on my Cheese steak (sorry guys).  I try to get by there at least once a month to have a different sandwich everytime I go (they've got so many). Oh, and did I tell you about the sides? What a selection!  Any way, you have got to check them out!  And don't forget to sign up for there special coupons to be sent to your email.  Yo won't regret going there for a great Philly Steak or whatever you are hankerin' for.

OaQ9fiRVc0LFqaPHpuOZ7g.text: I've been here once.  It's a very good sandwich, but a little too much meat.  The seating options there are very limited and can get very crowded at lunchtime.  I will return, but not during busy time of day.

wvgzMAdkhoIhlerIibh6Xg.text: I really don't like cheese steaks in general, but this little hole in the wall (or A-frame off the strip) had unusually good food. I had a 1/2 steak CS with peppers, swiss cheese, onions and mushrooms. It was all very tasty, tasted pretty fresh and was made to order. The service was very friendly. Be sure to ask for the hot sauce!

gNaI-aEngVQNnSPPtTCNMQ.text: This place is the real deal. Makes me want to move to Las Vegas. Nothing in Southern California comes close. If your visiting Las Vegas make the drive to this place it will safisfy your cravings for cheesesteaks.

G9tQONU7rtUPN81GmHrF5Q.text: This place is not what it's cracked up to what it USED to be. The sandwiches (now) lack flavor and they charge an arm and a leg. I paid $18 for 2. The mushrooms are gross - straight from the can. I used to love this place, and would make my way to get there. Totally disappointed. Don't waste your time. One star because they're fast - go figure.

R6MhYH8RgtKfTUk39JPPiw.text: Pop's Philly Steaks makes the best cheesesteak sandwich I have ever had. I love the meat. I love the cheese whiz. I love the bread. I love the grilled onions. SOOO YUMMY!!! If you are ever in town, you definitely have to stop by. I didn't give it 5 stars because it's outdoors so it's kind of inconvenient on a windy day and the sides are good, but not amazing. Despite those things, I'll be back to try other sandwiches anyways!!!

zgPapwQ3MzlagKEFkTckbg.text: Just OK.Use to be much better.Philly steak is unseasoned, however  I do like the pastrami fries. Over priced for not being one of the best tasting philly steak joints.

8wTS3A0vuiN8fbPwMeFaEg.text: im born n raised in vegas, had a few different philly steak places out here and pops by far is tha best ive had. a lil pricy but when its prepared right, when the meat outweighs tha bun, tha flavors n juices of the marinated steak drench out from each bite, then tha price is worth it!!! 24 hrs, one of tha only spots in vegas that doesnt have a drive thru, its pretty classic. i always get tha chili cheese steak sandwich, hella good!!!

lLa-F3Ims6LpfDplFR--Ng.text: an outdoor eatery-one of a kind. this place is great. fresh made philly cheesesteaks and pastrami grinders. fresh bread from philly. chili cheese fries. get whiz with your philly to make it authentic. this place is fast,friendly & super good food. plus it's cheap!!!! ok prices have went up recently

3xI4Iox0uDw91n47bsDAAA.text: This is the best place to go for a cheesesteak in Las Vegas.

IBXZ6IRoZrBRaFopPcf31g.text: Pops make a good philly cheesteak but it would be alot better if he did not talk as much.  Pops doesnt look that innocent.  He looks like he been in a prison cell before.
